De esta manera su trabajo lo separa por horarios, durante la mañana, tarde y noche, que son los tiempos en que entran y salen de estudiar los alumnos. Tiene cuatro años en esta actividad y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola, además le gusta mucho éste trabajo ya que tiene tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos, sin emabrgo le parece muy agotador tener que caminar de un colegio a otro. Espera mas adelante, poner un negocio en su casa que le permita estar ahí generando ingresos para su hogar sin tener que dejarlo tan seguido. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más golosinas para su venta, además algunos ingredientes, insumos y materiales para empezara vender comida en su casa.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old.  She is a cheerful and very dynamic woman who really enjoys working.  She finds a way of earning a living in everything she does.  María is married and has six children.  They live together in their own home where they share family harmony and good habits.

María's business is selling candies as an itinerant street vendor.  Every day she sets herself up outside schools where her small customers seek her out to buy her products.  She carries out her work at different times of the day (mornings, afternoons and evenings) as these are the times that the students go to school and come home from school.  María has been in this line of work for four years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  She very much enjoys this work as it gives her time to care for her children.  However, it is very tiring having to walk from one school to another.  She hopes, in the future, to set up a business in her home which will allow her to be at home and make income for her household without having to go out all the time.

This will be María's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more candies to sell.  She will also buy some ingredients, supplies and materials so that she can start selling food from home.

loans.use: to buy more candies and also raw materials for making and selling food

loans.name: Moheir

texts.en:
Moheir, a 37-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and two siblings, is the only income provider of the family. He was able to open his own car repair shop in 1991, and now has 25 years of experience in a car mechanic's domain, with a base of many loyal customers asking for his services.

Moheir is now requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanical parts and materials. In the future, he plans to further expand his garage.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical parts and materials.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 25,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, potatoes and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Kibibi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Kibibi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo Adolfo tiene 26 años D. edad  vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con L. esposa y con L. hija D. tres años D. edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia D. los Ríos.

L. VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Gustavo se dedica a l a Agricultura las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, líquidos para matar L. maleza y poder mejorar el desmonte.

Con el crédito podrá obtener mejores beneficios. El sueño es poderse comprar una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo D. problema, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gustavo Adolfo, 26, lives in a common law relationship; he has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Luchando Juntos” communal bank is located in Recinto Zapotal Nuevo belonging to Ventanas Canton; most of the members carry out commercial activities.

Gustavo is a farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.  He requests the loan to buy supplies, weed killing liquids and to improve clearing his fields.

With help from the loan he will be able to obtain better benefits.  His dream is being able to buy a house.  He’s had no problems and in his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, weed killing liquids and to improve the clearning of the fields.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene veinte ocho años de edad, es  una señora humilde con ganas  trabajar y de triunfar en la vida.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas, manteles y mandiles.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Abel  con quien tiene  tres hijos  el motivo por el cual trabaja ya que desea  darle un mejor futuro.
Pidió el préstamo  para comprar más hilos, aros, ajugas, manta blanca y de color.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que  le ha dado  para seguir trabajando y tener  su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Margarita is 28 years old. She is a humble lady who is willing to work and succeed in life. She makes napkins, tablecloths and aprons. She is happily married to Abel, with whom she has three children. Her children are the reason why she works, since she wants to give them a better future. She requested the loan in order to purchase more thread, hoops, needles, and white and colored fabric. She thanks the Fundación for the support she has been given in order to keep on working and run her own business.

loans.use: to purchase thread, hoops, needles and fabric to embroider.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Margie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam se dedica  de artículos de piel como es  bolsas ,cinturones y carteras, ellas nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es la atención que le da a sus clientes.
Su mercancía la da en pagos quincenales  y también vende dulces y refrescos.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos el motivo de su inspiración para trabajar con mas gusto.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas mercancía: bolsas ,carteras y cinturones.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para segur trabajando.
texts.en:
Señora Miriam sells leather items such as bags, belts and wallets. She tells us that she most enjoys tending to her customers.
Her merchandise is paid for every two weeks, and she also sells candy and pop.
She has two children who are her motivation to work harder.
She requested this loan for the purchase of more merchandise: bags, wallets and belts.
She thanks the Fundacion for the support that they have given her so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy leather bags to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Poblacion Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling fish in her town's public market. She earns about PHO 3,800 a month, which is her family's main source of income. She recently joined GDMPC and is applying for a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell and to enlarge her shop. She will use the additional income she earns to make her business more profitable, pay for the education of her children and meet daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Juanito, an electronics technician. They have two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every-day expenses.                             

Loreta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, with groceries, toiletries and beverages. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loreta hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on timber stock to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram is a resident of Beylagan town. He has a small canteen in the town and also he is engaged in cattle breeding. He has his own supply of meat for the canteen. His business has developed 
considerably. He has borrowed four loans fron Normicro Beylagan branch, last for $600. Now he needs $1200 to increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah was born in 1970.  He lives in a household of five in District 16 in Kabul, Afghanistan.During the war he was unemployed. After the peace, he bought a taxi to support his family.

He is taxi driver working in the main city. Due to the disrepair of the tires, tube and machine, he took a loan to replace these items. He is working seven days a week to develop his business and cover his familys expenses.

loans.use: to buying tires and a machine

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Reina Isabel and I am dedicated to sales. I sell shoes to men and women and own a store called “EXCLUSIVO KEISA". It is located in the downtown area of my city. I have dedicated 3 years to this type of activity. I have 3 children in school. With the income I earn, I am able to help my husband with our family’s expenses. My biggest need at this time is to refurbish the store in order to better serve my clients.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Reina Isabel, mi actividad es el comerico, cuento con un negocio de venta de calazado para ambos sexos, llamado EXCLUSIVO "KEISA", ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, tengo 3 hijos en la escuela y con los ingresos que persivo de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente mi mayor necesidad es acondicionar mejor el local para atender mejor a los cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of women's shoes, sandals, and purses; purchase of men's shoe, sneakers

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Senora Cornelia is 46 years old, and is married with four children. She has been running a nursery from her home more than 20 years. One of her children helps her with care and maintenance of the business. Cornelia is a very dynamic woman, active and creative, and is always looking for ways to diversify the products she sells. She invested the prior loans in seeds and fertilizers. She is requesting $200 so that she can buy potted plants of various sizes and colors to sell.

La señora Cornelia tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella tiene un vivero de platas y se dedica a este oficio hace ya más de 20 años; y su negocio de venta de plantas lo tiene en su misma casa, y uno de sus hijos la ayuda en el mantenimiento y atención del vivero. Cornelia, es una señora muy dinámica, activa y creativa, en todo momento busca diversificar los producto que vende ya que tiene proyectado incorporar ventas de planteras (macetas) de barro en su negocio. Los préstamos obtenidos con anterioridad los invirtió en la compra de semillas y abonos, hoy solicita $ 200 para poder comprar planteras de barro de diferentes tamaños y colores para venderlos en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase potted plants in different sizes and colors

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is the mother of two small children. Since the time she was young, she dreamed of having a home where peace, tranquility, and harmony would reign. Unfortunately, this was not to be, as she constantly received physical and psychological abuse from her husband. Tired of the daily violence, she decided to end the abuse and begin a new life in the company of her two greatest loves, her children.

At that time she began selling underwear in the markets of several small towns near the city where she lives, Juliaca. This has been, so far, enough to provide for the day-to-day needs of her children, who are currently studying in a modest school in their town.

Candelaria wishes to grow and increase her business. In order to do this, she needs to increase the variety of products she has available to offer. With the additional income she makes, she will be able to provide economic stability to her family. To make her dream a reality, she is requesting a loan of $150.00. With this money, she will buy the merchandise she needs to assure the future prosperity of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Candelaria es madre de 2 pequeños niños y desde pequeña siempre soñó con formar un hogar en donde reine la paz, tranquilidad y armonía familiar, desafortunadamente no pudo ser así, debido a que recibía constantemente maltratos físicos y psicológicos de su esposo, con quién mucho antes de casarse creía que compartiría un hogar cálido lleno de amor y tranquilidad. Cansada de este violento acoso diario decidió terminar con este abuso y empezar una nueva vida en compañía de sus dos grandes amores, desde entonces desarrolló la venta de ropas interiores, productos que ofrece en las ferias de los diversos pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, con los que hasta el día de hoy les procura el sustento diario a sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de la ciudad que habitan.El deseo que tiene es el de acrecentar y ampliar su negocio para esto requiere aumentar la variedad de los productos que ha estado ofreciendo hasta ahora y con los beneficios que obtenga brindar estabilidad económica a su familia. Para hacer realidad sus sueños la señora Candelaria está solicitando un préstamo de 150 dólares, dinero con el que podrá comprar artículos para futuro beneficio de su hogar.

loans.use: To additional clothing clothing for resale

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi A., 40, was born in Djita, in the Vo prefecture. He is a father of three (3) children and is a very active jack of all trades. He repairs bicycles and used basins and also sells fuel. He would like to maximize his income from his diverse business activities, and to do so he needs to build a workshop and to buy fuel wholesale. As this project requires additional financial means, he is requesting a loan of $200. Meeting this goal will allow him to meet his family’s needs and in particular to send his children to school.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 40 ans, Monsieur A. Komi est née à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo. Père de trois (3) enfants, c’est un homme très actif et très à tout faire. Mécanicien à 2 roues, il répare les bassines usées et vend aussi du carburant. Dans le souci de maximiser son revenu à travers ses multiples activités, il voudrait construire un atelier, aller acheter lui-même le carburant en gros. La réalisation de ce projet nécessitant de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $200 pour ce faire. Cet objectif atteint lui permettra d’assurer les besoins de sa famille surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To build a workshop and to buy and sell fuel

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: I am a widow Shazia J.. I have four small children one of whom is handicapped.  I have some how managed to send other three to school. I sew clothes for my neighborhood women and now I need a loan of $175. I plan to invest this loan in my brother’s workshop who in return will give me a suitable rate of return. I am in a great need to increase my income so that I can continue ending my children to school.

loans.use: Invest in brother's workshop

loans.name: Leydi Emilia

texts.es:
Señora Leydi belongs to the communal bank called 'Nuestra Senora del Carmen' lcoated in Calleria, Ucayali. She is 30 years old and she's single. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She currently sells cable for wood. She gets up about 6 in the morning to open up her convenience store and closes it about 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase 100 meters of cable for wood.

Leydi is very happy for her growing business. Her profit keeps growing and she feels that her dreams are coming true thanks to all her hard work and dedication and for all the help Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leydi pertenece al banco comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, ubicado en el AA.HH. Faustino Maldonado Mz. D Lt. 2, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en compra y venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de cables para maderas. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para abrir su negocio y atender hasta las 8.00 de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 100 cancamos y 100 metros de cables para maderas. Leydi está muy contenta porque su negocio prospera, sus ingresos aumentan y siente que sus sueños se están realizando gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que pone para salir adelante y esta feliz de trabajar con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase cables

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
K. Muhabbat is 30 years old. She is married with four children.

Muhabbat is an entrepreneur. She is selling confectioneries like candies and sweets in the market. As a rule, she is purchasing the goods for selling in one of the markets of Dushanbe city and is selling them in the local market of her home city. The business of Muhabbat is the main source of income for her large family, and she is doing her best in order to make it stable and successful. Her husband helps Muhabbat.

Having worked for three years, Muhabbat applied for the loan for the first time. She requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Muhabbat thanks all supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan management.

loans.use: Purchasing confectioneries like candies and sweets in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama O. is a fishmonger. She is married and has five children. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1970 and lives with her husband in a small suburb of the town Kalesija. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 400 KM. They earn additional income by doing agriculture and breeding cattle. Hanifa will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy more cattle in order to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Betty Nattabi's Group

texts.en:
Betty leads a group with five members. She is 22 years old and single with one baby. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has just started selling women’s clothes, such as skirts, blouses, and trousers. Although her business has not yet picked up momentum because it is new, she has been able to increase her stock.

She plans to use this loan to continue increasing her stock and perhaps move her business to a more strategic place.

Betty is paying her first loan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
For the past twenty years, Mrs. Balvina E. has had a business raising chickens and pigs at her house.

She sells them both from her home and at the local market.

She has nine children who help her tend to the animals. In her free time, she knits traditional crafts.

Her husband is not in Guatemala.

Thanks to the business she can support her children, and the majority of them are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Balvina E. tiene un negocio de crianza de pollos y marranos en su casa. Su negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 20 años, y vende los pollos y marranos en su casa y en el mercado de la localidad. Tiene 9 hijos, y ellos le ayudan en el cuidado de los animales, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a hacer tejidos típicos a mano. Su esposo no esta en Guatemala. Gracias a este negocio ella mantiene a sus hijos, y la mayoría de ellos están estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Su

texts.vi:
Mr. Su’s family has 4 persons and doesn’t have enough space for agricultural activities. His wife has cancer, which makes her unable to work but they don’t have financial resources to send her to hospital. Mr. Su earns a living by making ice-cream and selling it in the streets, which generates a very limited income of about only 175000 VND per person. Mr. Su has two children; the oldest one is in grade 12 and very diligent. Thus, he is in an extreme need of money to send his wife to the hospital and raise his two children, especially when his daughter is going to college in a year. Mr. Su would like to borrow a loan of $75 to purchase more ingredients to make ice-cream and breed chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình gồm có 4 người và không có đất sản xuất, chỉ ở trên nền đất nhỏ họ hàng cho. Vợ đau yếu thường xuyên không hể lao động nặng được. Hiện tại vợ bị bệnh u bướu sau lưng, nổi u nhiều gây đau nhức, không có tiền đi mổ. Chồng tự làm kem rồi đi bán suốt ngày ngòai đường nhưng thu nhập thấp ( Thu nhập bình quân 175.000 đ/ người ) do không có người ăn, vợ khi nào không đau thì phụ với chồng kiếm tiền nuôi 2 con ăn học. Cháu gái lớn học lớp 12, tuy gia cảnh khó khăn nhưng siêng học và học khá. Gia đình rất cần sự quan tâm giúp đỡ về mặt tiền bạc để chạy chữa bệnh sau lưng cho vợ và mua nguyên liệu làm kem và chăn nuôi gà kiếm chút đồng lời cho 2 cháu ăn học và đặc biệt là cháu lớn sắp vào đại học.

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia is 50 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who still depend on her. She finished primary school completely. She lives in the Comunidad de Pusuyo.

She is affiliated with the Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza in the community of de Pusuyo, in the District of Ilave, Province of Collao, Puno Region. She has been with the Banco Comunal for two years. Lacking capitol to further increase her earnings, with the first loan she bought three lambs at S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles each. With the rest she bought beads and alpaca wool in order to make beaded braiding.

With this loan of S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a small bull to fatten for S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles. The rest of the capital would buy beads and alpaca wool for the braided adornments that she would sell in Ilave.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave so that her children can study and later buy 5 or 6 head of cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cecilia cumplió 50 años de edad, es casada, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, estudió primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Pusuyo. Es socia del Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza de la comunidad de Pusuyo, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, hace dos años se asoció al Banco Comunal por falta de capital para incrementar más sus ganancias, con su primer préstamo compró tres corderos a S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno, con el resto compró mostasillas, lana de alpaca para realizar las trensillas de mostasillas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará un torete con S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles para engorde y con el resto del capital comprará mostasillas y lana de alpaca para las trensillas, esto será vendido en Ilave. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la Ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien y posteriormente comprar de 05 a 06 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde.

loans.use: To buy materials (beads and wool).  To buy livestock (1 bull).

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. is 46 years old. Her husband is a pensioner. They have 2 children; one is grown-up and has a stable job. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed VND 1 million to raise pigs. For the following loan cycles, she accessed loans to brew rice wine for sale. For the next loan cycles, she is applying for VND 15 million to buy rice and reserve it for this business. With an income of VND 5 million/month, she finds it easy to repay the loan.

loans.use: buying rice to brew rice wine

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 24-year-old man who lives near the Southern Lebanese city of Tyre.  Mohammed owns a car washing garage and would like to take out a loan of $1000 to perform maintenance on the air compressor and winch which he uses to clean vehicles. This is the first time that Mohammed has asked for a loan.

loans.use: to perform repairs on car-washing machinery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling used clothing.

loans.name: Tusekile H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Tusekile M. from Kyela. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Tusekile has been running a charcoal business since 2007. These small, black dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. 

The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Tusekile currently earns about $190 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 in order to purchase more charcoal in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another store of charcoal for reselling. Tusekile thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 50 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos solteros que trabajan y la apoyan mucho, en la actualidad vive junto a su esposo. Su actividad diaria D. la venta D. bebidas hace que Teresa siga adelante, este trabajo lo viene haciendo desD. hace 10 años atrás, a razón D. encontrarse en un buen lugar que es muy concurrido. Le gusta su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes intercambia ideas y le es rentable porque las bebidas son consumidas diariamente, debido al calor D. la zona. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sillas, mesas, y cajas D. cervezas y gaseosas, que son la materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old, a mother of 2 single sons who work and support her a lot. At the present she is living with her husband. Her daily activity selling beverages makes Teresa get ahead as she has been doing this for the past 10 years at a very popular location. She enjoys her work as she meets many people with whom she can exchange ideas, and it is profitable as drinks are consumed daily because of the hot weather in the area. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she has proven to be responsible. With the money she will buy chairs, tables, boxes of beer and pop which represent the raw material to her businesss.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and products for business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia Álvarez de 36 años, está casada con el Sr. Carlos Álvarez de 44 años, ellos tienen 4 hijos que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.

Doña Lidia hace 3 años migró a la ciudad buscando progresar económicamente, para obtener capital tuvo que vender uno de sus animales que tenía en su campo, ella invirtió en una despensa, en la actualidad su despensa ya tiene una gran clientela formada, mientras su esposo se encarga del cuidado de los animales que tienen en su establecimiento.

El Sra. Lidia invertiría este crédito para  comprar más mercaderías como arróz, huevos, harina, galletitas, bebidas, etc., para que sus clientes encuentren todas las variedades de mercaderías que necesitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia A., 36 years old, is married to Mr. Carlos A., 44. They have 4 children who are in secondary school. Lidia moved to the city 3 years ago looking for economic opportunities. In order to get some capital, she sold one of the animals she had when she lived in the country. She invested that money in a small grocery store, and today her store has many customers. Her husband takes care of the animals they have. Lidia will use this money to purchase more merchandise like rice, eggs, flour, cookies, drinks, etc., so she can offer her clients the variety of products that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: rice, eggs, flour, cookies, drinks, etc

loans.name: Onorina

texts.es:
Onorina trabaja desde los veinticinco años de edad y, en casi toda su vida, ha tenido una gran variedad de trabajos, desde la venta de ropa hasta una bodega de abarrotes en la selva.
Hace seis años empezó a dedicarse a su negocio de compra y venta de muebles. Los que compra Onorina los manda a fabricar ella misma según los pedidos que tenga. Después de tener más de cuatro años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, ella planea seguir con su negocio ya que le gusta mucho, pero desea agrandarlo cada vez más.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años Onorina comparte los gastos del hogar con su esposo, que tiene un negocio propio a parte – una ferretería - , sin tener muchos gastos de familia ya que su único hijo es mayor de edad y trabaja para mantenerse el mismo.
texts.en:
Onorina works since she was 25. Almost all of her life she has had a variety of jobs, from apparel selling to having a grocery warehouse in the jungle. Six years ago she started a buying and selling furniture business. The furniture that Onorina buys, she has it made according to the orders she receives.

After more than four years of having EDAPROSPO loans, she is planning to continue with the business because she likes it very much and she wants to have it to continuously growing. Being 48, Onorina shares the house expenses with her husband who has a separate business -a hardware store-, and she has few family expenses because her only child is all grown up and works for self support.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in furniture purchasing, her merchandise

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Холмуминов Абдунаби житель города Турсун-Заде . Живет в одном из отдаленном кишлаке. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается  только животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Откармливает бычков для продажи. В данный момент хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdunabi Holmimunov lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He lives in one of the remote villages. He is 45 years old, married and has five children. He is in the animal husbandry and agriculture. He raises calves for resale. At this time he wants to get a loan to increase his cattle headcount. He can pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 46 years old. She is married with four kids. Two are schooling while the others work. She lives with her family at Eguase, in the central region of Ghana.

For the past ten years, Sarah has baked bread and pastries to take care of her household. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, cakes, meat pies, etc. and retails them to her customers. She books their order in advance, before they come, so it will be ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfasts. And she sometimes sells by hawking herself. She says the price of commodities are increasing which makes it difficult to buy raw materials from the market. The daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 250 loaves a day. Sarah needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc. Her husband is a mason.

She says your assistance would be much welcome. Sarah belongs to a group called ‘Gina Pin Tin’ which means Stand Firm. She also hope to receive GH¢800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: Buy baking materials.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. is only a high school graduate, while her husband, Ariel, is a high school undergraduate. They got married at an early age and have four children. Two of them are now at the elementary level. According to them, having a family is difficult if you don’t have a stable job. With this, they help each other to earn a living for the sake of their children. Rosalie hopes and prays that with their hard work, they will be able to surpass every challenge that may come.

Rosalie and her husband have helped each other in cultivating their farm and vegetable business. To support her husband in providing the needs of their family, Rosalie engages in vegetable vending. She also sells onions and garlic in little bundles to further increase her daily income. She is now applying to borrow a loan of  5,000 PHP from the lenders that she can use as business capital. Rosalie believes that she would be able to increase their monthly income through the financial assistance.

loans.use: To obtain more capital for their farming and vegetable selling business

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is married with one child. She sells shoes at the department store in the city of Ordzhonikidze. Her profit is 2,200 UAH per month.


Alena has been in this business for 6 years. During this time she has developed her business and gained repeat customers. Alena's husband has been very supportive of his wife, which helps Alena in her business a lot. She is a hard-working and determined person. She would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase her inventory of shoes. Alena sees that there is a high demand for shoes and wants to develop her business further.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of shoes sold

loans.name: Aqelah Group

texts.en: This is the Aqelah group, led by Aqelah. There are four members. They are requesting a loan of 40,000 Afghani. Aqelah and Salema would like to purchase a new sewing machine for their tailoring business. Bibi Zahara will use her portion to purchase materials for her husband’s mechanic business. Zaryn Gull would like to help her son expand his general store. With this loan they will improve their businesses and support their families, making a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: improve their businesses

loans.name: Holmumin

texts.ru: Раджабов Холмумин проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Холмумин более 12 лет работал по специальности педагогом. В данный момент он более 12 лет занимается земледелием. Холмумин в основном выращивает овощи ибахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en:
Holmumin R. lives in the Rumy district. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Holmumin used to work as a teacher for over 12 years. He is currently involved in agriculture and has over 12 years of experience in this field. Holmumin mainly grows vegetables and melon plants. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase mineral pesticides and oil and lubricants.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral pesticides and oil and lubricants

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: El joven Rolando es originario de la aldea Nimasac del Municipio de Totonicapan el comenta que siempre ha tenido la idea de poder construir, el lucho para poderse graduar de perito contador pero anteriormente su actividad es talabartero en el mes de marzo del dos mil nueve consigue un trabajo en una empresa del mismo municipio de Totonicapan, el ve ya estabilidad laboral deside ser realidad sus sueños ya con su profesio. construccion, luego terminar una carrera universitaria
texts.en:
The young Rolando is originally from the village of Nimasa of the Municipality of Totonicapan. He says that he's always wanted to be a builder, but he has been working hard to be an accountant. He used to work as a leather artisan. In the month of March 2008 he landed a job with a company in the Totonicapan. Having steady work he sees the possibility of realizing his dreams and working as a builder, and then finishing his university career.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Kaboli

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de d’agoè-adougba qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays où le bol de céréales est moins cher, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser de bons profits sur ces ventes. Son stock a diminué, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 02 sacs d’haricots et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the neighborhood of Agoè-adougba, which is located in the outskirts of the city of Lomé. She earns her income with the revenues from her business selling cereals and grains. She gets her supplies from the middle of the country where buying cereals is less expensive and, as a result, she is able to earn good profits from her sales. Her stock has diminished and she would like to re-supply, so she is requesting a loan to purchase 10 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals/ grains

loans.name: Ma.  Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe B., 28, is a rice grower in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She helps her husband, Vicente B., till a small parcel of farmland that she inherited from her parents. They have been married a long time and wish to have a baby someday to complete their family.

She would like to ask for a loan worth php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy four bags of urea and one bag of complete fertilizers. The loan will eventually help her out with improving her farm. This, according to her, hopefully will give her family not just an abundant harvest but income as well.

Through the CEVI micro-credit program, she has been able to sustain her livelihood. She enjoys having the CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase four bags of urea and one bag of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es: Manuel Jesús Martínez L. tiene 72 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 6 hijos pero ninguno depende de él. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. A pesar de la edad tan avanzada que Manuel posee le gusta recorrer las diferentes calles ofreciendo sus productos. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y le gusta proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario en sus estudios y en vestimenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como faldas, vestidos, camisetas, pantalones y shorts. El deseo de Manuel es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Jesús is 72 years old. He is married. He has six children, none of which are dependent on him. He works buying and selling clothes. He has been working in this business for more than five years. In spite of his advanced age, he has the energy to travel around different streets selling his products. He is a responsible man and he likes to provide his children with what they need to study and to dress. He is asking for a loan for working capital to buy clothes like skirts, dresses, T-shirts, pants and shorts. Manuel wishes to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Essowedeou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a un enfant à sa charge. C’est pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille que cet homme s’est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce de prêt-à-porter. Son commerce se situe tout juste à côté de la station d’essence Total d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette station est très fréquentée de beaucoup de personnes, car disposant d’une buvette. La plupart des jeunes filles visitant le coin en profite souvent pour jeter un coup d’œil sur ses étalages. A présent elle est très connue de beaucoup de clientes. Pour acheter 02 bals de prêt-à-porter, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour concrétiser ses intensions d’achat.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and has a child in his care.  To provide for his family, he embarked on a ready-to-wear clothing business in 2007.  His business is located right next to the Total gas station of Adidogomé in Lomé.  This station is very busy with many people because it has a stand available for refreshments.  Most girls visiting in the neighborhood often take advantage of it to have a look at what he has on display.  It is now well-known to many customers.  To buy two bales of ready-to-wear clothing, he's requesting a WAGES loan to make his purchasing plans a reality. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 27 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Linder y a sus 2 hijos: Densi de 5 y Edy de 1 año y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su puesto de carne está ubicado en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es muy concurrido por las personas y casi todos los días acaba con la mercadería que tenía planeado vender, lo cual la hace muy feliz, ya que sabe que ese dinero ayudará a su familia a tener una mejor vida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto de venta, soportando el intenso frió, aun así no se desanima y sigue adelante. Para el futuro anhela tener una carnicería más grande fuera del mercado, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Gloria con MFP y está muy contenta de haberlo obtenido, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old. She is a young mother who comes from a hardworking family. She lives in her own home together with her husband Linder and their two children, Densi, who is 5 years old, and Edy, who is only 1. Gloria's greatest desire is to improve the quality of life for her children. Her small butcher shop is located in the Las Mercedes market, the most important market in the city of Juliaca. Her business is doing well. She has many customers and almost every day she manages to sell what she planned. This makes her happy, because she knows that the income will help improve her family's quality of life. What she enjoys most about her work is the chance to talk with other vendors nearby about what's happening in the market. Gloria has had this business for 8 years, and even though she has to work at her shop when it's intensely cold, she remains motivated and continues to work hard. In the future, she would like to have a much larger butcher shop outside of the market, where she could generate more income. This is the second loan from MFP, and she is very content to have received this support. Gloria knows that she must make all of the payments on time so that the reputation of all the communal bank members is upheld. With the money, she will purchase meat to stock her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat for her small butcher shop

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: Silvia Esperanza García F. tiene 50 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que su record crediticio es muy bueno.  Es una mujer casada y con su esposo tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña Silvia es una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Los problemas que ha enfrentado Silvia son de salud ya que debido a su edad es muy difícil tener la agilidad para servir a sus clientes, pero esto no le impide el seguir adelante. siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pan, verduras entre otras cosas útiles para el hogar. Su deseo es mejorar su salud para continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Poni is 20 years old and married to a driver. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda L. is from the village of D'BAN, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Brenda is married and has 5 school aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a retail business. The main source of income comes from selling scrap metal, empty bottles, and other used products in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Brenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Brenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 47 años, es madre de seis hijos(5 son mayores de edad e independientes).
Ella se dedica junto con su esposo a la venta de camu camu y frutas de la región para lo cual cuenta con una chacra que es donde cosecha los frutos para luego llevarlos a vender al mercado de bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò envases para colocar las frutas.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1500.00 nuevos soles los que invertirà una parte en el transporte de las frutas y otra en artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.) para la venta en la bodega de su casa.
La meta de Maritza es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hard-working and active woman. She lives in the Campo Verde district, in the Ucayali region. She is 47 years old and is the mother of six children (5 are grown up and independent). Together with her husband, they sell camu camu (a fruit native to the area) and other fruits of the region that they grow on their farm and then take to the bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa. She has been a part of the Community Bank “Las Nazarenas” for six years and her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles. She bought containers to hold the fruit. Now she needs a loan of 1500.00 nuevos soles. She will invest part of the money in the transportation for the fruit and part in basic needs products (rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.) to sell in the grocery store in her home. Maritza’s goal is to have a well stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for transportation for the harvested fruit and to buy basic needs products

loans.name: Victor Jose

texts.es:
Víctor P. de 51 años de edad, vive en una casa de caña en un sector de escasos servicios básicos ubicado en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es costurera y vende arroz y legumbres, tienen 3 hijos 2 viven con el uno de 3 años otro de 1 años y una niña de 12 años que vive en la casa de ex esposa.

Víctor comenzó hace 3 años atrás con un pequeño puesto de legumbres en la calle Valle de la Flor de Paraíso Guayaquil, Ahora Víctor tiene un horario de 06h00 hasta las 12h00 y 14h00 hasta las 20h00 vendiendo legumbres y frutas, una de las mayores complicaciones es el trasporte porque tiene que pagar todos los días $ 5.00.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas por cajas, legumbres por cajas para poder agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere poner una tienda ya establecida en su casa y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor is 51 years old. He lives in a house made out of cane, in an area with few basic services. It is located in the Paradise Zone of Guayaquil. His wife is a seamstress and she sells rice and vegetables. They have three children. Two of the children live with him. One is three years old and the other is one year old. The twelve-year-old girl lives with his ex-wife. Victor has had a small booth (on the Valle de la Flor Street in Guayaquil) for the past three years where he has sold vegetables. Victor works from 6:00am until 12pm and from 2pm until 8pm selling vegetables and fruit. One of his biggest problems is transportation. He pays $5.00 each day for transportation. With this loan he would like to buy boxes of fruit so that he can grow his business. In the future he would like to have an established store at his house. He would also like to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Jover

texts.en: Jover, 36, manages a rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. He’s married and has four children. His eldest child is 12 years old. He needs additional capital to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for his farm business. He’s requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, for 10,000 Philippine pesos. CEVI offers the lowest interest rate and the loan would be of great help in financing his existing business.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: Purevjav is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Her children are grown up and live on their own. Purevjav operates a grocery booth at National Historic Museum.  She sells candies, cookies, hot tea, hot coffee, etc. She started her business after working at a museum until retirement. For the future, she is planning to continue to maintain her business. She says, "I am happy to serve people who come to the museum.” Purevjav is requesting a 3,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase new tables and chairs for her grocery booth.

loans.use: To purchase new tables and chairs for her cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is married and has four children. She has received a senior high education.  Mary sells foodstuffs such as plantain, okro, onions, pepper, tomatoes, salted fish and others at Abura. She has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a mason.  Mary uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and other household responsibilities.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Magie's Group

texts.en: Magie B. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Sta. Maria, Isabela. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Magie is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Magie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Magie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kakira Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
A. Mariane appears at the top left in a small photo and also in the big photo seated on a chair at the far right.

Mariane is a 27 year-old diligent and married mother of three. She also looks after two orphans.

Mariane operates her brewing business in Kakira, Jinja, which she has been doing for the last seven years. Despite problems like the scarcity of firewood and a lack of transport, she has been able to make the best out of these bad bargains. As a result, she has been able to send her children and the orphan under her care, to primary school, notwithstanding the fact that she earns only 20,000 shillings a week.

To all appearances, Mariane’s customers have come to like her on the basis of her work ethic and her hospitality. Her future reckoning is to be able to deliver her supplies on a bigger scale to her customers. She anticipates that a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings will be her tower of support for her planned future endeavors.

loans.use: To buy bananas, jerrycans (plastic containers) and sorghum for her local brewing business

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: 64-year-old Crispina says her loans from CEVI helped her business and family a great deal. She raises hogs for a living and was able to have her two children finish college from her income and hard work. She wants to continue raising hogs to help improve her family’s living conditions. She has asked for a loan of PHP4,000 that she will use to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: Piglets.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata J. sells provisions in a shop she rents close to the stadium. She is married to a farmer who produces local foodstuffs and they have four children. 

She has spent 10 years in business and since then, her business has been doing well as a result of a grant received from her husband. Aminata is therefore seeking a loan to be able to purchase more provisions in bulk to start supplying to other traders and to buy confectionery. She hopes to use part of the proceeds generated from the business to educate her children up to the university level and save some money for the construction of a house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Mujeres De Bella Vista B. Patzite Group

texts.es: Doña, Leocadia Marcelina A. I. de treinta y ocho años de edad, originaria del Paraje Bella Vista del Barrio Patzite Momostenango, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de comida ya que mencionado trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace mucho tiempo tanto ella como sus hijos realizan este trabajo el cual ella a superado y logrado pagar la educacion, alimentacion y medicina a sus hijos, por lo tanto a ella le surgio la idea de formar un grupo de mujeres para que ellas puedan superar como ella lo a hecho el cual logro formar un grupo de diez señoras que desde hace doce años se vienen conociendo, mencionadas señoras se dedican a diferentes trabajos como: venta de pasteles, venta de refacciones, venta de consumo diario, todas ellas se acercaron a la oficina de la Agencia ASDIR Pologua Momostenango, Solicitando un Credito para ampliar el capital de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Leocadia Marcelina A. I., 38, is a native of the Paraje Bella Vista community of the Patzite neighborhood of Momostenango. She is currently engaged in the business of selling food. She mentions that she has been doing this kind of work for a long time. She and her children carry out this work, in which she has succeeded. As a result she has managed to pay for the education of her children, as well as for their food and medicines. She had the idea of creating this group of women, so that they could succeed like she did. She managed to get 10 women to join 12 years ago, and they have come to know each other. These women perform a variety of occupations, such as: selling pastries, selling spare parts, and selling grocery items. They have approached the office of Agencia ASDIR in Pologua, Momostenango, requesting a loan to expand the capital of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato O. is from the city of Divisoria Santiago. He is 35 years old and single. To make a living, Renato provides recycling services, hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase scrap metals to sell. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Afi Elise

texts.en:
Madame Afi K. is 44 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She is married to a welder and they have four children. Afi K. is an experienced entrepreneur who runs a business selling general grocery items as well as charcoal out of her home. With her income she is able to provide for her husband and four children. She's been working at this business since 1994. 

Madame K. has requested her sixth loan from WAGES of 500,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs. She will use half for her grocery business and the other half to purchase charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and goods for her general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 45 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years. In 2008, Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure as well as other farm inputs. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees and to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure plus other farm inputs

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 28 years old and single. She has two children who are 5 and 9 years old. She has one dependant and she has a family of four people with whom she lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children. She has a beauty salon business. She has been in the business for four years. She started by plaiting hair. Eventually she opened her own salon for plaiting hair and now has started stocking cosmetics. Her business is seasonal and in the future, she expects to specialize in selling cosmetics and treating hair. The purpose of the loan is to purchase cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana B. has been selling bags of charcoal and firewood at Takoradi for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of charcoal to sell. She plans on saving towards buying a piece of land.

Juliana has attained a senior high school level of education. She is married and has five dependents. She responsibly helps her husband in feeding and educating her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
A 25-year-old married mother of three sons, all of whom are preschool age (under seven), Gulzar S. is the leader of the group. When the collective farms broke up 15 years ago, Gulzar got a piece of land upon which she started cultivating wheat, rice and potatoes. Because of the high unemployment rate, her husband went to work in Russia. Gulzar has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fertilizers for farming.

A year ago, with an initial investment of 3000 soms, Sharapat Bolotovashe, the 22-year-old treasurer of the group, started wholesaling sunflower seeds. With money received from the loan Sharapat wants to purchase sunflower seeds in order to increase the turnover of her business activity. In the future she wants to save money and purchase a vehicle.

Akjoltoi Z. is a 34-year-old married father of two daughters, both of preschool age. In order to make money, Akjoltoi and his wife sell sunflower seeds at the market. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase dairy products to resell at higher prices in the market. In the future he wants to purchase a vehicle.

Talyp A., 50, is married and has two daughters and three sons. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family; the second daughter is at school, and the sons are working. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 12000 soms, Talyp started wholesaling bottles. In this way he makes 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase 25000 bottles in order to resell them at a higher price to the factories. In the future he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma I. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Vilma is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan Vilma has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a man with one son. He is married to one wife, who is also in business. He has been keeping poultry and selling vegetables for five years. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan, George would like to buy a water pump and water pipes for his farm. The rain has been his source of irrigation water in the past and due to seasonality, he decided to seek a loan to supply water to his farm. He also faces the challenge of transportation as he incurs heavy costs taking his farm produce to the market.

He sells poultry and his farm products from his home, door-to-door and at the market. He hopes to construct a bigger poultry house in the future. George joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business capital. 

He owns a home that has electricity but no water. His greatest expenses are transport costs and food.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Bonite is a 44-year-old widow with four children and is a resident of San Roque within the municipality of Panaon, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Her husband was a farmer. After the death of her husband, she decided to venture into the cosmetics business to augment the family's income. Her loyal customers are her neighbors and friends. She sometimes cooks "barbeque" in the afternoon for additional income.

In 2005 Marites joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access its financial aid. Marites became a member in good standing, religiously paying her loans. Now, she is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP for additional working capital. She hopes that her growing business can send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo N. is from the town of Banga. He is 48 years old. Eduardo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo works hard to sustain his children's education. He wishes them to finish college someday and be working professionals.

Eduardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children; all of them are in school. She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

Rose has run a business selling yellow bananas for 10 years, working 6 days each week. She sells her products in the market at the retail level. Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO in order to buy more bunches of both sweet and yellow bananas. The main business challenge for Rose is seasonality.  Her goals and hopes for her business are to expand it to earn more profit by going directly to farmers.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: Jesicca

texts.en:
Jesicca P. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old. Jesicca is married and has nine children. Her eldest child is now 20 years old and the youngest is aged 2. To make a living, Jesicca provides waste management services, operating jeepney transport services. Jesicca works hard to help provide for her large family. She hopes to venture into other kinds of business that could help increase her income.

Jesicca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesicca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase wheels and spare parts. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and spare parts

loans.name: Yuri Anís

texts.es: La señora Yuri Anís H. R., es una joven de 24 años que se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, ella no tiene hijos pero espera mejorar sus condiciones económicas, para ofrecerle a su futura familia un lugar mejor para su desarrollo, ella ha tenido el apoyo de sus padres, y ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de abarrotes que incrementen sus ventas y le permitan ahorrar recursos económicos porque quiere retomar sus estudios de secundaria, y la adquisición de su casita para su futura familia, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que labora con mucho ahincó para logras sus cometidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yuri Anís H. R., 24, sells fruit and vegetables.  She does not have any children but hopes to improve her economic situation to be able to offer her future family a better place to grow up in.  

She has had support from her parents and now is asking for a loan to buy larger quantities of groceries to increase sales and be able to save some economic resources because she wants to restart her secondary school studies and acquire a small house for her future family.  She is a very enterprising young woman who works with much dedication to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales, ella tiene una tienda en el centro comercial el molino que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante asus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina Abigail belongs to the "COMUZONE I" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Josefina Abigail is 59 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling natural products.  She has a store in the El Molino shopping mall where she serves from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  Through this business she gets her children ahead in life.

Josefina Abigail would like to expand her business selling natural products.  She is requesting this loan to buy natural products wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Kemboi

texts.en:
Kemboi S. is 28 years old and married to Joyline who is a house wife.  They are blessed with one child who is three months old. He is the sole bread winner in the family. 

Kemboi owns a matatu (public service minivan) which he uses to transport people and goods from one place to another. He has been in this business for five years and he get a monthly income of Kshs 6,000. 

He is borrowing his first loan of Kshs 15,000 from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase some spare parts and service his vehicle. He plans to save the anticipated profit in order to buy another Matatu in future. 

He hopes to excel in business and have a big company of matatus and even lead the matatu owners in future.

loans.use: To service his public service vehicle

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina está feliz y no es para menos,  pues su hija pronto cursará el séptimo semestre de contaduría Pública en la universidad, gracias a los financiamientos recibidos por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por Kiva; ella Sabe que es una inversión exitosa porque su hija, una excelente estudiante, aprueba cada semestre. Este es su  tercer credikiva y lo aplicará al pago de sus estudios y así será hasta que termine de estudiar, pues ya falta poco para ello.  Luz Marina dice a sus financiadores “muchas gracias y que sigan apoyando a las  microempresas Colombianas”. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Luz Marina S. ingrese a los siguientes enlaces: 
http:// kiva.org/lend/173039                             
y el
