http:// kiva.org/lend/221228
texts.en: Luz Marina is happy, and with good reason.  Her daughter will soon start her seventh semester in public accounting at the university, thanks to the financing from Fundación Santo Domingo and Kiva.  She knows it's a successful investment because her daughter, an excellent student, passes every semester.  This will be Luz Marina's third Kiva loan, and she'll use it to pay for college until her daughter is done, which won't be too long now.  Regarding the loans, Luz Marina says, "Thank you very much for continuing to support Colombian micro-businesses."  If you would like to find out about Luz Marina S.'s history, go to the following links:  http:// kiva.org/lend/173039 and http:// kiva.org/lend/221228.

loans.use: To pay for college.

loans.name: Paloma Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama PALOMA, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México. Esta conformado por 13 integrantes entre ellas está la Señora MARIA DEL CARMEN P. H. quien tiene 35 años de edad, lleva  16 años de casada y tiene 5 hijos; 2 mujeres y 3 hombre, todos estan estudiando actualmente. Ella se dedica a vender alimentos naturistas desde hace 6 años, comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio por que los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Ella ya habia pedido créditos anteriormente y comenta que con este nuevo prestamo se a beneficiado mucho ya que puede comprar por mayoreo y así obtiene mejores precios aumentando sus ganancias. Su deseo de ella es que algún día pueda poner un local para vender sus productos y tener por lo menos 2 empleadas de su misma comunidad. La señora Maria del Carmen quiere ofrecerle a sus hijos una carrera, ya que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios porque muy chica se caso y tuvo que ayudar a sus padres a la economia de su hogar, lo cual lo hizo con mucho gusto, pero quiere un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Ella se reunio con las demás integrantes y formarón un equipo de futboll en la colonia y representan dignamente su localidad desde hace algunos años, lo cual les trae mucha satisfaccion personal.
texts.en:
This group is called Paloma (Dove). It is located in the state of México and consists of 13 members. Among them is Señora Maria del Carmen P. H., who is 35 years old. She has been married for 16 years and has 5 children, 2 girls and 3 boys, who are all in school. She sells natural foods and has been doing this for 6 years. She comments that she decided to begin her business because her husband's income many times wasn't enough to cover their necessities and those of their children. She had already applied for loans in the past and comments that with this new loan she will benefit a lot, since she can buy wholesale and thus obtain better prices, increasing her earnings. 

Her dream is that some day she can set up a shop where she can sell her products and have at least two employees from the her community. Señora Maria del Carmen wants to be able to give her children careers, since she was not able to finish her schooling because she married very young and had to help her parents with the household economics. She did this with great pleasure, but she wants a better future for her children. She joined with the other members of the group and formed a soccer team in their district, and they have represented their town with dignity for several years, which brought them great personal satisfaction.

loans.use: Buy natural foods

loans.name: Pabla Norma

texts.es: Pabla Norma tiene 65 años, su negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa Inició su negocio hace mas de 12 años, pues siempre le ha gustado salir adelante, esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que se siente muy contenta con este negocio. Inicio con esfuerzo propio ya que es una persona muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado mantener a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de trajes, camisetas, ropa interior y pantalones. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado en ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Pabla Norma is 65 years old and has been in the business of buying and selling clothes for more than 12 years; she has always liked getting ahead.  This is her first loan and she is very happy with the financing.  She has made her own way and has always been a person that puts up a fight and likes to take care of her family.  The loan she is requesting is to purchase suits, shirts, undergarments, and pants.  She has been identified as always offering the best to her clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul T. is the treasurer of this group. She is 29 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters.  The first daughter studies at school and the second is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet family needs, the family breeds livestock animals.  They also cultivate agricultural products. With money received from the loan, Mairamkul wants to purchase some livestock for breeding. In the future she dreams of purchasing a piece of land and building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Arn

texts.en: Arn S. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries, earning an income of $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a tobacco company, earning an income of about $6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Emman

texts.en:
Emman V. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Emman is single. To make a living, Emman owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor transport services. Emman has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Emman joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emman is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emman from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich is the group leader. She was selected by the six members of the group loan. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living. 

Mrs. Pich was born in 1981. She is married to Mr. Phorn. Both of tH. are farmers who own a small piece of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables to support their own family and to sell. In addition, they are pig breeders. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Pich would like a loan to buy more some piglets and pig food for breeding. 

She is a mother of two children. They are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 46 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hace más de 5 años brinda el servicio de transporte de carga,  en la que cuenta con su propia movilidad, que es su esencial herramienta de trabajo. Es así que trabaja todos los días brindando este servicio, teniendo solo la hora de almuerzo para descansar. Las rutas de transporte que cubre es alrededor de su localidad que son las zonas rurales de su ciudad. En todo este tiempo ha visto la rentabilidad del servicio que brinda y lo más importante es el factor de la prevención por lo que periódicamente realiza un mantenimiento mecánico a su carro y de esa manera evita problemas mecánicos que pueden interrumpir un día de trabajo. Sus planes para el futuro fue el de adquirir otra movilidad más para generarse más ganancias. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP,  considera que trabajar de manera grupal es ventajoso para el logro de objetivos por lo que se siente tranquilo de pertenecer a su banco comunal y se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y pago del mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.
texts.en:
Raúl is 46 years old and lives at his parents’ house with his wife and two children. He has been providing transportation services for more than five years. Raúl has his own vehicle, which is essential for his line of work. He works every day to provide this service, only taking his lunch hour to rest. His routes cover the surrounding neighborhoods of his community, which include the rural districts of the city. Throughout the time he has been working, his business has been profitable. The most important factor in his job is periodic preventative maintenance of his vehicle so that he can avoid problems that will cause a disruption of his work.

His plans for the future include acquiring another vehicle for generating more income. This is his first loan with MFP. Raúl considers working in a group to be advantageous in helping him achieve his goals. He is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank and promises to submit his payments on time. The loan he is requesting will be invested in spare parts and mechanical maintenance of his automobile.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to pay a mechanic to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Iris Ii Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Iris ll" porque es el nombre de la hija de la señora Amanda quien es la presidenta del grupo y se ubican en Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Amanda se dedica a la compra/venta de ropa en su domicilio que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada que ya le pidieron sus clientas, tiene 29 años, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 2 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada al ofrecerles esta oportunidad. Con esto desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. La señora Carmen V. es otra integrante de este grupo. Tiene 57 años de edad, no tiene estudios, es legalmente casada y tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a la costura que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar tela e hilos que le hacen falta. Sus clientes son de la misma localidad. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada ya que se surtira de tela e hilos para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio. Tambien espera tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ganancias para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Iris ll" because it is the name of Amanda's daughter (Amanda is the group's president).  It is located in Puebla, in Mexico.

This group has eight members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.  Amanda works buying and selling clothes from her home.  She started her business two years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes that her customers have already requested.  She is 29 years old, studied up to the sixth year of elementary school, lives with her partner, and has two children.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic that her group has been offered this opportunity.  She hopes that it will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Carmen V. is another member of the group.  She is 57 years old, didn't attend school, is married, and has one daughter.  She has been running a sewing business for five years and is requesting this loan to buy fabric and threads that she needs.  Her customers are from the same town.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic as she will be able to stock up on fabric and thread so that she can continue growing her business.  She hopes to attract more customers and improve her profits so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: For the past 6 years, Maame has been involved in production and sale of plam oil, which is often used in preparing okra soup, red-red, apaparansa and other Ghanaian dishes. She is married and currently taking care of six dependents. Her husband is a hunter. As part of her responsibility she feeds, clothes and educates her children. For some time, Maame has been longing to produce on a larger scale and a loan from kiva will help her make oil in larger quantities for resale. When an additional profit is realized, it will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to make oil in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Afinan

texts.en:
Afnan is married to Mumen. She is a mother of one daughter and one son. Her husband Mumen (who appears in the picture as she is a conservative woman) is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a transport car driver.

Mumen transports goods in the city where he lives. Afinan took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to buy an engine and replace the one in his car as it is not working properly anymore.

The loan will help the family have a better income as Mumen will be able to transport more goods and over longer distances. 


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: buy an engine for the car her husband drives for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make concrete blocks.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende chupetes,caramelos,chicles entre otras golosinas, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de comida los días sábados y domingos en forma ambulatoria y la venta de golosinas lo realiza en el distrito de Poroy que queda a unos 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas y negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas y productos para cocinar como carne, arroz y verduras.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the “Mama Simona” communal bank, located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and department.

Mauricia is 43 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children.  She sells snacks, lollypops, caramels, and gum among other things, in the Poroy district, about 20 minutes from the City of Cusco.  She also sells food on foot on the weekends.  [Mauricia] wants to expand her snack and food business and is asking for this loan to buy snacks and ingredients such as meat, rice, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her clothes sewing business. With this loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her customers' orders in a shorter period of time and make more profits. 
Sughran is married and her husband is also a tailor by profession. His shop is located in the market and he is an expert in sewing men’s clothes while Sughran is an expert in making ladies' clothes. Sughran is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is also a tailor and helps his father in his business while her remaining children are enrolled in a school and getting an education. 
Sughran is very experienced in her work and this is her twelfth year of business. She is confident that an investment will bring even more profits to her. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sughran.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 41 years old and married, with 7 children. With 4 children in school, Luisa works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like sardines, groceries, etc.  Luisa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, milk, curls, etc. 

In the future Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 42 and chose to be single for he wants to take care of his parents, who are now old and incapable. He has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of only PHP 25,000 per cropping. 

He aims to increase his rice production and income so that he can meet all their needs and save for future emergencies. He wants to ask a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings. He is hoping that this coming season will yield a plentiful harvest and he will earn more income. 

He believes that through patience and hard work he can achieve his goal some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Antonio Rafael

texts.es: Antonio  de 45 años de edad y padre de un hijo de 14 se dedica a la venta de repuestos e instalaciones de vidrios, negocio que inició hace muchos años y poco a poco logró un gradual crecimiento y posicionamiento, que le exigió cambiarse de local porque el espacio físico requerido era de mayor tamaño.  Su sueño es tener un local propio y lograr comprar en mayor volumen con el fin de ganarse,  los  buenos descuentos que ofrece el mercado con este sistema de compras. Como su clientela ha ido creciendo, su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para mantener un surtido de los productos de mayor rotación, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará repuestos, como motor, partes eléctricas para ofrecer mejores precios y ser más competitivo. En su negocio Antonio presenta una capacidad de pago que le permite cumplir las obligaciones de créditos y solventar sus compromisos a corto plazo. Sus ventas son generalmente de contado, sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente, lo mismo que sus inventarios y desde el análisis y la evaluación de estos indicadores financieros, auguramos su potencial crecimiento y una inversión exitosa la que aplicaría con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Antonio is 45 years old and the father of a 14-year-old son. He sells spare parts and performs glass installations. Antonio started this business many years ago and it has grown gradually and gained position. This facilitated a change in location because his physical space requirements increased. His dream is to have his own shop where he can sell in greater volume and generate more income. He will also be able to obtain good discounts being offered in the marketplace by purchasing in this manner. Even though his customer base has grown, Antonio’s operating capital is not sufficient for maintaining an inventory of products with high turnover. For this reason he is applying for a Kiva loan so that he can buy spare parts, such as motors and electrical supplies that he can offer at better prices. This will allow him to be more competitive.

In his business, Antonio’s payment capacity allows him to meet his credit obligations and resolve his short-term commitments. His sales are generally made on a cash basis and his receivables are collected within a short period. In addition, his product turnover is fairly quick. Based on the analysis and evaluation of these financial indicators, the use of his Kiva loan should result in a successful investment and an increase in his growth potential.

loans.use: to purchase motors and electrical supplies.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 31-year-old mother of two children aged 10 and 5 years, is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband transports water to sell, earning $6 per day. Every month, Sary spends $35 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike and cart for her husband to transport water to sell in the village. In the future, Sary wants to expand her husband’s business by buying more carts and motorbikes to transport water.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and cart for her husband to transport water to sell.

loans.name: Kanyansande Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Dezi is a fifty year old married man with eight children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Dezi has been selling a local brew for thirty years.  He started with one jerrycan and now brews ten jerrycans a month.  Each is sold for 60000 shillings. 

His hardship is finding and buying ingredients to make his brew, especially bananas.  Dezi's vision is to own a big bar in his village and to educate his  children.  Dezi needs the loan to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.use: to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Баргигул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в России, второй сын помогает ей в торговле, а третий учится в средней школе. Сама Баргигул занимается торговлей. Она продает детскую и женскую одежду. В этой области шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения теплой детской одежды и зимней обуви.
texts.en: Bargigul lives in the Dangara district.  She is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Her oldest son is working in Russia, second son helps her with the sales, and the third attends a secondary school.  Bargigul is involved in sales.  She sells children's and women's clothing.  She has been in this business for six years.  Bargigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm children's clothing and winter shoes.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothing and winter shoes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene  58  años D. edad, está separada y tiene ocho hijos, siete D. ellos son independientes.

Trabaja más D. doce años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.  Nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta D. comidas y animales menores como chanchos.

Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará, diez sacos D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa, chuño, lana D. diferentes colores para los bordados 

La señora desea continuar con el negocio, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la alegría D. las socias y el compartir con ellas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Santa Rosa D. Lima communal bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department.  She is 58 years old, separated, and has eight children.  Seven of them are independent.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for over 12 years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested that money in her business of selling handicrafts.  She tells us that she also sells food and small animals like pigs.

With this new loan for 1,300 soles she will buy ten sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes, potato flour, and different colors of woolen yarn for embroideries.

She wishes to continue with the business.  What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings, the members’ happiness, and sharing with them.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes, potato flour, and different colors of woolen yarn.

loans.name: Lidia Elizabeth

texts.es: Lidia Elizabeth,de 42 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir.desde hace 5 años.ella nos cuenta que su esposo la apoya tabien sus hijos,ya que pues tienen barias metas que cumplir una de ellas es ser grandes confeccionistas y vender trajes por mayo,ahora ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas para la confeccion de prendas de vestir,y asi de la misma manera seguir ayudando a sus familia.
texts.en: Lidia Elizabeth, 42, has four children.  She’s a seamstress; she makes articles of clothing.  She’s been in business for five years.  She tells us that her husband and her children support her efforts since they have several goals to meet one of which is becoming great clothes manufacturers and to sell suits at wholesale.  Now, she’s asking for this loan to buy fabric to make clothing and to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié père de deux enfants.Il a ouvert récemment une boutique alimentaire dans son quartier.Il vend des denrées de consommation courante et des articles ménagers.Son commerce rapporte des revenus modestes qui ne lui permettent pas encore de satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille.C 'est pourquoi, il sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'UIMCEC afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce et augmenter ainsi ses revenus.Il veut acheter du riz, du lait, du sucre,de la tomates et diverses autres denrées.Son ambition est de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: This borrower is a married young man who has two children. He recently opened a grocery store in his district. He sells typical consumer items and household goods. His business brings in modest revenues, which still don't allow him to meet the needs of his family. This is why he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to bolster his working capital and thus to increase his revenues. He wants to buy some rice, milk, sugar, tomatoes, and various other goods. His ambition is to build his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, tomatoes, and various other grocery items

loans.name: Harriet Nkatha

texts.en: Harriet Nkatha is 26 years old. She is married and has two children, ranging in age from five to seven years old. She describes herself as honest and principled. She has sold cereals to retail customers for the last two years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate capital. She will be using 20,000 KES to buy black beans, beans, and maize. In the next five years, she wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy black beans, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 28 mars 2008. Il est compsé de 13 femmes qui habitent pratiquement la même localité. Leur principale  activité est le petit commerce. 

Rokhaya (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Rokhaya vend des poulets. Elle s'approvisionne au marché  et vend à ses voisins. Elle fait aussi du commerce de "Thioup " tissu teintés. Elles pratique ces activités depuis cinq ans. 

Son objectif de participer à la prise en charge de la famille (nourriture, santé, scolarisation, habillement.
texts.en:
The Sop Sergne Fallou group was created on March 28th, 2008. The members of the group have diverse activities: some are merchants and sell products like juice and ice cream, others are chicken farmers, and others practice animal fattening.

Rokhaya, standing on the far right of the picture in the light blue boubou, is the leader of the group. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She sells chickens, which she buys at the market and resells to her neighbours. She has also been selling dyed fabric (thioup) for 5 years.

Rokhaya would like earn enough to be able to contribute to the various household expenses (such as food, medical expenses, educational expenses, clothing).

(2 members of the Sop Sergne Fallou group could not be present for the taking of the photo)

loans.use: to buy chicks and dyed fabric for resale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Mrs. Chea, 38 and a mother of two school-aged children, has been involved in a farming business. She grows her rice two times a year because she gets enough water from the nearby river. It doesn’t matter for her to do a lot of work at the field but the problem is that her family doesn’t own any powerful animals for such kind of work. In general, she rents her neighbor’s cows to plow her rice field, and it will cost a lot. So now she would like to seek a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase two cows for working on her farmland. It will help the family reduce some expenses and can increase the productivity.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for working on her farmland.

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFAME est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Perpétue est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Perpétue est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Perpétue n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Perpétue est mariée à un couturier du nom de Honoré. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Perpétue vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Perpétue vend depuis six ans environs, divers produits (lait, tomate etc..) dans un marché du Bénin. Perpétue s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Perpétue sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The FIFAME group is comprised of three persons of the same family. This is the fourth time they are asking for a loan from Alidé in order to improve their business activity, the three others were successfully reimbursed. The representative of the group, named Perpétue, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. Perpétue is 28 years old woman living in Benin who did not attend school. She is married to a tailor named Honoré, and the couple are responsible for taking care of three children, all of whom attend school. They all live together in the same home, and both Perpétue and Honoré share responsibility for the household. In order to attend to her family's needs, Perpétue has been involved in the re-selling of diverse products (milk, tomatoes, etc) for the last six years out of a market in Benin. She is asking for this fourth loan, along with the other members of the group FIFAME, in order to satisfy her clients and increase her revenues.

loans.use: Purchase cartons of milk, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She has been in the brick-making business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use for expansion of her brick-making project. With the anticipated profit from the business she will build rental houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children in order for them to have a bright future.

loans.use: to expand her brick-making project.

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng, 29, is married and resides with her mother, her husband, and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetables vendor. Her husband has been running a business of buying cattle to sell for a profitable price for over three years and is successful in his career. 

In order to improve her family's economy, Sok Heng is requesting a loan of USD 800 to raise capital for her husband’s business in order to purchase more cattle to resell. By doing so, her family income would increase. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in the village of Lasam. She has a small sari-sari store where she sells a variety of products to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more groceries, such as biscuits, candies, sardines, spices and pancit canton, to stock her store. In the future, she plans to start a piggery business as an additional source of income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as biscuits, candies, sardines, spices and pancit canton, to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on their stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy hair chemicals and one dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia started her business of selling shoes 4 years ago to help her husband Jose Ismael, a factory worker whose income was insufficient to maintain the household and provide education to their 3 daughters. The children are 11, 18 and 22 years old and help in Lucia’s business, which has been growing lately.

Lucia needs a loan of $200 to buy wholesale merchandise at a lower cost and be able to offer more variety to her customers. You can help Lucia grow her business- support her today.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia desde hace cuatro años inició con la venta de calzado, para ayudar a su esposo, José Ismael, que trabaja como obrero en una fábrica, ya que el salario de él era insuficiente para los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijas, ellos tiene tres hijas de 11, 18 y 22 años de edad, quienes colaboran con Lucia en el negocio, y últimamente han tenido un aumento en sus ventas y pedidos.

En estos momentos, Lucia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de mayoreo para conseguir un mejor precio, y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes. Tú puedes formar parte del crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Lucia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en: Isabelle M. is 60 years old originally from Haiti and lives with Chelise Misteler in Munoz, a small town in the northern region of the Dominican Republic. All of her children of grown up and moved out of the house. Isabelle spends most of her time running a general grocery store, providing food, beverages and basic household supplies to her community. She is requesting this loan of $150 to replenish her stock of sugar, beverages and rice, which are her most popular items. Isabelle receives ongoing support for her business as well as a place to develop relationships with the other women in her community who have created their own businesses. She meets every two weeks with the members of her solidarity group and their Esperanza loan advisor to repay their loans at Bank of Hope meetings.

loans.use: Invest in sugar, beer and rice

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
My name is Gloria Maria. I am a merchant and I have my own business selling new clothing and cosmetics. It is located in front of the Boulevard of my city and it is called Variedades GLORIA. I have been doing this type of business for two years, and thanks be to God, it generates enough income for me to cover my family’s expenses and other obligations incurred with suppliers. Taking into account that the Independence Day holidays are nearing, I need to stock my business well since sales increase at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Gloria Maria, soy comerciante y cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos, ubicado frente al Boulevar de mi ciudad, llamado Variedades "GLORIA" tengo 2 años de realizar este tipo de actividad la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos adquiridos con los proveedores. Tomando en cuenta que se acercan las fiestas Patrias, necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor

loans.use: To buy an inventory of jeans, skirts, t-shirts, and school pants and shirts

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
My wife and I have kept a small grocery store for more than 16 years and rely on the business to support our family. We are asking for a loan of $1200 to stock up on merchandise hoping to boost sales and better provide for our family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 16 años con el negocio de venta de abarrotes este negocio a sido la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía y así tener suficiente inventario y tener mas ventas , mas ingresos a la familia.

loans.use: To restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 34 year old married woman. Her business is selling various food items. She can earn as much as $15 per day. Her husband, I.,  is a worker who earns a salary of $30 per month. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business and hopes that she could earn more income to cover their daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: I am Razia B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I live here in a two-room brick house. I am a mother of five: four boys and one daughter. Three of my kids currently attend school, whereas the others are not of school-going age yet. I sew clothes for the women in my neighborhood, and my husband runs a clothes shop. His shop does well, and now he needs to expand his business. Therefore, he requires a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Thi Hien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hiên buys then sells stuff at the market. She also is a general labor for hire. On her spare time she helps her husband making furniture. She is 18, young and energetic. She has never taken out any loan before. This first time, she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD. Her daily income is 5USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hiên làm nghề đi chợ và làm thuê. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị từ 70.000-80.000đ/ngày. Mặc dù còn rất trẻ, mới 18 tuổi, nhưng chị rất năng động. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là đi chợ. Bên cạnh đó, mỗi khi rảnh rỗi, chị lại giúp chồng làm mộc, không thì chị đi làm thuê để có thể tăng thu nhập gia đình. Gia đình chị chưa vay ở đâu. Chị rất thích hình thức trả góp của chương trình Tài chính vi mô binh minh cdc và chị mạnh dạn vay 2006000đ để đi chợ và cho công việc làm mộc của chồng.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is 54 year-old Esther M.. She is married with four children, aged between 30 and 37, and has two other dependents, her niece and nephew.

In 2002 Esther established a food stall business. Esther has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice, and oil in bulk. Esther thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice, oil, and other stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana S. has a provision store but she is also a seamstress. She is married to a cocoa seller and has three children with him. Her shop is generating a lot of income, which she is using to support the family’s finances. She wishes to increase sales.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more Milo, Milk, soap and other items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more Milo, Milk, soap, and other items for her shop

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba L. is a housewife with some training gleaned from the PDEF literacy project in Ndayane. She proposes to open a little grocery store in her neighborhood. She is able to keep quite clear accounts and needs capital to expand her stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Coumba L. est une dame ménagère, avec quelques formations glanées au niveau du projet PDEF de Ndayane sur l’alphabétisation, elle s’est proposée d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation dans son quartier. Elle tient une comptabilité assez claire et voudrait un fonds pour renforcer son stock de marchandises

loans.use:
to open a little grocery store in her neighborhood

Pour ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation dans son quartier.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi, wife of M.I., is a 30 year old lady. She has three sons and one daughter. The youngest two kids are in kindergarten. She needs a loan to buy a rubbing machine which she will use for the cleaning of wood. Her daily income is $6 to $7 a day. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Her husband will expand the business if he gets more profit. Allah Rakhi is a housewife, and does household chores.

Sughran B. wants a loan to start fruit business. Anwari B. wants a loan to expand her sugarcane business. Zeenat B. wants a loan to expand her workshop. Sabiha B. wants a loan to start a grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses on a large scale and improve their financial condition

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
Celedonia is a member of the Comunal Bank Los Laureles

Celedonia is married, is 49 years old and has six children. Celedonia has a restaurant in a rented store front located in a principal avenue in the city of Ayacucho. Caledonia also sells beverages with the help of employees.

Celedonia needs a loan of $350.00 which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and other condiments.

Caledonia’s dreams are to purchase land, to expand her business and that her children will be successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

Celedonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Celedonia tiene una restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Celedonia también vende bebidas con la ayuda de empleados.

Celedonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y otros condimentos.

Los sueños de Celedonia son comprar un terreno, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and other condiments.

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.en:
Maria is a professional teacher in a relatively remote area, though it is not very good pay. In order to deal with her household expenses, Maria also makes animal gelatins that have curative properties. She sells her gelatin in pails, walking around different markets, institutions, and parks. Furthermore, Maria sells ready-made cereals, duck, and potbelly to order to various families.

Maria hopes for a loan of 1,600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to invest in sugar, disposable cups, firewood, and cereals.

Maria’s dream is to have a larger gelatin business and to distribute her products around most of the city.

loans.use: to invest in sugar, disposable cups, firewood, and cereals

loans.name: Mirian Yanet

texts.es:
Mirian Yanet is married common-law and is 34 years odl. She attended high school until grade 9 but she didn't want to keep on going. She has 5 children all of whom are attending school. She lives in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad quarter.

To help herself financially she raised and sold livestock (chickens, ducks) but her livestock started to die off because the coop became humid with the cold temperatures and the ducks were too expensive to purchase anymore. Soon after she changed her business and now she dedicates her time to the sales of cosmetics. It was going well at first but her clients were failing to pay her. Later she had family problems and she was left with nothing. But then the father of her children started to send her some child support and slowly she has been able to set things straight. A friend of hers referred her to the Mar Y Cielo II community bank when she needed money. She wanted to make it past all the troubles so she started working with Manuela Ramos. And with the first loan, amounting to S/.200.00, she purchased creams, colognes, perfumes, deodorants etc..

This loan, amounting to S/.300.00, will be repaid in a term of 4 months and she will invest the funds into the purchase of more cosmetics, including perfumes, creams, colognes, and necklaces.

This member dreams of having her own home and a small grocery store. And she hopes to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirian Yanet, es conviviente, tiene 34 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria, no quiso seguir estudiando por falta de certificados de estudios, tiene 05 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente primero criaba y vendía cuyes, patos, gallinas, pero como los cuyes morían porque la panca estaba húmeda del frío y los patos los compraba caros, no le resultaba, al poco tiempo cambio de negocio y ahora se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, le iba bien al principio pero los clientes le demoraban en pagar, después tuvo problemas familiares, se quedó sin nada, pero luego el padre de sus hijos le enviaba el dinero y con el tiempo ha empezado a surgir. Una amiga la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “MAR Y CIELO II” como necesitaba el dinero, quería seguir adelante, decidió trabajar con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 200.00 que recibió compró cremas, colonias, perfumes, desodorantes, etc. Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará productos cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, colonias, collares. La socia sueña con tener su casa, una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Compra de productos cosméticos.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 12, 10, and 8. She has run her own shop since 2004. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: CASILDA TIENE 4 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES PEQUEÑO AGRICULTOR, TIENE 3 HIJAS, TRABAJAN COMO EMPLEADAS PARA MANTENERSE YA QUE A SU MADRE NO LE ALCANZA, ADEMAS QUE SUS HIJAS SIGUEN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA ES CASADA, TIENE UNA CASA EN EL KM 21 (EL PALMAR) ES UNA CASA DE MADERA DE DOS AMB/ MAT..........VENDE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO 1º DE ABRIL YA VENDE 4 AÑOS, ANTES VENDIA ROPA AMERICANA PERO ASEGURA QUE LA VERDURA EN MEJOR YA QUE PUEDE ALIMENTAR CON ELLA A SU FAMILIA........LA CLIENTA TIENE VARIAS PERSONAS QUE OFRECEN EL MISMO PRODUCTO, SUS COLEGAS TIENEN PUESTOS MAS GRANDES EL EXCITO DE SU NEGOCIO ES LA PERSISTENCIA Y RESPONZABILIDAD YA QUE ASI TIENE CLIENTELA SEGURA...............LA CLIENTE INVERTIRA EN EL COMERIO DE VERDURAS, COMPRARA PAPA GRANDE CON 560 BS. PAPA PEQUEÑA CON 200 BS. CEBOLLA CON 140 BS. UNA CAJA DE TOMATE CON 60 BS. Y OTRAS ESPECIES CON 78 BS........LA CLIENTE INVIERTE ESTAS ,MISMAS CONIDADES YA QUE NO HAY ESPACIO PARA MAS VERDURAS Y RENUEVA CADA CIERTO PERIODO SU MERCADERIA......ADEMAS OTRO PARTE DEL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA LA COMPRA DE VENENO YA QUE TIENE ARROZ SEMBRADO........ ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS ESTA CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO.
texts.en:
Casilda has 4 children, her husband is a small farmer, their 3 daughters work to support themselves as what their mother makes is not enough. In addition their daughters continue studying. She lives at Kilometer 21 (El Palmer), in a wood house with two rooms. She has been selling vegetables in the 1st of April market for 4 years. Prior to that she sold American-style clothing but she assures us that vegetables are better and she can feed her family with this business. The client has various colleagues who offer the same products, her colleagues have larger stands and the success of her business is her persistence and responsibility as she has a steady clientele. The client will invest in her vegetable business, buying large potatoes (560 BS), small potatoes (200 BS), onion (140 BS) a case of tomatoes (60 BS) and other items (78 BS). The client will invest in these items as there isn’t any more room for vegetables and she rotates her merchandise after a certain period of time. In addition part of the loan will be used to buy insecticide as she has planted some rice. This is her fourth loan and all her loans have been repaid promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married and has one child. He rents a store in Ordzhonikidze and sells clothing. Victor has been in this business for 12 years. He has been able to develop his business over this time and always tries to have a large variety of goods in order to satisfy his clients. Victor would like a loan to purchase more clothing for the winter season coming. Victor hopes that increased sales will bring him more income and is hoping to eventually own his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories

loans.name: Mr. Pon Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of twelve people who all live in Chrouy Chrey village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Pon K. is the village bank president. He is farmer who cultivates rice on 1 hectare to earn a living. Since his field is far from the irrigation system, he also has a pump but he does not have enough money to purchase fuel for his pump to water the rice field. Thus, Mr. Pon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Yath Im, is also a farmer. Mr. Pon K. is 60 years old and the father of two children who are both studying. All the members are presented in the picture but some of tH. are blocked from view.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for his pump to water the rice field

loans.name: Grupo Bermudez Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario B., de tres integrantes que son las señoras: Ligia Lorena B. H., Heydi Elibhet R. y Ángela Rafaela S. P., residen en el municipio de Tisma, Masaya. Son muy conocidas por su actividad en el lugar y por ser personas con calidad moral y honradas.

Haydi Elibhet R. de 29 años, casada, madre de un niño pequeño que inicia los estudios primarios, su esposo es pescador en la laguna de Tisma, ella comercializa la producción de pescados que lleva el esposo en su casa, junto con las tortillas que ella elabora. Tiene 6 años de dedicarse a estas dos actividades.
El crédito lo necesita para invertir en la compra de Maíz, leña y frijoles para vender frijoles cocidos y así diversificar sus productos y ofrecer más opciones a sus clientes.
Sueña con un día poder tener en su casa un lugar exclusivo para el negocio.
texts.en:
This is the solidarity group B., three of whose members are women: Ligia Lorena B. H., Heydi Elibhet R. y Ángela Rafaela S. P., residing in the town of Tisma, Masaya. All are well-known for their work in this place and for being honest and moral people. Haydi Elibhet R. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of a little boy who has started primary school, her husband is a fisherman in the Tisma lagoon. She sells fish that her husband gets from her home, along with the tortillas that she makes. She has dedicated herself to these two activities for 6 years. The credit is needed to invest in the purchase of corn, beans and firewood to sell baked beans and diversify their products and offer more options to their customers. She dreams of one day having an exclusive place for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify their products and offer more options to their customers

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 38-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Housam has been working as a carpenter for nineteen years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase wood and tools for his work. This is the first time that Housam has requested a loan.

His clients are the people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing wood for his work. Housam decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tools for his work

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a fruit seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Donbosco group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $170. Every day she works for nine hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, get more food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

Rukia is 34 years old, married and has three children: ages 13, 9 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice E. is the 40-year-old divorced mother of four children, two currently in senior high school, one in junior high and one in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Elmina, one of the country’s tourist attraction centres, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

For the past ten years, Beatrice has worked hard as a trader to earn some income to support the family.  She deals in all kinds of drinks – malt, fan milk, fan ice, etc., procuring them from wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and selling in the community market. Beatrice also distributes to other retailers in her community and nearby communities. She is now requesting a loan to procure the products in bulk.

loans.use: To procure drinks for her business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 39 years old and married to Juanito, a farmer. They live in the village of Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela together with their three children: Janimar, 20 years old, who took an automotive course for two years; Joana May, 11 years old, an elementary student and John Jomer, 10 years old. Guillerma is thankful for having her loving family that chooses to be happy despite the hardships of life.

Guillerma chose hog raising as her business. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital. She plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and a feed supply. She dreams of sending her children to college and for them to have a better way of living someday. As a mother, she will do her very best to succeed in her endeavor.

She promised herself to work hard for the education of her children and provide them with their needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a feed supply

loans.name: Ni Ketut Bartini

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Bartini is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Ni Ketut Bartini owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Bartini has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Bartini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Bartini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Ni Ketut Bartini is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from DINARI. Ni Ketut Bartini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
(DNR.M-0654)

About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Bartini - (DNR.M-0654) merupakan 58 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Bartini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Bartini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Bartini menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Bartini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Bartini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Bartini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S., 53, is a local market seller. She sells items like dried fish and different kinds of fruit. She generates an average income of $2 each day to contribute to her family's daily living. She is a widowed mother who cares for three children who are single. Two of her daughters are employed: one is a garment worker and the last one is a shoe worker. Yet S. is a sacrificing lady who works hard at her business actions every day and she wants to encourage her unemployed child to attain a suitable job. In order to grow her business, she would like a loan from Kiva to order dried fish from wholesale suppliers to resell.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cafe basics like rice,sugar, salt and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and is the mother of three children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live.

Esther is very hardworking and is committed to her business which, she said, is her only source of income. She is a supplier of salt. Salt gives food a very good taste and it is also used to preserve food. She takes delivery of salt from Kumasi which is a nearby city. She buys salt in bags and supplies to her loyal customers in the community market of Sefwi Dwinase where she lives.

Esther is urgently requesting the loan to buy more bags of salt because of the rainy season. She believes she can hoard them during the rainy season and supply to her customers. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of salt to retail in the rainy season

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vend les pièces détachées, il a associé à cette activité le commerce des cartes de recharges. La vente de pièces détachées marche bien pour lui car il est le seul à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier ce qui lui permet de bien vendre. Voulant rehausser son stock, il sollicite de WAGES du crédit pour acheter des rouleaux de fils de bobine, divers pièces détachées et des cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who sells spare parts. He has included with this business the commerce of mobile phone recharge cards. The selling of spare parts is going well for him because he is the only one in this business in his area. This allows him to sell a lot. Wanting to replenish his stock, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy rolls of coil wire, various spare parts, and some recharge cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge cards and rolls of coil wire

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L., 35 years old is having difficulty budgeting her money to buy the needs of her home. She is a rice grower too and when she is not busy doing some chores in their house, she helps her husband till the farm to have food to eat at their table. She doesn't have child at this time. She really dreams of having at least one child, so that they will be truly a complete picture of family.

She would like to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy 5 sacks of seeds and karate insecticides.

She chose CEVI for its low interest rate which is 2% per month. Aside from loans, she also receives training and insurance from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase seed and insecticide

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora M. C. tiene 47 años de edad, actualmente esta separada de su marido. La sra. Isidora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 todavia viven con ella. Tiene una casa propia en una zona que se dedica a la actividad lechera.

La sra. Isidora se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 20 años, entrega leche a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos.

Requiere el dinero para poder comprar insumos (avena y soya) para su ganado lechero. esto repercutira de manera positiva por que asi se proveera de insumos que haran que sus vacas lecheras produzcan mas, incrementando sus ingresos, para poder pagar los estudios de sus dor hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isidora is 47 years old. She is separated from her husband. She has five children, two that still live with her. She has her own home in a region that is known for its dairies. Mrs. Isidora has been working in the dairy business for twenty years. She delivers the milk to businesses that produce all sorts of dairy products. She would like money to buy ingredients (oats and soy) for her milk cows. This will have a positive impact because with better feed the milk cows will increase their production. Increasing her income will allow her to pay for the education of her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for her milk cows.

loans.name: Maaga Group

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Maaga borrower group in  MWanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 35 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children.

Neema has owned a shop business for 4 years, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Neema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Neema hopes to save more money, pay school fess and expand her business.

Alatukemela is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like rice, cooking oil to her shop

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotocopiado en un espacio donde instaló una máquina fotocopiadora en su vivienda, pero debido a que los clientes no son muy frecuentes, optó por emprender un negocio adicional. Entonces, desde hace 3 años, todos los fines de semana, vende ganado porcino y ovino. Su madre la apoya en estas actividades y siempre está pendiente de que sus animales estén en buen estado de salud. Este negocio le es más rentable, por lo que desea incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee.
Este es el catorceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, ella es una integrante muy comprometida con su banco comunal y nuevamente renueva el compromiso de ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de ovejas y cerdos, además de reparar las fallas de su máquina fotocopiadora.

loans.use: Compra de animales

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania lo conforman cuatro mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras y trabajadoras, ellas son Martha G., Yessenia M., Anita M. y Modesta H.. 

Martha G. de 42 años desde hace dos años y medio comercializa los productos de la avon los cuales coloca con ayuda de su hija. Yessenia M. vende hilo, helados y comenzara a vender productos de la zermat, Anita M. tiene una pequeña pulpería y Modesta H. vende productos lácteos como crema, cuajada, queso, leche y leche agria.

loans.use: comprar cosmeticos, perfumes y cremas

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is 41 years old, married man and has one child. He has been in the transportation business for the last 10 years, and was able to buy his own van in 2008. Now he is applying for a loan for $1,000 to perform maintenance on this van before winter weather arrives.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his van

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1,6, & 7 Group

texts.en:
Marquelina, 44, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Marquelina and the other borrowers from Dios es mi Pastor live in Boca Chica, a small town in between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica has unreliable electricity at best, and when running water is available, it is never drinkable. Boca Chica also suffers from the pollution of its two large neighboring cities. Marquelina is a single mother of four, and all but one daughter have moved out of her home. With this loan, Marquelina’s third with Esperanza International, she plans to purchase foods typical of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, flour, oil, meat, juices and fruit. She currently runs her eatery from the side of her house, but eventually she would like to purchase or rent a separate building for her eatery.

Her dream is to give her children access to great educations so that they can all receive well-paid positions. Three of her four children are currently living and studying in New York City, and she said that her dreams for them are already coming true. Thank you for lending to Marquelina and the Dios es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: Purchase food to supply her eatery

loans.name: Onolina

texts.en:
Onolina P. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo Uta . She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Onolina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Onolina has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Onolina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Onolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Onolina is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Onolina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Aggieagnes

texts.en:
Aggieagnes is 25 and married with one 4-month baby.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Aggieagnes needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Aggieagnes joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aggieagnes's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Aggieagnes's Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy painting materials for bigger jobs

loans.name: Qahraman Group

texts.en:
Qahraman group is made up of five members that would like to complete the requirements of their businesses and to make their businesses grow. Altogether, they have requested a group loan of 50000 Afghani.

Zia Jan, the group leader, has a quilt sewing business. With the loan she receives, she would like to buy more good quality materials to attract more clients and to expand her business. 

Zholina, the second member, wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She needs to buy an electric machine to add to the other one she already has. 

Shah Gul would like to receive the loan for her son. He has a general store. With the loan, he would purchase supplies that are not available in his shop, but are in much demand. 

Semin wants to take the loan for his brother, a mechanic. He would like to buy the necessary tools for his brother’s workshop. 

The last member, Nahid, would like to take the loan for her husband. He needs to repair his taxi to improve his work.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa, who is forty-seven years old, has a rice-farming business. She started her business in 2008, and now she is managing a rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. To supplement her income from farming, she also sells peanuts around her community. She is the mother of six children, and she works diligently to proviD. for her family's basic needs.

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to help finance her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies, as well as peanuts to sell.

loans.use: Seeds, farm supplies, and peanuts

loans.name: Dionicio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionicio G. tiene un taller de Ebanistería y Carpintería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
El va a utilizar el crédito para reparar su vehículo ya que es su medio de transporte que utiliza para el traslado de la madera.
Este es el primer crédito que el Señor G. tiene para con la Institución, pero dice agradecerle a CEPRODEL,  por haberle brindado esta ayuda ya que al reparar su vehículo le genera mayor  ganancia a su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Dionicio G. has a cabinet-making and carpentry workshop in his home, located in the town of El Viejo. He will use this loan to repair his vehicle that he uses for transporting wood. This will be Sr. G.’s first loan with the Institution. He thanks CEPRODEL for providing this assistance in repairing his vehicle so that his business can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to a vehicle used for transporting wood

loans.name: Sironko Cell 1 Miriam Nabulo Group

texts.en: Miriam N. is the group representative of 'Sironko cell 1'. She is married with three children, one going to school. She carries out salon services and she has been in her business for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase hair extensions, weaves, wigs, hair sprays, and so forth for her customers. She is an active business woman whose dream is to obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Ma. Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa J. is from the village of Mabini, Baggao, Cagayan. She is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Ma. Teresa is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.
