The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish balls and other dim sum to the local community. Ma. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Ma. Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella Z. is from the village of Hubangon, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, separated from her spouse and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosebella owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Rosebella has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosebella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to increase her working capital. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Myagmarsuren, works as a repairman and guard in a Standards and Measurements Center in his province. He earns 160,000 MNT (about $115) a month. Three of Narantsetseg's children are university students. 

Narantsetseg operates a grocery store called “Bayn Nuur” (Rich Lake). She has been operating her business since 2004, and has steadily expanded her business since then. Previously, between 1995-2004, she operated a dairy products trading business. From 1992 to 1994 she operated a mobile meal preparation business at a local market. 

She has good communication skills. She is trained as a building decorator, and works on construction jobs during the summer. She has been planning to operate both her businesses simultaneously in the future. Narantsetseg is an industrious person and focused on the future. She says, “Since I received a loan, my family's standard of living has improved. Thanks to this loan I have been able to pay my three children's university tuition fees.” 

Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (about $1420) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur, Ester C. has run a fish cage and fish-trading business for almost 10 years from Talim Island in the province of Rizal, earning her a reasonable monthly profit. Ester’s main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of small working capital to put into her fishing trade. As an active businesswoman, Ester has also been engaged in a sewing business for added income.

She joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999 and is very grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. This loan, amounting to 35,000 PHP, is to help Ester buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and fingerlings to increase her stock to match her customers' demands in the local community. She thinks that commercializing her fishing business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her children and cater to other family needs. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Ester is hopeful her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete their college degrees will be achieved. Ester's wishes to give her children a brighter future fuel her commitment to her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and fingerlings.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 40 years old. Dionicio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dionicio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dionicio has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Dionicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionicio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Dionicio is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Dionicio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to grow

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 33 años, es un joven soltero  muy emprendedor, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea en la vida  es contribuir con el progreso de toda su  familia.Trabaja como albañil, y tiene muchos clientes fijos que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos. Todos sus ahorros los invirtió en su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet. Está muy contento con su prospero negocio, por eso cuando  llega de su jornada  de construcción;  por más que este cansado, se da  tiempo para  tipear los trabajos que solicitan algunos clientes. Su padre es quién le ayuda, a controlar las cabinas durante el día,  y él se hace cargo cuando regresa de su trabajo. Sus clientes son los niños y jóvenes estudiantes de su barrio, ya que en temporada escolar le resulta muy rentable el trabajo de tipeo de documentos. Ya lleva cinco años en esta actividad, donde ha crecido de a pocos y lo que le parece mas difícil  es reparar los CPUs. En adelante piensa ampliar  y diversificar su negocio, para satisfacer la demanda de sus asiduos clientes.Este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en  pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre lo hace. Y él es el único varón de su grupo por lo que todas las integrantes lo estiman mucho.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de más computadoras, para empezar a  ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
José, age 33, is single and a very enterprising young man. He lives in his parents' house, and what he desires most in life is to contribute to the progress of his entire family. He works as a mason, and he has many steady customers who appreciate the quality of his work. He also has a business renting booths with Internet access, in which he has invested all of his savings. He is very happy with his thriving business, so when he arrives after a day of construction work, even though he is tired, he takes the time to type documents that are requested by his customers. His father is the one who helps him oversee the booths during the day, and José takes charge when he returns from work. His customers are children and students from his neighborhood; during the school year, the business of typing documents is quite profitable. He has done this work for five years, expanding little by little. What he finds most difficult is repairing the computers. In the future, he plans to expand and diversify his business, to satisfy the needs of his steady customers. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he is committed to making all of his payments on time, as he has always done. He is the only man in his loan group, and all of his fellow members respect him very much. José plans to invest the funds he is requesting in buying more computers so he can begin to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more computers to expand his business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 42 años y sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Víctor, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia. Los productos que cosecha son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, puesto la calidad que tiene su producción es buena logrando comercializarlos a buen precio. Lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas, ya que éstos perjudican su cosecha, por otro lado el tener que transportarlos en sacos, le es muy difícil y agotador. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para aplicar a su siembra, para que pueda mejorar su productividad.
texts.en:
Víctor is 42 years old, and is a very happy and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife María, who is also 42 years old, and his five young children, to whom he hopes to bring a better quality of life. The crop-bearing fields which with much effort Victor was able to achieve, are the principal source of sustenance for the family. The products he cultivates are in high demand in the biggest market in Tarma, and thanks to the quality of his products, he can sell them for a good price. He has been doing this activity for 23 years, and what he likes most about his work is protecting his fields from pests, which threaten his crops. On the other hand, transporting his products in sacks is very difficult and it wears him out. Going forward, he hopes to buy a car, with which he will make transporting his products easier.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows that this contribution will be very helpful in the development of his work. In his community bank, he is a very happy member and always brings order to the meetings. With the 2,000 Soles he seeks, he will buy fertilizer for his fields, so he can improve their productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Lyndil

texts.en: Lyndil T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 19 years old and single and has to stop studying because of financial problems in her family. To help her family earn a living, she operates a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lyndil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lyndil is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for her education and to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle C. is from the town of Trento. She is 31 years old. Anabelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Anabelle raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Anabelle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Anabelle from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with a 13-year-old son, Andryi. She is a market entrepreneur from Stryi, Western Ukraine. Ivanna sells sports gear in small town markets in the Stryi Region. She offers a nice selection of clothing items at affordable prices. Ivanna has been in business for 14 years. Her gross income is 25,000 UAH a month. Her net profit is 3,000 UAH a month.

Ivanna is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to increase her turnover capital and sales as a result. The loan will give her business a good economic boost and will help her meet the high demand for her products this season.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the town of Trento. She is 30 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for 12 years now. She also started growing pigs recently. She works hard to improve her business and to earn better. She says it is quite difficult for her because her children's school fees keep increasing.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and livestock feed. This will be the second loan taken out by Gina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and also livestock feed

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Juanita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2000, Juanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Juanita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Alioza

texts.es: Alioza tiene 43 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad cotidiana de Aliosa, es la aplicación de bordados en polos de algodón, actividad que le dedica toda su atención, ya que requiere de mucho cuidado y precisión, a la semana elabora de 20  a 30 polos, dependiendo del diseño y del tamaño. Una vez terminada este trabajo, son comercializados, pero primero pasa por un revisado exhaustivo para su compra, depende de ello que pueda recibir las ganancias que espera, ya que dichas prendas serán exportadas. Lo que más le gusta de este trabajo, es que lo realiza en su casa, de esa manera no descuida a su hija. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y por tanto espera convertirse en una gran distribuidora, para así lograr aumentar sus ingresos económicos y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Es su  octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito que necesita, será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará hilos, lana, lentejas y mostacillas como adornos, para realizar los detalles que demandan sus bordados.
texts.en: Alioza is 43 years old and is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 children. Alioza's daily activity is embroidering cotton polo shirts. She dedicates all of her attention to this activity because it requires a lot of care and precision. She completes 20 to 30 polo shirts a week, depending on the size and design. Once the work is finished the shirts are sold but first they go through a comprehensive purchase review that determines the amount she will receive since these shirts are exported. What she enjoys most about this work is that she can do it at home which allows her to stay with her daughter. She has been doing this work for 2 years and hopes to become a great distributor so that she can increase her income and provide her children a good education. This is her 8th loan with field partner MFP. She knows that the loan that she needs will greatly benefit her in developing her business. She is also a very responsible member in her community group which is why she is very respected. With the loan she is requesting she will buy thread, wool, beads and sequins as ornaments to complete the detailing that her embroidery demands.

loans.use: Purchase thread, wool and beads for her embroidery.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
GILDA M. nasceu na Catembe, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 4 filhos já em idade escolar. Fez o ensino primário e não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa da mãe com seus filhos e ajuda a mãe nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Moçambique para a Republica da África do sul a procura de melhores condições de vida, volta a Moçambique com perspectivas de iniciar uma actividade comercial. Compra e vende roupas na África do Sul e revende em Moçambique ha mais de 5 anos. Tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua mãe que também foi cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mantas, cobertores, cortinas, lençóis e outros para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Esta confiante que vai liquidar o mais rápido possível e segundo o calendário de amortização. No futuro pretende solicitar mais créditos para construir uma casa própria, assim como aumentar cada vez mais o seu negócio diversificando mais produtos.
texts.en:
Gilda M. was born in Catembe, a district located in the province of Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of four school-age children. Her studies were interrupted after elementary school due to the destabilizing war that devastated the country. She left Mozambique for South Africa in search of a better life but ended up moving back to Mozambique. She and the children currently live in her mother's house.

For the past five years she's been in the business of selling clothes, bedding and window treatments that she buys in South Africa to resell in Mozambique. She learned about Hluvuku from her mother, who used to be a client of the institution. This is Gilda's second loan with Hukuvuku, and she plans to use the 16.000.00mt to buy more blankets, quilts, sheets, curtains and other items to resell. Her first loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, was used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will be able to pay back this loan according to the agreed-upon terms.

loans.use: to buy blankets, quilts, curtains, bedding, etc

loans.name: Robert Kisembo

texts.en:
Robert Kisembo I. is 27 years old. He is married and a father of three children between two years and five years old. He is a businessman who  sells jeans trousers on a busy street in Narok town. He has been running this business for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other friends who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to increase his stock by buying more jeans. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent a permanent shop where he can sell his clothes. He plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. His dream is that he will be able to build his own house and run the shop at  his own premises.
 
Robert believes he is hard working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his stock by buying more jeans.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya that produces tea, maize, beans, cabbages and milk. He has been in the farming business for 15 years and sells all his products to the local market. He also earns income from his business of animal trading. His biggest challenge has been animal diseases which affect his production. 

Joel is 40 years old. He is married, with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will go towards the education of his children. 

In the future, he would like to expand his farming by increasing his acreage of tea plants and tree seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Inganzabunebwe Group

texts.en:
Claudette is 32 years old and married to a carpenter. She has three children who are between one and four years old. None of her children go to school. Claudette is the leader of this borrowing group, called Inganzabunebwe, which means 'Fight Laziness' in English. The group members are committed to changing their mode of life by requesting this loan. All of them have different businesses. 

Claudette, as the group leader, sells clothes. She has been in this business for seven years. She has requested the loan with her group members to buy more clothes to sell, and she says the profit from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children in the future. She says that her business is successful because it makes profit. 

At the time when this picture was taken, the group leader was not around, but she was later interviewed.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hugo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Hugo Enrique A. R. vive en Barranquilla en compañía de su esposa y su hija menor. El labora como vigilante residente en un edificio del norte de la ciudad y alterna este oficio con la venta al detal de mercancías varias. El negocio comenzó hace dos años con un pequeño capital y poco a poco sus ventas fueron aumentando. La mayor parte de su clientela está formada por empleadas domésticas, vigilantes y trabajadores del sector de la construcción a quienes les otorga de 30 a 60 días de plazo para que le paguen en 2 o en 3 partidas. Este es el segundo crédito que el señor Hugo tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva el que planea invertir en la compra de camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas, calzado y perfumes. Con la llegada del fin de año, los pedidos se han incrementado considerablemente, así su volumen promedio de ventas mensuales es de $1.000.000 COP y su margen de utilidad es aproximadamente del 35%. El prestatario manifiesta que para él es una ventaja vivir muy cerca de sus clientes porque le permite hacer una efectiva gestión de cobro y mantener una tasa de morosidad del 0%, asimismo, se evita gastos de transporte y tiempo por no tener que recorrer grandes distancias. El señor Hugo planea para el próximo año comprar varias vitrinas metálicas en las cuales pueda almacenar y exhibir toda su mercancía, y si las cosas le salen bien, abrir un pequeño almacén de variedades en el que además de ropa, calzado y perfumes, pueda vender regalos y artículos de papelería.
texts.en: Hugo Enrique A. R. lives in Barranquilla with his wife and young daughter.  He works as a security guard in a building to the north of the city, and he also sells general merchandise.  He started this business 2 years ago with a small amount of capital, and gradually his sales grew.  Most of his customers are employed as domestics, security guards and construction workers.  He provides his customers with 30 to 60 days of credit, and allows them to pay in 2 or 3 installments.  This is the second loan that Hugo has taken from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and his first loan with Kiva.  He plans to invest the money in the purchase of shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, shoes and perfume.  With the end of the year approaching, his orders have increased considerably.  His average monthly sales volume is $ 1,000,000 COP and his profit margin is approximately 35%.  Hugo states that for him it is an advantage to live very close to his customers, because it allows him to manage his collections effectively and maintain a default rate of 0 percent.  In addition, he avoids transportation expenses and saves time because he does not have to travel over long distances.  For next year, Hugo plans to buy some metal display cases where he can store and exhibit all of his merchandise, and if things go well, open a small variety store where in addition to clothing, shoes and perfume, he can sell gifts and stationery items.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen de 62 años, empezó con el negocio de la tienda hace años atrás porque la situación económica de su hogar no estaba estable ya que su esposo no tenía suficientes ingresos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio Carmen tuvo la idea de construir un pequeño local en la parte delantera de su casa para una tienda. En la actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Se levanta a las 06h00am ha preparar la tienda para que esté lista para sus cliente y trabaja vendiendo platanos, arroz, legumbres entre otros hasta las 22h00pm. 

Quiere continuar con su tienda porque le ha ayudado para solventar los gastos de su casa con ayuda de su esposo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, legumbres, confites para su tienda. En el futuro quiere seguir con fuerzas para continuar trabajando en su tienda si Dios lo permite.
texts.en:
Carmen, 62, started her grocery store years ago because the economic situation of her household wasn’t stable because her husband did not have sufficient income.

Living in an urban area called Suburbio, Carmen got the idea to build a small store in the front of her house.  She currently has a small store in the front of her house.  She rises daily at 6am to prepare the store so that it will be ready to receive customers.  She works selling bananas, rice and legumes, among others, until 10pm

She wants to stay in business with the store because it has helped her meet household expenses with her husband’s help.  She wants to use the loan to buy rice, legumes and sweets for the store.  In the future, God willing, she wants to continue to have the strength to continue working in her store.

loans.use: For rice and legumes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old and married. She has 3 children, the eldest 13 years old. Josefina owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefina wishes to have a successful business.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot tiene 22 años y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de multiservios donde ofrece internet, comestibles, bocaditos, tragos, cervezas y otras cosas más.  Margot requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería  como por ejemplo botellas con agua, gaseosa, bocaditos y muchas cosas más.  
 
Margot pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Margot is 22 years old and lives in the city of Ollantaytambo in the Cusco Province of Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works and has a small multi-service store where she offers internet service, food, snacks, drinks, beers, and other items. Margot needs the loan to purchase merchandise like bottles of water, soda, snacks, and many other items.

Margot belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to the times of the Incas and served as the base for the ancient Incan empire.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like bottles of water, soda, snacks, and many other items

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam B. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Miriam owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, beverages & toothpaste. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo Antonio tiene 28 años, esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es la venta plátanos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, su negocio tiene mucho tiempo de permanecer en la familia, es así que ha luchado por mantener esta actividad. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento es para la compra de mas plátanos. El deseo de Rodolfo es mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Antonio is 28 years old and this is not his first experience receiving financial support from the Foundation which has been of great help.  

He has been selling bananas for 10 years.  He has three children under his care and this business allows him to spend a lot of time with the family, so he has fought hard to keep this job.

He plans to use the loan to buy more bananas.  Rodolfo's dream is to improve his earnings and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Hab

texts.en:
Hab T., age 71, is a mother of seven children: five are single, still living under her care; two are marred and live separately. 

To earn a living, Hab T. is a fish trader. She has operated this business since 2003 and is able to make $5 USD each day. She has another income earner, her husband, who catches fish in and around Tonle Sap Lake. Currently, the quantity of fish is not much as before because of they are lacking fishing tools. Hab T. has requested a loan in order to purchase fishing equipment for supporting her husband's fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Radhika M. T. is married and has three children aged 30, 24 and 19. In 1995, she established her business selling cow's milk. Working seven days a week and five hours each day, she supports her family. Radhika has already received and repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Radhika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Aisuluu's Group

texts.en:
Aisuluu S. K. is the leader of this group. She is 37 and resides in Nookat, a small village in Osh region. Unfortunately she is a widow. She has three sons, the first son studies at university and the other two are at school. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 2000 soms Aisuluu started to sell grocery products. In ten years she achieved good results, her monthly profit is 10000 soms and this profit made is possible for her to build a kiosk, a shed and a summer kitchen. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more grocery goods, such as: macaronis, sugar, various drinkings  in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Aisuluu wants to provide her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the grocery store

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel   tiene  una tienda  de  abarrotes  desde hace ya  ocho  años en  la  cual  trabaja   la  mayor  parte  del  día , en esta  ocasión requiere  del  crédito para  realizar  la  compra  de mercancía ya  que  requiere  brindar  a  sus  clientes  una  mayor  variedad  de   productos e  incrementar  sus  ingresos , agradece  a la  institución ya  que  ayudara  a  hacer  realidad  su proyecto.
texts.en: For the past eight years Miguel has been working each day in his grocery store. This time he is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that he can provide his customers with a greater variety of products. In this way he will increase his earnings. He is thankful for the institution that will help him attain his goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián de 48 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Mauricia de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Julián, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar las plantas de cacao, piña y frutas cítricas es de buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cosechar los frutos ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados. En adelante, espera incrementar más plantas de piña ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio para cultivar. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy campechano y jovial. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y hacerlas muy productivas.
texts.en:
Julián, 48, is a happy and hard-working man. He lives in his own house with his wife Mauricia, 40, and their 4 beloved children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. The farm lands that Julian has put so much effort into getting are the principal means of support for his whole family. 

His products are very highly sought after in the city of San Francisco, since it is well-known that his harvests of cacao, pineapple and citrus fruit are of good quality. What he likes best about his work is harvesting the fruit because he feels that the quality of his fruit makes up for the months of hard work. He has done this work for 22 years and says the hardest part is transporting the bags full of his harvest because they are very heavy. In the future he hopes to add more pineapple plants since he has enough space to grow them. 

This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he knows that it will be very helpful for the development of his work. He is a very good-natured and jovial member of his communal bank. With the requested loan he will purchase bags of manure to fertilize his lands and make them very productive.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Luis Celso

texts.es:
Jorge es padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su menor hijo en casa de unos familiares; cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, la cual se encuentra en el distrito de Eten que pertenece y está cerca de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la pesca y a la crianza de animales de corral.

Desde hace algunos años Jorge tiene su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual maneja llevando pasajeros a los diferentes destinos de la zona donde vive, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y de él.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento e implementación de su mototaxi que esta presentando algunos desperfectos y necesita tenerla en buen estado para que siga trabajando, ya que es el único medio con el que mantiene su casa.  Jorge es una
persona que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a podido conseguir más clientes con el servicio que presta y asi pueda darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 30 year-old father who lives with his [dependent] son in a house belonging to some family members.  The house has water and electricity and is located in Eten district which belongs to and is near Chiclayo province.  The residents of this district mainly work in fishing and raising farmyard animals.

For some years, Jorge has owned a motorcycle taxi (a mode of transport that is used for travelling short distances and which holds a maximum of three people).  He drives passengers to different destinations in his area.  With the income that he makes, he is able to improve his own quality of life and that of his son.

Jorge has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and he will use the money to have his motorcycle taxi serviced and repaired because it is experiencing some problems and he needs to keep it in a good state of repair so that he can continue working as this is his only way he has of supporting his household.

Jorge is a person who, through a lot of effort and hard work, has been able to gain more customers for his services and is thereby able to provide his son with a better future.

loans.use: to have his motorcycle taxi serviced and repaired

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat (in the photo) is 51 years old; her husband, Buntheun, is 61 years old. They have been married since 1982 and have four sons and one daughter. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sat is a garment worker, while her husband is a security guard. She is in the process of building a new house, but lacks some money to finish it. Hence she decided to request her first loan of $1,000 to do the finishing details.

loans.use: To finish her house building.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel, tiene la edad de 40 años, está soltero y vive con 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una maquina de soldar. El quiere realizar la compra de esta máquina para realizar trabajos en soldadura y darles un mejor acabado, para así poder ir generando más fuentes de empleo y mayor clientela. Es quiere generar los ingresos para su bienestar y la de su familia y a su vez tener un futuro cada día más seguro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 40 years old, single, and lives with his 2 children who are his biggest priority.  He intends to use his loan to buy a soldering machine.  He wants to buy this machine to complete soldering work and give them a nicer finish, so that he can create more streams of revenue and a better customer base.

He wants to generate income for the well-being of his family and to have a more stable future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him the loan with more ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy a soldering machine.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 46 years old and married with seven children.

Monica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Monica has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Monica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine works at the local hospital as an accountant. It is very difficult for her to meet the ends with her low salary, so she is also engaged in agriculture. She keeps livesock and chickens. She lives together with her husband and their son and daughter. They have been successfully managing the business for several years. 

Karine would like to develop her agricultural endeavors and thereby increase her working capital. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a cow, a calf, beehives, pigs, and forage. This will enable Karine to earn additional income and ensure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, a calf, beehives, pigs, and forage

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old, divorced, and mother to four children aged between eighteen years and three months. She has been in the clothing business for five years making a monthly profit of 14,000 KES. She has been loaned 15,000 KES which she plans to use to buy more stock like socks, sweaters, trousers, skirts, etc.

With the anticipated profits made, she plans to educate her children and provide essential financial support to her family.

In the near future, she hopes to be a well-established trader in the region.

loans.use: to buy more stock like socks, sweaters, trousers, skirts, etc

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman is 33 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has one child, aged 5.   Her husband works as a travelling salesman.  Though Ni Nyoman often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Nyoman is the head of the AS. Lestari group, which is made up of  eight neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1.500.000 that Ni Nyoman receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 40 años  vive con su esposo  y sus 6 hijos en las edades de 8 a 22 años, en el barrio Los Olivos al suroccidente de la ciudad. Allí tiene su negocio mediante el cual se dedica a la preparación y venta de almuerzos, jugos, frituras y también aprovecha su clientela cautiva para ofrecer el servicio de telecomunicaciones. Su negocio lo inició hace 5 años con $20.000 COP que le prestó su padre, sus clientes iniciales fueron sus vecinos que la fueron promoviendo, gracias  a su buen servicio y sobre todo a su buen gusto en la preparación de sus alimentos diariamente y  sus fritos los fines de semana. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y diariamente pasan por el negocio de Luz Marina no menos de 50 clientes, que le compran principalmente de contado. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda , pues en un futuro planea tener un segundo piso para separar su ambiente familiar de su ambiente productivo y de servicio. Mientras Luz Marina trabaja por alcanzar sus metas maneja en su negocio un margen de rentabilidad del 47% desde el cual proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una exitosa inversión de su credikiva, con el cual comprará aceite, arroz, maíz y otros ingredientes para la preparación de sus almuerzos y también comprará sillas y mesas para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 40, lives with her husband and six children whose ages range from 8 to 22 years in the Los Olivos neighborhood in the southwest part of the city.  She has her business there where she prepares lunches, juice and fried fast food items.  She also takes advantage of her captive clientele to sell them telecommunication services.  

Her business started out five years ago with a $20,000 COP loan from her father.  Her initial customers were her neighbors who spread the word about her thanks to her good service and, above all, to the good taste of her daily meals and weekend fried fast food.  Her sales are cash and every day about 50 customers pass through Luz Marina’s business and they buy from her primarily for cash.  Her goal is to enlarge the business and to do some home improvements because in future she plans to add a second story to separate the living quarters from the business.

While Luz Marina works to reach her goals, she manages a profit margin of 47% from which we can project potential growth and augur a successful investment of her Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy oil, rice, corn and other ingredients to prepare her lunches and she’ll also buy chairs and tables to offer improved customer comfort.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation and also to buy tables and chairs for improved customer comfort.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a conscientious and honest person. He is a farmer and is also involved in buying and selling livestock. George is married and is a loving father of three children. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 12 years. 

George tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants to place his children into good schools and universities. He wants to expand his business and receive a desired profit. George wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for the purchase of livestock. He is grateful to all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a responsible housewife who sells fruits and vegetables in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is now 35 years old and has 2 school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she and her husband want to improve their sources of income to support their family and finance the education of their children. 

Due to inadequate capital, Luzviminda is asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her village

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children one of whom attends school while the other one is too young for school. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his child. 

He has operated a fuel selling business for the past one year; his potential clients are his neighbors and motor cycles operators. He faces a major challenge of bad debts where his customers refuse to pay there debts in time. He dreams of owning a big farm in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 he wants to purchase more liters of fuel for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more liters of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Aparicio Santiago

texts.es:
Sr. Aparicio sigue viviendo en la ciudad de Izcuchaca y sigue teniendo su estudio jurídico y le va muy bien, él en esta  oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

El anterior crédito que solicito fue para educación de sus hijos y le fue muy bien, pues sus hijos responden a sus estudios y se siente feliz porque sus hijos están saliendo adelante. 

Sr. Aparicio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Aparicio is still living in the city of Izcuchaca and still is a lawyer and is doing very well. 

At the present time he is asking for a loan in order to pay for his children’s education. The last loan was also for his children’s education and it went very well, since his children study hard and he is happy because his children are moving forward. 

Aparicio is appreciative and values the loan and he promises to make his monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: G.s. Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: La señora Flor de Maria se dedica es la venta de nacatamales y cosas de horno. Ella es casada con dos hijos de 4 y 9 años respectivamente. Considera su mayor problema han sido las enfermedades de sus hijos de enfermedades respiratorias. Desea en un futuro criar cerdos para vender carne y seguir con los nacatamales, por lo que desea invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos. La señora Maria del Rosario es nueva integrante del grupo, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 12, 16 y 22 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante desde hace 5 años. Ella desea con el crédito comprar cosechas de naranjas y mandarinas, para sacarlas al mercado y comercializarlas.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan steamed corncakes) and baked goods.   She is married and has two children, ages four and nine. She considers that her biggest problem has been her children's respiratory illnesses. In the future he wants to raise pigs and sell the meat, and continue with the nacatamales. So she wishes to buy some pigs.

María del Rosario is a new group member. She is 48, married, and has three children, ages 12, 16 and 22. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the street for five years. She wants the loan to buy oranges and mandarins to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy oranges and mandarins.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other grocery operators in the area. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, vegetables, potatoes and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits, vegetables, potatoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Debido a que se termino la temporada de calor a la señora Margarita le está haciendo falta surtirse de ropa de invierno ya que es lo que le piden sus compradores por lo cual está solicitando este crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa de invierno. 
Doña Margarita es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor, para su futuro. Desea tener mas mercancía para ofrecer y que su negocio tenga mas ganancias.
texts.en: Due to the fact that the hot season is over, Margarita needs to stock up on winter clothes because her customers are requesting it already; this is why she’s asking for the loan to buy winter clothes.  Margarita is a single mother; she has three children in her care that she wants to provide the best for.  She wants to have more merchandise to offer so that her business will earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria Josefa: ella tiene 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace 18 años,nos cuenta que desde ese tiempo que inicio su negocio gracias a Dios su venta ba en aumento,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario,ya que por esta epoca es cuando mas se bende porque biene la epoca de fin de año,y quiere aprovechar la epoca de fin de año para vender y aumentar mas sus ventas.
texts.en: Maria Josefa is 44 years old and has been selling basic consumer products for 18 years.  She tells us that ever since she started this business, thanks to God, her sales have been increasing.  For this reason she is requesting this loan to be able to purchase basic food products, for this is the season in which they sell the most.  She wants to take advantage of the year end season to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food from a stall in Yambio, South Sudan, for five years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onion and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onion and rice to sell

loans.name: Cica Célestine

texts.fr: Cica Célestine est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Cica Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cica Célestine ne vit plus avec son mari. Cica Célestine est mère d’un enfant scolarisé qui n’est plus à sa charge. Cica Célestine vit seule. Pour assurer ses divers besoins, Cica Célestine vend depuis dix sept ans, des tissus, des ustensiles de cuisine et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Cica Célestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Cica Célestine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Cica Célestine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Cica Célestine is 52 years old and lives in Bénin. Cica Célestine did not go to school. Cica Célestine does not live with her husband anymore. Cica Célestine is mother to one child who goes to school and is no longer under her care. Cica Célestine lives alone.

To take care of her diverse needs, Cica Célestine has been selling fabric, kitchen utensils and shoes by the distribution system for seventeen years. Cica Célestine gets her supplies in a market of Bénin and in Lomé. Thanks to the income that this business generates, Cica Célestine contributes to the different expenses of her family. 

To satisfy the needs of her increasingly growing clientèle, Cica Célestine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El Señor Eligio, es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo. El es propietario de un Taller Mecánico, bastante conocido en la ciudad, heredo el taller y la profesión de su difunto padre, realiza todo tipo de trabajos, reparaciones y mantenimientos en general de Motocicletas, también prepara motores para competición por lo cual mantiene una clientela formada.
Acude a  Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva para  acceder a una pequeña ayuda que quiere destinar a  la compra de Lubricantes, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Agradece la oportunidad que estas le dan de poder progresar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Eligio is from the city Villarrica. He is 32 years old, single, and has one son. He is the owner of a mechanic shop, well known in the city. He inherited the shop and the profession from his late father. He does all types of jobs, repairs and general maintenance of motorcycles and he is also prepares motors for competition, for which he maintains consistent customers.

He comes to Fundación Paraguaya and kiva in order to access some assistance that he wants to allocate to the purchase of lubricant, which will be of great help to his business. He appreciates the opportunity that he has been given to be able to progress and help his family.

loans.use: to buy lubricants to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and has three children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of snack goods in the local community. Rosa has been in her business for four years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 44 years old and is married. She sells bags around her village as a source of income. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in making their living better. With her determination to achieve her dream, Jovy keeps on her journey in life by selling bags. 

Jovy’s wish is for continued growth of her business to gain higher income and invest in an additional businesses as a source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more bags to sell. She hopes to manage her business well and to be able to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell

loans.name: Lourdes Melissa

texts.en:
In my community I am known as Melissa, I sell children's clothes, and also for men and women, as well as items for the home by commission. I have had my street vending business for five years, which has enabled me to attract loyal clientel, who prefer my low prices to those they find in the marketplace. My income helps me with family expenses and the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase children's shirts, women's underwear, items for the home.

En mi comunidad me conocen con el nombre de Melissa, me dedico a la venta de ropa para niño, dama y caballero, asi como articulos para el hogar por encargos. Tengo 5 años de vender de manera ambulante lo que me permitio hacerme una clientela fija, que me prefieren por los precios bajos que les doy en la mercaderia. Los ingresos que obtengo me ayudan con los gastos de mi familia y los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas para niño, ropa interior para mujer, y articulos para el hogar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Caroline would like to open a beauty shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 60-year-old woman who had seven children, although one of her children died from a sickness that neither the hospital nor the traditional Samoan medicine woman could cure.  In addition to her husband and children, six of her extended family lives with Elena. Her husband does agricultural work to support their family, fishing and raising taro. Elena’s sewing business brings in a steady income. She sews women’s and men’s clothing in popular Samoan styles for local villagers. But Elena reserves her sewing income to fund her daughter’s university education. With a loan, Elena would purchase a new sewing machine that would help keep up her business and ensure her daughter had the means to continue at the university.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and mother of two small children. Her husband is a worker for a company in the town of Garcia, Nuevo León. However the salary he receives is very low to pay for all their family expenses. Recently they have had the opportunity to buy their own house, but this has considerably reduced the family income. In order to help her husband with the expenses, Maria decided to start selling used clothing. With this she is able to attain extra income while taking care of her children.

Little by little she was able to grow her business, and now she also sells her products in local markets which has incremented demand. In order to give good service and increase her merchandise she is requesting a loan of $550 that she will repay in six months. You can be an important part of the development of this business and increase the well-being of his family. Thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es casada y madre de 2 pequeños hijos, su esposo se desempeña como obrero en una empresa de la localidad de García, Nuevo León, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es muy bajo para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Recientemente han tenido la oportunidad de adquirir su propia vivienda, pero esto ha reducido considerablemente el ingreso familiar, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, Maria decidió realizar ventas de ropa usada con la que puede obtener un ingreso extra sin descuidar a sus hijos.

Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora también comercializa sus productos en los mercados rodantes donde se ha incrementado su demanda y para poder dar un buen servicio e incrementar su mercancía solicita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que regresará en 6 meses. Tú podrás ser muy importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, muchas gracias por tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
I need to build a fence in front of my house, for the sake of my family’s security. I work the night shift and my wife stays at home alone with the children. I wouldn’t want anything to happen to them, as there are many thugs in the neighborhood. I am requesting $800 for the construction of a fence in front of my house.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Por la seguridad de mi familia necesito construir una barda al frente de mi casa, ya que mi trabajo es en el turno de noche y mi esposa se queda sola con mis hijos. No quisiera que les fuera a pasar algo debido a que en este fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes. Solicito $800 para la construcción de una barda al frente de mi casa.

loans.use: Construction of a fence in front of my house.

loans.name: Bibisang

texts.ru:
Bibisang S., 48, a trained nurse, is married and has 3 children. She owns a sales stand at the central market “Mekhrgon” in Yavana, where she sells fabrics and clothing for women and children. Bibisang has been in business for 7 years. This loan Bibisang plans to use to purchase Fall collection of clothing, as the demand for it is about to go up. With your help, the residents of Yavana will be able to buy warm clothing from Bibisang without having to travel 80 km all the way to Dushanbe. Bibisang plans to repay this loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Салихова Бибисанг, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, по специальности - медсестра, замужем, имеет 3 детеей. Имеет торговую точку на центарльном рынке «Мехргон» в городе Яване, где торгует женскими и детскими вещами, материалом для пошива женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На полученный кредит Бибисанг планирует закупить осеннйи ассортимент женского товара, детские осенние вещи так как скоро начнутся холода и вырасттет спрос на этот товар. Люди проживающие в городе Яване будут иметь возможность купить необходимые им осенние вещи не выезжая за пределы своего города, так как близлежащий рынок находится в городе Душанбе и расстояние между городами составляет 80 км. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Fall collection of women’s and children’s clothing

loans.name: Tassi

texts.fr:
Married and mother of three children, Mrs. Tassi M. is 25 years old. She and her husband live in the village of Atséti. Her primary business is making the cassava (manioc) flour she sells. She buys the raw material, manioc, direct from farmers. Producing the flour is a very labor-intensive process: digging up and collecting the manioc, peeling and washing it, grating, pressing, and sieving before roasting it. This calls for a big input in capital for labor costs. Mrs. M. is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 400 to revitalize her business so as to make a reasonable profit from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, madame Tassi M. est âgée de 25 ans et vit au côté de son mari dans le village d’Atséti. Sa principale activité est la production du gari qu’elle commercialise. La matière première étant le manioc, elle achète celui-ci chez les cultivateurs dans les champs. La chaîne de cette activité reste périlleuse (déterrer, amasser, peler, laver, râper, presser, tamiser puis torrifier) et nécessite une main d’œuvre importante ; ce qui rétrécit le gari. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour redynamiser l’activité et couvrir les charges afin de pouvoir dégager une marge acceptable de revenu.

loans.use:
Pay labor costs and for purchase of manioc for flour

Allouer des gens et achat de manioc

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es:
Cleyde is 38 years old and has two children, Elizabeth is also 38 years old and has one child, while Justina is 47 years old and has two children. Cleyde, Elizabeth and Justina have belonged to the Santa Rita Communal Bank for eight, six and seven years respectively. Members of their Communal Bank are close friends and they say that, whenever a member gets sick or has some need, they support one another morally and financially. They mention that they started saving at their Communal Bank, as it was impossible to do it at home. This is Cleyde’s case who, with her savings, managed to buy machinery for her business and a piece of land, and got married. Cleyde has a wood shop along with her husband, and she also runs a coffee shop at the Fine Arts School. On the other hand, Elizabeth has a sewing shop, where she makes women clothes. She was initially employed in a shop and, little by little, became independent and presently has all the necessary machinery. On her side, Justina has been selling food (potato and eggs) in the streets of downtown Ayacucho for the past 10 years.

Cleyde, Elizabeth and Justina are requesting a loan for soles 100, 800 and 600 respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of wood, plywood, glue, varnish, thinner, fabric, zippers, threads, knitting adhesive material, lace, elastic thread, potato and eggs. To expand the wood shop and buy all the needed machinery, to set up a store to sell and rent party gowns, and to register the property title of her land and see her children become professional are Cleyde’s, Elizabeth’s and Justina’s respective dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Cleyde tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Justina tiene 47 años y 2 hijos. Cleyde, Elizabeth y Justina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santa Rita desde hace 8, 6, 7 años respectivamente. Las socias en su Banco Comunal son amigas y unidas y nos dicen que cuando hay socias que se enferman o tienen alguna necesidad ellas se apoyan moral y económicamente. Ellas mencionan que en su Banco Comunal comenzaron a ahorrar, porque en su casa era imposible ahorrar. Este es el caso de Cleyde, que con sus ahorros pudo comprar algunas maquinarias para su negocio, compró su terreno y también se casó. Cleyde, junto a su esposo, tiene un taller de carpintería y además ella tiene un cafetín en la escuela de Bellas Artes. Por otro lado, Elizabeth tiene su taller de confección de prendas de vestir para damas. Inicialmente Elizabeth trabajaba en un taller, y poco a poco fue independizándose y en la actualidad tiene todas las máquinas necesarias. Mientras que Justina vende papa con huevo sancochado y los vende en las calles del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 10 años.

Cleyde, Elizabeth y Justina necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 800 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de madera, triplay, colas, laca, tiner, tela, cierre, hilos, pelón adhesivo, blondas, elásticos, papa, huevo. Los sueños de Cleyde, Elizabeth y Justina son ampliar su taller de carpintería y comprar todas sus máquinas, tener una tienda de venta y alquiler de vestidos de fiesta, hacer registrar el título de propiedad de su terreno y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Cleyde, Elizabeth and Justina are requesting a loan for soles 100, 800 and 600 respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of wood, plywood, glue, varnish, thinner, fabric, zippers, threads, knitting adhesive material, lace, elastic thread, potato and eggs.

loans.name: Khalimachon

texts.en:
Khalimachon A. is 41 years old. She is married and has three children.

Khalimachon runs her own tailoring shop. Currently there are four sewers working in the shop. Khalimachon’s tailoring shop specializes in sewing clothing for women in both the European style and the national style. Khalimachon's husband is not employed, so her business is the main source of income for her family.

Khalimachon is planning to expand her business and to hire two more sewers. She requests a loan of 3,450 somoni ($1,000.00 in US dollars) for the term of nine months. She will use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine produced in Japan. This is Khalimachon's first loan; however, she would like to assure everyone that she will be able to pay it on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to help expand her business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. Kokou is 39 years old, a father of two children and is owner of a watch repair shop. He has owned this business for 8 years. This activity helps him earn a modest incomes that enables him to provide for the needs of his family. This credit will help him acquire modern tools for the repair of watches and also to secure his workshop by making and installing safety bars.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr D. Kokou est âgé de 39 ans, père de deux enfants et est propriétaire d’un atelier de réparation de montres. Il exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans . Cette activité lui procure des revenus modestes sui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Le présent crédit va lui permettre d’acquérir les outils modernes de réparation de montres et de rendre plus sécuriser son atelier par la fabrication des grilles de sécurité.

loans.use: Purchase of various materials for watch repairs

loans.name: Las Margaritas I Group

texts.en:
The 32 women of the "Las Margaritas" village bank come from a small town, Yepocapa, nestled quietly between the Fuego and Acatenango volcanoes, two hours from paved roads. With this tranquil isolation also comes limited opportunity, but microfinance has opened the doors to small loans that will lessen the burden of providing basic needs for their families.

The women of Las Margaritas have a variety of businesses, and 15 of the 32 have requested a loan of 25,100 quetzales ($3,300 USD), ranging from $100 to $400 per person. These fifteen women are weavers, an art most women learn as children. They will invest their loan in colorful threads with which they will craft beautiful "huipiles," the traditional Mayan blouses that can take up to 3 months to make.
