She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Rossel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Idalídes Isabel

texts.es:
Idalides V.  vive en el Líbano un barrio de Cartagena, donde tiene un negocio de variedades  y vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños,  calcetines, y en general accesorios femeninos. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina, ropa femenina e infantil, y cosméticos que tiene encargados por sus clientes.  Su negocio inició hace tres años cuando a través de una revista especializada de productos empezó a vender mercancías específicas,  para  apoyar la gestión de su hogar, adquirir independencia financiera,  y como le llamó la atención  los premios o promociones comerciales que entrega la revista por su compra, se entusiasmó y se afilió de inmediato.  
Actualmente  ha logrado gran diversificación en su oferta y ya no solo está vinculada con un catalogo, sino que maneja  cuatro,  para lograr integrar a su variedad  todos los productos que requieren sus clientes, con el fin de que al llegar a su negocio, compren y logren su satisfacción. 
A Idalides le va muy bien, porque es muy conocida en su zona de trabajo y además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo,  quien le consigue también, buenos clientes entre sus vecinos y amigos.  Su mayor desafío es aumentar su capital de trabajo, para vender de manera sostenida y obtener utilidades importantes que le permitan cubrir los gastos de educación universitaria de sus hijos,  en las edades de 14 y 17 años, uno de los cuales está próximo a comenzar estos estudios.
Idalides V. aprovecha muy bien la ubicación que tiene en su barrio donde se encuentran muy cerca a escenarios deportivos y un importante numero de negocios que interactúan y forman parte de sus clientes reales y potenciales y que cada día busca fidelizar.
texts.en:
Idalides V. lives in Líbano, an area in Cartagena, where she has a business selling clothing for women, men and children, socks and women's accessories.  This is her second loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation and first through Kiva.  She plans to use the loan to buy a display case, women's and children's clothing and cosmetics which have been ordered by customers.  

She began her activity three years ago through a specialized magazine and began selling specific goods to help with household expenses and have financial independence.  She was so enthusiastic about the rewards and sales promotions she could receive through the magazine that she signed up right away.

She has been able to add more variety to her range of products and not only sells through one catalogue but through four.  This is so she can offer her customers everything they need to their full satisfaction.

Idalides is very successful because she is well-known in the area and has a lot of support from her husband who also helps her reach more customers in the neighborhood and among friends.  Her greatest challenge is to increase working capital so she can maintain sales and obtain earnings that allow her to cover university expenses for her children who range in age from 14 to 17.  One is about to begin college.

Idalides V. takes full advantage of her location in the neighborhood since she is very near sports venues and many businesses there work together to keep a loyal customer base.

loans.use: To buy a display case, women's and children's clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: My

texts.en: My M. is 34 years old married man who makes a daily profit by selling. His wife, Sor Eang, is 33, and sells rattan cupboards in her village, which is in the province of Kompong Tom. The couple has two children, both in school. My M. always uses his motor-trailer as vehicle to pick up his item to sell in and around his community. Unluckily, his motor-trailer was broke during driving. My M. is worried about his bed-selling business because of his motor-trailer. Accordingly, he would like to request a loan to buy a new motor-trailer to replace the broken one so he can continue his business as he did before.

loans.use: to buy a new motor-trailer

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 33 years old and married with two children in school. Ivy works very hard to provide for them.

Ivy runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Ivy has been in this business selling charcoal for three years. 

In the future, Ivy would like to send her chilren to school and use funds for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stock to sell

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has one child.

Nabil has had a shop for frozen meat, fish and chicken since 2006. He is well known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a new refrigerator for his work. He is aiming to develop his work and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for his work

loans.name: Sahodatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Sahodatkhon T. is the leader of this group.  She is 61 and married, her husband is a pensioner. Together they have raised three sons; all the sons are working in Russia. Sahodatkhon and her husband are farmers. They breed livestock animals and then resell it at the higher price after fattening. In this way they earn additional 1500 soms per month. They also cultivate agricultural products; with money received from the loan Sahodatkhon would purchase potato seeds. In the future she wants to increase the number of livestock and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for farming.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José tiene 26  años de edad, él casado y tiene un hijo.  Vive en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en la zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mochumi, cuenta con servicios de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

José se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público de pasajeros en una mototaxi (unidad móvil con moto y una cabina para transportar pasajeros), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en su misma localidad donde cuenta con clientes establecidos.  Además cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la venta de animales, labor que realiza pero con menor dedicación.

José quiere poder darle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil comprando algunos repuestos y renovado sus asientos.  Para eso a crecido por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1500 nuevos soles para solventar estos gastos.

José es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in his own home which is located in a marginal urban area in Mochumi district.  It has electricity.   His is a small community which is made up of approximately 100 families.

José provides a public transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He has been in this business for two years and works in his own village where he has regular customers.  He also makes additional income from selling animals but this is a sideline business.

José would like to be able to have maintenance work done on his vehicle.  He would like to buy some spare parts and renew the seats.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to cover these expenses.

José is a calm and responsible person.  His biggest wish is to get ahead in life and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle and to have it serviced

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, corn husks, fresh fish, firewood and more

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II” del Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 43  años  y tiene tres  hijos, dos de ellos ya cuentan con su propia familia, solo el menor está en el nivel secundario.

Inicia su negocio  con  la venta de frutas en el mercado de la zona, lo dejò debido a que no generaba muchas ganancias y  decidiò  comprar un motocarro con un capital  de S/. 500.00 que  le sirvió de cuota inicial, este vehículo es utilizado para transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, por lo que está muy contenta ya que las ganancias le sirven para ir pagando poco a poco el crèdito. 


Con este préstamo de S/. 1800.00, financiará la compra de un motocarro màs que le servirá para mejorar sus ingresos  a través del alquiler diario de este vehículo.
 
Rosa es una  mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener algún día una tienda grande de alquiler de motocarros.   Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de la Colina II" of the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, in the Province and Department of San Martin. She is single, 43 years old, and she has three children. Two of them have families of their own and the youngest is in high school.

She started out with a business selling fruits in the regional market but she abandoned it because it was not generating much profit. She decided to purchase a motorcycle transport vehicle with the help of a capital fund of S/.500 which helped her with the initial expense. This is an urban passenger transport vehicle. She is very happy because her profits help her to repay her loan.

With this loan of S/.1800 she will finance the purchase of another motorcycle transport which will help her to improve her income from its daily rental.

Rosa is a hardworking woman and her dream is to one day have a large business renting motorcycle transports. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like herself to have opportunities to improve their income and to improve the quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle transport vehicle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 59-year-old who is married and has eight children. She has been farming for the past 26 years. Mary grows vegetables and rears dairy cows.  She gets her income from selling the vegetables and milk. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business and raise her standard of living.  She hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow for more milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es: La señora Otilia es socia D. la Alcancía Comunal “San Roque”, tiene 64 años D. edad, casada tiene  7 hijos. La socia se dedica a la Agricultura en la Venta D. Verduras, ella tiene su propio hectárea D. terreno para cultivar y cosechar las verduras como Lechuga, Nabo, Zanahoria, Cebollas, y otros para la venta en el mercado D. su localidad, también conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos cría animales menores como Cuy, Ternera, Cerdos, Gallinas, etc. El préstamo solicito es para comprar insumos como semillas para el cultivo D. verduras. Sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar maquinas agrícolas para el cultivo D. sus productos. Está ubicada en la izquierda segunda fila con polo blanco, chompa color plomo y guindo.
texts.en: Otilia is a member of the San Roque Communal Bank.  She is 64 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She farms and sells produce, and has her own hectare to grow and harvest produce such as lettuce, turnips, carrots, onions, and others, to sell in the market in her area.  Together with her husband and children, she raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, calves, pigs, chickens, etc.  She requested the loan to buy raw materials such as seed to grow her produce.  Her goal is to buy farm equipment to grow her products.  She is the first person on the second row, with a white polo shirt, and a gray and burgundy sweater.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell for her fruits and vegetables vending business.

Jessie has been in this business for eight years. Jessie earns more income from a general store.

Jessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additonal fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en: Georgi is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and has an orchard. With the loan's help, Georgi will increase the number of livestock in his business by purchasing cows and calves. This will make Georgi's dream of having a big farm come true. Increased income means a brighter future for Georgi and his family. Georgi lives together with his wife and parents.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His cherished dream is to build commercial houses because he believes they bring higher returns. He has been operating a shop for two years and business is profitable despite the high cost  of rent and the ever raising prices due to the current inflation rate. Moses needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, soap and rice for resale. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and also to build his own business premises.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and rice bags for resale.

loans.name: Nataliya's Group

texts.en:
Nataliya is the leader of this group. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. Her husband went to work in Russia. She works in the Combine of Kadamjai and receives a monthly salaryof 5600 soms. She is requesting a loan because she needs additional funds to purchase building materials. Nataliya plans to start repairing her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza. Mahmoud would now like to open his own business, so he decided to start a business of his own by opening a bookshop in which he sells stationary. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy stationary for his bookshop and furniture as well. Something that will make his business special or different from others is that he is planning to open a toy section, since no other bookstore has this. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy stationary for his bookshop and furniture

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up two daughters and two sons; the daughters work in a sewing workshop in Bishkek, the first son studies at university, and the second son is at school. Nurgul works as a cleaner; six years ago her parents presented her a calf, and since that time she has also been engaged in cattle breeding. At the moment she keeps four cattle, and every day she sells about 7-8 liters of milk. In this way she earns about 2000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the near future, Nurgul plans to increase the number of her cattle up to ten, and with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she wants to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar est âgé de 39 ans et est père de 5 enfants.Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à LOULOUNI.
Oumar mène cette activité de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 4 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il  décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après un premier prêt correctement remboursé,  il est à son deuxième prêt qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de LOULOUNI. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar is 39 years old and is the father of five children. He lives in a traditional family in Loulouni.

Oumar has been practicing his trade, selling cereals, for the last four years. His experience in this field earned him a good reputation and he receives cereals orders in particular for corn and sorghum. 

In order to have the required resources to meet his customers demand he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yirwaso. After a first loan that was fully reimbursed, he is planning on using his second loan to buy 2 tons of corn and 1 ton of sorghum. He gets his supplies in the villages neighboring Loulouni. The cereals are stored in his shop. He sells them for cash to his customers who are men or women coming from Sikasso and Bamako. If need be he will deliver them to Sikasso.

With this loan he is planning on making a monthly profit of 150 000 Francs CFA. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Vivian has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Yoselin Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Yesenia tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la comunidad de Compone y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta y compra de chanchos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Yesenia requiere el préstamo para comprar más chanchos. 

Yesenia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a member of the 'San Isidro de Compone community bank' which meets once a month in the city of Izcuchaca, in Compone community.

Yesenia is 23 years old and has one child.  She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in Compone community.  This is where she carries out her business activities.  Her business is buying and selling pigs.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this opportunity, she requires a loan to buy more pigs.

Yesenia is grateful for her loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LOS COMERCIANTES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Fortunata;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad; la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, la socia también lleva verduras a Puerto Maldonado, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de panetones, la socia también con parte del préstamo desea abonar sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz blanco para choclo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de panetones porque se vienen las fiestas navideñas y también con parte de este dinero ella invertirá en abonar sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz blanco.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the "Los Comerciantes" community bank which is located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Fortunata is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 15 and 8 years old.  Fortunata has a grocery store.  She also takes vegetables to sell in Puerto Maldonado.  Fortunata has land where she grows crops.  She would like to invest her loan in buying panettones.  She would also like to use part of her loan money to fertilize her white corn crop.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying panettones because the Christmas holidays are approaching and will also invest part of her money in fertilizing her white corn crop.

Fortunata is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying panettones because the Christmas holidays are approaching.  She will also invest part of her money in fertilizing her white corn crops

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada started a small retail business 10 years ago selling blankets, clothes and towels. Because Ghada is a conservative person, her son Mohammad has agreed to be in the photo instead. Ghada is a 43-year-old housewife. She has six sons and daughters. She buys her products from either Aqaba or Ramtha, where she can find the products cheap; then sells them after adding some profit in Marka, her home city. Now Ghada has applied for this loan to buy items in larger quantities to add to her collection.

loans.use: to buy more clothes items in larger quantities

loans.name: Sonia Doranny

texts.es: La señora Sonia a sus 28 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 12, 7 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la producción agropecuaria. Desde niña, la señora Sonia ha trabajado la agricultura y actualmente tiene un vivero de flores. La señora Sonia desea diversificar su negocio adquiriendo cerdos para su cría y levante; asimismo desea construir el lugar donde permanecerían los cerdos llamado cochera. Con lo anterior podrán aumentar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Sonia es tener una gran finca en la que pueda tener muchos cultivos.
texts.en: At the age of 28, Mrs. Sonia is the mother of three children, ages 9, 7 and 12. She has worked in agriculture since she was a child. She now has a flower nursery. Sonia wants to diversify her business and buy hogs to raise. She also wants to build a shed for them to live in. With this investment she will be able to increase her family's income and improve their quality of life. Mrs. Sonia's dream is to have a big farm with a lot of crops.

loans.use: to buy hogs and build a place for them to live.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery de 44 años de edad, es una mujer soltera pero con 7 hijas de 21, 19, 18, 17, 11, 8 y 3 años. Mery tiene una familia grande y unida, 3 de sus hijos mayores viven en la ciudad de Huancayo, por estar estudiando, mientras que ella vive con 4 de ellos en una casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas. Mery trabaja mucho y siempre se las arregla para no descuidar sus pedidos. En el calor de su hogar, abrió un taller de confecciones de textiles a los que entrega su vida desde hace 20 años. Con esta actividad y su esfuerzo ha podido educar a sus hijos, ya que 3 de ellos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. Está contenta y orgullosa. Mery es una excelente confeccionista de mantas, faldas, vestimentas autóctonas, frazadas, etc. Cuando coge el hilo y la aguja deja volar su creatividad, es así que sus pedidos no cesan. “En diciembre ya no tengo tiempo para nada, el trabajo es agotador, pero no me quejo por que sé que es bueno”, comenta.
Ahora está trabajando en un pedido de 250 mantas, que calcula terminará en 2 meses. Cada manta la ofrece a 10 soles. Para agilizar su trabajo sus hijos la apoyan. Cada quien tiene su función que puede ser cortar, coser, bordar, etc., de esa manera ahorra en el pago de personal. 
De su actividad espera mucho, aún tiene hijos pequeños a los que quiere ver realizados, por eso continuará con su diaria lucha. Mery pertenece a un grupo comunal, pero por la necesidad de sus pedidos, desea obtener un préstamo de MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, como lo fue en muchas oportunidades. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de telas de diferentes calidades, marcas y colores para confeccionar más mantas y vestimentas autóctonas que son usadas como disfraces en las fiestas patronales, muy costumbristas en los distritos de la sierra del Perú.
texts.en:
44-year-old Mery is single with 7 daughters aged 21, 19, 18, ​​17, 11, 8 and and 3. Mery has a large, close-knit family. Her three grown children live in the city of Huancayo, where they are studying. Mery lives with the other four in her own house in the district of San Pedro de Cajas. 

20 years ago, Mery opened a clothing and textiles workshop in her home to which she has dedicated her life ever since. Mery works hard and always manages to fulfill her orders. Due to her efforts in her business, she has been able to educate her children; three of them are now studying in college which makes her happy and proud. 

Mery is an excellent manufacturer of garments such as woolen and cotton blankets, skirts, native dresses, and so on. When she picks up the thread and needle, her creativity flows and this is why orders continue to come in. Mery says, "In December I have no time for anything, the work is exhausting, but I'm not complaining because I know it's good". 

Mery is currently working on an order of 250 blankets, which she estimates will be completed in two months. She sells each blanket for 10 soles. To help expedite the work, her children assist. Everyone has their own role, which could be to cut, sew, embroider, etc. This saves on paying staff to do these jobs. Mery has high hopes for her business, and will continue with her daily struggle as she still has young children whom she wants to see succeed.

Mery belongs to a community group, however due to the volume of orders she would like to obtain a loan from MFP. She therefore agrees to be punctual in her payments, as she has been on many previous occasions. The money will be invested in the purchase of fabrics of various qualities, brands and colors, with which Mery will make more blankets and clothing for use as costumes during the festival of the patron saint, which is a custom in the mountain districts of Peru.

loans.use: to purchase fabric of different colors and qualities, to produce her garments

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket, 51, is a hardworking and responsible mother of six children living in Kompong Cham province. 

To earn a living, Ket is involved in agricultural businesses such as cultivating rice crops and raising poultry at home. She typically earns in the neighborhood of $2 per day. 

Ket is going to prepare a wedding party for her son soon, yet due to the lack of capital, Ket cannot manage the party as well as expected. So now she turns to our lenders to ask for funds to prepare her son’s wedding party that will be held in the next few weeks. She is appreciative and she promises to pay her loan back punctually.

loans.use: to prepare her son’s wedding party.

loans.name: El Durazno Group

texts.es:
La señora Domitila tiene 39 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que trabaja en el campo, ellos tienen 1 hija mayor de edad ya trabaja, ella tiene sus huertas de zarzamora y aguacate, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar abono y agua para sus plantas, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años sus hermanos le dijeron que sembrara zarzamora y plantas de aguacate ya que en su comunidad se dan las frutas y también le enseñaron a plantarlas y cuidarla, su negocio es importante porque le proporciona ingresos para comer y para comprar otras cosas para su casa, ella se siente orgullosa de tener sus plantas de cuidarlas, que no les falte nada, su negocio es popular por el sabor de la fruta. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio plantar mas plantas para tener más frutas, ella está emocionada con su préstamo que va a recibir lo va a invertir en abono para que produzca mucha fruta, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir progresando con su negocio con sus hertas de zarzamora y tener salud para seguir trabajando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante en nuestros negocio y con la familia”. 
*La señora de pie que está atras de la señora del rebozo blanco no pertenece al grupo, pero de igual manera quería tomarse una fotografía**
texts.en:
Domitila is 39 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband who works in the field. She has 1 older daughter who is already working. 

She has her garden with blackberries and avocados. She is asking for a loan to buy compost and water for her plants. 

She began her business 7 years ago. Her siblings told her to plant blackberry and avocado plants because their community gives them the fruit and also teaches them to plant and care for them. 

Her business is important because is gives her income to eat and to buy other things for the house. She feels proud of having her own plants to care for, that lack nothing. Her business is popular because of the flavor of the fruit. She is planning to expand her business, planting more plants to have more fruit. 

She is excited with the loan that is is going to receive. She is going to use it for compost in order to produce lots of fruit. Her dreams and hopes are to continue to progress with her business and her blackberry garden and to have good health to continue working. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “thank you very much for the loans, thanks to you we can get ahead in our business and family.” 

Note: The lady standing behind the woman in the white shawl is not a group member, but wanted her picture taken.

loans.use: to buy compost and water for her blackberry seeding

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 45 years old and married with six children. He sells (omena) small dried fish to earn a living and he has been in the business for four years. His other source of income is from his employment. He describes his business environment as good because there is no competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to open a tailoring business for his wife. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy (omena) small dried fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy (omena) small dried fish for resale

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en: Cresilda is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. Cresilda makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks. Cresilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks

loans.name: Seliman

texts.en:
seliman  is a 30-year-old businessman  who lives in Juba. he is married, and has 3 children between the ages of 4and 12. 1 go to school. 

seliman  runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years.he has one employee he heard about Finance Sudan through other clients  and he  is taking a loan of 1500
 SDG to purchase more goods. In addition to this business he benefited alot from the the first loans, 

In 5 years,he wanted to open many branches and hopes to employ more people.

His  major challenges include inflation in the market. 

More loans should be given to other people.

loans.use: to purchase items such as a new radio, phone chargers, and phone lines.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The returns she gets from her farming activities.' Her biggest challenge is 'Seasonal changes affecting crops and animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyaboke.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because she wanted a good  quality dairy cow.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That they give loans to groups.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Florence replied 'They will get extra income for other needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Guerdy

texts.en: Guerdy is a 39-year-old single mother whose only child goes to school. She is a teacher and lives in a small, white and green wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, so she can finally get rid of her dirty, costly kerosene lamp. Mainly, she is looking forward to being connected as it will allow her to save money - Guerdy and her family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and then with up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a 29 years old, father of 4 children and living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He deals in leasing cocoa gardens, buying and selling cocoa and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expand cocoa growing. 

His main challenges are price fluctuations, expensive labor and inadequate capital for expanding the business.  Bonny wants a loan to lease cocoa gardens for harvest and selling to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace was born 49 years ago. She is married and the couple is blessed with six children. She was not lucky to joining secondary school like others but fortunately she finished primary school and thus, she knows how to read and write most words.
She owns a stone quarry where she gets blocks used for building residential and commercial houses. She sells these blocks in Kiserian, Kajiado and Isinya Town. Transportation of blocks is difficult when you are hiring than using your own lorry. Grace works hard such that in two years she is able to buy her own Lorry.

loans.use: Grace wants to increase the supply of building blocks by hiring at least two Lorries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy organic manures for her farm

loans.name: Faititili

texts.en: Faititili is 44 years old.  She lives in a small Samoan village and makes meat pies that she sells at a stand to both locals and tourists.  She has five children.  Two of her children are grown.  One is employed and helps contribute to the family finances; the other wasn’t able to finish school due to her troubled family finances, and helps Faititili with her business.  Faititili toils tirelessly with the goal of keeping her small children, and raising her family’s standard of living.  She will use a loan to purchase supplies in bulk (and thus at better rates) for her food sales.  The small pies she makes -- puff pastries filled with meat, cheese and/or vegetables -- are a Samoan favorite.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and supplies for her baking

loans.name: Sytath

texts.en:
Sytath is a widow with two daughters. She learnt to weave silk from her mother in 1984. She finished her studies in grade 8, and she is currently producing silk products at home and raising a few cows.

She has already taken and repaid a loan from MAXIMA three times. The current loan amount requested is $200. She will use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread.

Sytath is polite and friendly. Since she has been borrowing money from MAXIMA, she is able to send her child to school and her family is doing better day by day. They are sure to have the capability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is married and has 2 children. Asif has been running a café in the Beylagan city bazaar for 8 years now. When he first started, he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling $1,000. He used those loans to increase the size of his café. He also has an employee who works as a waiter while Asif cooks the meals.

He is now requesting $900 to purchase some tables and chairs for his café to accommodate a greater number of customers.

loans.use: To expand his cafe

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal M. is a 22-year-old farmer who sells pomegranates in his own village Varkhankend in the Imishli region of Azerbijan. He lives with his old parents. Kamal has two years of experience raising pomegranates and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Azerbaijan's climate is quite optimal for pomegranate tree growing, the average tree growing in 6-12 months. It starts to give fruit within a period of 8-14 months. Kamal has more than fifteen pomegranates trees in his garden. He gathers crops in the autumn and with the money from selling them he covers his family needs for the next three seasons. The conditions are hard but Kamal also has his small garden where he raises vegetables like potatoes and onions which he uses for food during the winter and spring.
Kamal is going to develop his business and start raising potatoes and onion for selling. He has enough experience in this field  and for this purpose he applied for 1200 USD.

loans.use: Going to start raising potatoes and onions for selling

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a small entrepreneur that sells clothes in Dar es Salaam. She is married to Stephen Mandara and has two children ages 15 and 20. Mary is a very hard worker and really loves her job and being an entrepreneur. This is Mary's third loan request from SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a big show case and office furniture. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy big showcase and office furniture

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo K. is the mother of 2 children and comes from a poor family. Her husband’s income does not cover all the household expenses. She sells maize gruel in the morning and fried yams in the early afternoon. She requests a loan of $200 to be able to buy the yams and bags of maize wholesale in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adjo K. est mère de 2 enfants et issue d’une famille pauvre. Les revenus de son mari n’arrivent pas à couvrir toutes les charges du foyer. Revendeuse de bouillie le matin et d’igname frite au bord l’après midi. Elle sollicite un montant de $200 pour pouvoir acheter en gros les ignames et les sacs de maïs afin d’agrandir la taille de son commerce.

loans.use: To buy yams and bags of maize wholesale

loans.name: Katogo A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Milly is 35 years old and divorced with two children. One of the children goes to school. Milly sells second hand clothes. With the extra business profits, she wants to  open up a bank account and start saving money. Fina is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to buy a water tank. Fase offers tailoring services and wants to buy an electronic sewing machine with the loan. Justine sells charcoal while Robinah sells used shoes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa I. is a married mother of two. Rosa, her husband Pedro, and their eldest daughter, all work in their small business distributing charcoal to the local stores and businesses.

For seven years, Rosa and her family have been distributing this important product to the city of San Lorenzo and the surrounding cities. Along with selling charcoal, she also sells helium balloons for parties and gatherings on the weekends.

With the loan she is asking for, Rosa and her family will continue to purchase more charcoal in bulk to meet their customer’s demands. Having the ability to buy in bulk will allow them to lower their prices, making them more competitive in the market.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Bella Isabel

texts.es:
Bella is a member of the communal bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 37 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband works in a shop. With the first loan she received, Bella invested in a business selling sodas. She gets up at 7 each morning to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and then works in her business selling sodas during the rest of the day. With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 5 cases of sodas, large and small, as well as other beverages for her business.

La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 4 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Bella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de gaseosas, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus gaseosas durante todo el día. Con este préstamo de S/. 1600 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 5 cajas de gaseosas grandes y chicas, agua cielo, etc. Bella esta muy satisfecha, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE BEVERAGES FOR HER BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO INCREASE HER SALES.

loans.name: Jeamileth  Del Carme

texts.es:
Mrs. A. lives in Barrio La Morenita No. 2 together with her family, her husband and one daughter. Through her own efforts she has successfully built a small home in which she hopes to construct a small room to divide into a living room, for which she is requesting $1,100.00. By her own efforts, she has created a traveling business selling children's clothing and cosmetics, successfully going forward in life together with her family. Her husband is a conductor in the merchandise transportation sector, through which he earns an income that allows him to help his wife maintain the home. Her main goal is to improve their home's condition as she is currently four months pregnant and, as a result, she must prepare the house in such a way that she can present her new baby with the basic conditions of life and family togetherness.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. habita en el Barrio La Morenita Nº 2, junto a su familia, su esposo y 1 hija; por esfuerzo propio han logrado construir una pequeña vivienda, en la que pretenden construir una habitacion para compartimentar la de la sala, para lo que solicitan C$.20,000.00, por esfuerzo propio realiza venta ambulante de ropa de niños y cosméticos, logrtando salir adelante en la vida junto a su familia, su marido es conductor de transporte selectivo, donde obrtiene ingresos que le permite apoyar a su esposa en el sosten del hogar, su objetivo principal es mejorar las condiciones del hogar, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con 4 meses de embarazo, por lo que debe preparar condiciones que le permitan recibir a su nuevo bebé con las condiciones básicas de vida y unidad familiar.

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline U. is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She sells all kinds of drinks. She learned her trade from her Aunty and started her business in 2003. She needs a loan of $600.00 to buy more drinks to sell. She says she is grateful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
Señora Fanny María A. is a very hard-working lady that is dedicated to her personal jewelry sale business in her municipality of Sandino City in Managua. She has been dedicated to this work for 12 years, offering bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.

It is necessary to emphasize that she is a mother of two children under her responsibility and in addition she cares for two grandchildren, that being a total of four people that she must maintain. For that reason she seeks the support of Ceprodel for the purchase of her jewelry to market in her work sector.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fanny María A. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de prendas personales en su municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 12 años ofreciendo pulceras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Es necesario destacar que ella es madre de dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y además atiende a dos nietos siendo un total de cuatro personas que mantener. Por este motivo es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de sus prendas para comercializarlos en su sector de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín studied cutting and sewing and from this decided to set up a tailor shop in his home two years ago. He makes jackets, sweaters and polo shirts and sells them at the local markets and to friends, who also give him special orders. His sisters help him sell his products on the weekends. Efraín is also a master construction worker and dedicates himself to this trade along with his tailoring. The loans he has received have helped him purchase the supplies needed to make his products, and the one he is currently requesting will be used for the same purpose. He would like to be done with his construction work and enlarge his shop so he can focus his efforts on solely tailoring.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Efraín estudió corte y confección, por ese motivo, hace 2 años decidió poner un taller de confecciones en su casa. Él hace casacas, buzos y polos que reparte la ropa en mercados y a amistades que le encargan pedidos específicos. Sus hermanas le ayudan a vender los fines de semana. Efraín también es maestro constructor, por lo que también se dedica a esta actividad en paralelo. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la materia prima que necesita para sus confecciones. Él quisiera dejar la construcción y ampliar su taller de confecciones para dedicarse íntegro a eso.

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed to make articles of clothing / Para comprar la materia prima que necesita para sus confecciones.

loans.name: Jairo José

texts.es:
Jairo B. is a miller in the county of Nagarote in the city of Leon. He is father to 2 kids who are at school and this is why he works so hard at his job.

It is important to mention that despite the difficult situations that he has been through for some years he has managed to move forward and bring food to the table. Now he needs economic recourses to buy work materials and to maintain the machinery. It is for this reason that he went to Ceprodel; to obtain the necessary credit and in this way continue the business for his and his family's benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Jairo B. se dedica a laborar en su negocio de servicio de molino atendido en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Es padre de dos niños en edad escolar y esta es la razón por la cual se ha esforzado grandemente en este negocio.

Es de importancia destacar que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones adversas que este caballero ha atravesado desde hace varios años, ha logrado salir adelante y llevado el sustento a su mesa. Hoy en día la necesidad que él atraviesa es la falta del recurso económico para compra del material de trabajo y mantenimiento de la maquinaria. Por este motivo es que sin dudarlo acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario y de esta manera continuar con el negocio para beneficio de él y de su amada familia.

loans.use: To buy work materials and to maintain the mill machines/Compra de materiales de trabajo y mantenimiento de maquinas de molino

loans.name: Khekh Niakk2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe khekh niakk2 est composé de cinq femmes. elles habitent au quartier Diakhao et s'activent dans la couture depuis dix ans. elles sollicitent ce pret pour renforcer leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Khekh Niakk 2 is composed of five women who live in the Diakhao district. They have been active in sewing clothing for ten years and are requesting this loan to bolster their business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing clothing

loans.name: Avaydillo

texts.ru: Назаров Авайдилло живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 42 года , женат и имеет пятерых  детей. Не имеет образования и поэтому работает в поле. Арендует землю, которую использует под посев пшеницы и картофеля. Хочет получить кредит для покупки удобрений и семян. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Avaydillo N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. He has no formal education and works as a farmer. Avaydillo rents a plot of land where he grows wheat and potatoes. He would like to take out this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season. Avaydillo is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys Marisol

texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. Gladys is 34 years old and married with two children. Gladys sells clothing at various regional fairs. On Sundays, she sells at the Americas fair. She occasionally sells from a mobile cart in the Nery Garcia market and also sells to other vendors on credit. She collects payments on a weekly basis. Gladys needs a loan of 600 soles to buy polo shirts, sweaters and skirts. Gladys’s dreams are to buy more merchandise, educate her children and open a store from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. Gladys es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Gladys vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región, los días domingos vende en la feria de las Américas, en algunas oportunidades vende ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García y también a los comerciantes, sus ventas son al crédito, sus cobranzas los realiza semanalmente. Gladys necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, chompa, faldas. Los sueños de Gladys son aumentar su mercadería, educar a sus hijos y tener un puesto fijo donde venda sus productos.

loans.use: Buy polo shirts, sweaters and skirts

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
“ It pains me when I see my grandchildren not being provided with the things they need”, says Juana O., a 61-year-old mother from Polomolok South Cotabato. Five of her children are already married and have their own family. She is already old and doesn’t want to depend on them because they have separate lives already. "What I need to do is to focus more on my store to increase my sales because I want to help my children raise their kids”, she added. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She also considers looking into some other possible income-generating ventures like retailing charcoal to augment her income.

She is happy that she became part of CEVI credit program, now she has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia S., 27, is single and has no children.  She has many years experience in selling various items to the villagers and general public seven days per week. Iulia has had four previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to purchase more goods for her shop.  Part of the loan will be used to purchase timbers, nails, and iron roofing to expand her shop location.

loans.use: Purchase goods for sale and timbers, nails, and iron roofing to expand shop location

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann maintains her rice vending business to help her husband earn a living for their family.  She wants to make her business grow so she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000.  The said amount will be utilized to buy a sack of rice that she will sell at retail price.  Aside from selling rice, Rose Ann is engaged in raising 45-day-old chicks that she also sells afterward.  One of her hopes is for her family to have their own house in the village.  
	 
Rose Ann is 26 years old and her husband Rolando is working as a rice and corn classifier.  They have a one-year-old daughter and they are currently living in her parents’ house and her husband is visiting them on weekends since he is working in a distant place.  She is thankful that she has a responsible and loving husband.

loans.use: purchase a sack of rice

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, aun no tienen hijos, la casa donde vive es propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, trabaja en comunión con su esposo en el transporte de pasajeros, mientras él es quien lo maneja y recorre las calles de su localidad brindando servicio de taxi a diversas personas, al final del día, es Lidia quien administra todas las ganancias. Ya son dos años que viene trabajando de esta manera y han obtenido ganancias satisfactorias, a pesar de la proliferación de los motocarros y con ello el aumento de la competencia, ellos se esfuerzan mucho para seguir obteniendo ingresos que logren cubrir sus gastos diarios. Esta es la primera vez que Lidia tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por el trabajo en su banco comunal, quiere aprender de su asesor de crédito y del resto de miembros formas para mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro y con lo que le reste quiere reparar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is 21 years old and lives with her husband. They do not yet have children, and they live in their own home. She owns a moto-car and works with her husband transporting passengers. While he drives the taxi and gives rides to various people, at the end of the day, it is Lidia who administers the earnings. They have been working this way for the past two years and have made good earnings despite the proliferation of moto-cars and with it, increased competition. They work very hard to keep earning the income they need to cover their daily expenses. This is the first time that Lidia has received a loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA), and she is very happy with her work with the communal bank. She would like to learn from her loan officer and the rest of the members about ways in which she can improve her business. With the loan she will repair the moto-car and with any that is left over she would like to make some structural repairs to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her moto-car

loans.name: Rakib

texts.ru: Ракиб по профессии телефонист, работает в местном узле связи. Ему 44 года, женат и воспитывает 4 детей. Несколько лет назад он купил небольшой участок земли с 3 комнатным домом. Его жена нигде не работает и сидит дома. Ракиб рядом со своим домом начал строительство нового дома. Год назад он пришел в Микроинвест и получив займ покрыл крышу жестяным шифером. Погашения займа произвел вовремя и источником денег для погашения была его заработная плата и дополнительное занятие животноводством. Сейчас Ракиб собирается купить доски для того, чтобы сделать деревянный пол в своем новом доме.
texts.en:
Rakib, a 44 years old communications specialist, works at a local communications hub. Rakib is married and has 4 children. A few years ago, Rakib purchased a small parcel of land with 3-room house. Rakib's is a housewife. Recently, Rakib began construction of another house on his property. A year ago, he obtained a Microinvest loan to cover the new house with tin roof. The previous loan was repaid promptly. Rakib will use this loan to purchase wood flooring for his new house.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood flooring materials

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Sagrado Corazón de Jesús que recide en la compañía Cabañas de la cuidad de Caacupé esta compuesta por 18 integrantes, todas de la misma zona, y actualmente estan en el décimo ciclo, participando del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Se benefician de las capacitaciones por ciclo que comprenden témas de integración del Comité, autoestima, ahorros, y presupuestos, asi mismo la institucion tambien les beneficia de un capital operativo que hoy por hoy asciende en un promedio de guaranies 6.033.000  por cada integrante.
El capital desembolsado de la Fundación directamente va acompañar el crecimiento de cada negocio mensionados anteriormente.

Todas las integrantes agradecen a la Fundación por este apoyo tan importante y esperan como siempre cumplir los reglamentos propuestos por la instituciòn para que sigan teniendo tan importante programa de apoyo  brindado por la Fudación Parguaya de Cooperación de Desarrollo.

1.	Salvadora Monzón              Tambo                          
2.	Ascención Monzón             Vivero de plantas            
3.	Simeona C.                 Tambo                          
4.	Ana Isabel G.           Vivero de plantas          
5.	Florencia O.             Realiza juegos de azar  
6.	Esperanza D.        Venta de dulce              
7.	Isabel L.                        Venta de dulce              
8.	Josefina S.                     Despensa                      
9.	Celina  M.                       Vivero de plantas           
10.	Claudelina E.             Despensa                      
11.	Maria Vidalia M.               Vivero de plantas          
12.	Gloria Monzón                      Empleada                      
13.	Maria Eulasia A.           Despensa                      
14.	Maria del Carmen G.  Venta de plantas           
15.	Cristina Mozón                     Venta de leche               
16.	Rosalina C.                   Venta de huevo              
17.	Maria Leticia C.         Venta de ropa                
18.	Hilda Daisy B.               Peluquera
texts.en:
The Sagrado Corazón de Jesús ('Sacred Heart of Jesus') committee, which meets in the Cabañas company of Caacupé city, is composed of 18 members who all live in the same zone, are in their tenth loan cycle, and participate in the Fundación Paraguaya's committee of women entrepreneurs. They benefit from the training in each loan cycle that cover topics such as committee integration, self-esteem, savings, and budgeting. They also benefit from the institution's working capital that grows day by day, averaging 6,033,000 PYG per member. The funds disbursed by the foundation go directly to aid growth in each of the businesses mentioned. All the members appreciate the foundation for its important support and expect to always follow the rules set by the institution, so that they can continue to have the important support program provided by Fudación Parguaya, of the Cooperación de Desarrollo. 1. Salvadora Monzón (Vendor) 2. Ascención Monzón (Plant nursery) 3. Simeona C. (Vendor) 4. Ana Isabel G. (Plant nursery) 5. Florencia O. (Makes gambling games) 6. Esperanza D. (Sells sweets) 7. Isabel L. (Sells sweets) 8. Josefina S. (Store) 9. Celina M. (Plant nursery) 10. Claudelina E. (Store) 11. Maria Vidalia M. (Plant nursery) 12. Gloria Monzón (Domestic worker) 13. Maria Eulasia A. (Store) 14. Maria del Carmen G. (Sells of plants) 15. Cristina Mozón (Sells milk) 16. Rosalina C. (Sells eggs) 17. Maria Leticia C. (Sells clothes) 18. Hilda Daisy B. (Hairstylist)

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of essential merchandise for stores, ingredients to make sweets, clothes, hair salon products, enriched animal feed, etc..

loans.name: Senia

texts.en: Senia T., 30, is married with three children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala. SPBD loans are Senia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, fertilizer, a plant sprayer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Vilayat A. is a 20 year old farmer who, for the last two years, has bred calves for meat production. Vilayat is not married yet and provides an income to his parents who he is living with. Being from a low-income family, Vilayat could not finish high school and had to join his father farming.

Vilayat has now got enough experience to separate from his father and he would like to buy two calves. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1200. Lets do our best to support this young hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase two calves for his business

loans.name: Kossi Kouma

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Il est marié et est père de 02 enfants. L’activité qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce des matériaux de construction. La plupart de ses clients sont des entrepreneurs, des maçons. Actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée. Il souhaite se réapprovisionner et demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in Adidogomé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. He is married and the father of two. The work he does that allows him to provide for this family involves commerce in construction materials. Most of his customers are entrepreneurs, masons. Currently, a portion of his inventory is exhausted. He would like to stock up again and is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy hardware products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware products

loans.name: Zefanias Armando

texts.pt:
Zefanias de 31 anos nasceu no distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, estudou até sétima classe e teve de parar com os estudos por falta de condições financeiras. Casado e pai de dois filhos de 12 e 06 anos e todos são estudantes. Vive na casa dos pais com esposa e filhos.

Comerciante e mais de 10 anos e dono do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 2,500.00MT a 4,500.00MT.

É pela primeira vez que pede empréstimo a Hluvuku, com o valor de 15,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o stock de produtos para maior diversificação e consequentemente maiores vendas.
texts.en:
Zefanias is 31 years old and was born in the Chibuto district in the province of Gaza. He attended school through seventh grade, when he had to abandon his studies because of financial difficulties. He is married and the father of two children, 12 and 6 years old, who are both in school. He lives in his parents' house with his wife and children. He is a merchant and has owned his own business for 10 years. He has no employees. He sells staple goods that he purchases in the wholesale market in Maputo. He earns between 2500 and 4500 MT a day. This is his first loan request with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 MT. He intends to increase his stock of merchandise to have a greater variety and thus increase his sales.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel M. R. reside en Ahuachapán junto a su esposo. Ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, la cual le ha proveído para muchos gastos del hogar, es por esto Isabel desea mejorar su negocio solicitando un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y de esta manera poder surtirlo para poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel M. R. lives in Ahuachapán with her husband. She runs a store in her home selling staple goods. This business has covered many household expenses and this is why Isabel wishes to improve it. She is requesting a loan that will enable her to obtain enough capital to improve her business and stock her store so that she makes better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple goods

loans.name: Adom Wowim Group

texts.en:
Lawrence T. is 25. He is married and has two beautiful girls who are in school. He works hard to provide for his children. He is an auto mechanic in his community. He started providing maintenance for his clients five years ago and acquired his skills from his competent master in Kumasi. Because of his rich experience he has attracted lots of customers who come to his garage to service their cars. His only challenge is that he pre-finances most of the work before his customers pay him. He said this has helped him maintain lots of customers. With the loan he wants to buy engine parts like jack plugs, gaskets, etc. 

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom wowim’. He is the only male and is sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Lidia

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Филимонова Лидия Николаевна родилась 1945. Она замужем и имеет  2 детей.  Лидия Николаевна работает в Психиатрической Больнице г. Душанбе старшей медсестрой. У нее мизерная зарплата. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 2300 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев  и  сделать косметический ремонт квартиры. Она благодарна инвесторам KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.

loans.use: Ремонт квартиры

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the city of Pagadian. She is 48 years old. Aida is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Aida is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sarina

texts.es:
Sarina vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera de un hijo, tiene un puesto de comida al horno (lecho de cerdo y pollo) que elabora ella misma, siendo esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar mercadería y compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, lo cual  le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la cliente.
texts.en:
Sarina lives in the home of her in-laws in the July 16 District of the city of El Alto. She is a single mother of 1 child. She manages a food stand where sells roasted pork and chicken that she prepares herself. This business is the main source of income that enables her to support her young son.

Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients and a few cooking utensils, which will help her improve her earnings.

This is Sarina’s third loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates that she is approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pork, chicken, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar E. de 63 años de edad, es un varon muy jovial y trabajador; Desde hace mas de 40 años trabaja en zapatería. Elabora calzado y lo distribuye en diferentes zonas del país. 

Esta profesión la aprendió de sus padres,  quienes en tiempos pasados se esmeraban en enseñar a sus hijos a trabajar en lo que ellos trabajaban. Así aprendió e inicio su propio taller desde muy joven para poder independizarse de sus padres y formar su familia.

Padre de 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, agradece los créditos que ha tenido puesto que le han permitido tener su propia instrumentaría, ya que cuando inicio, alquilaba las maquinas para poder sacar su producción.  Ahora cuenta con sus propias maquinas. Pese a que tuvo muchas pérdidas con la devaluación de la moneda, ha logrado levantar su negocio gracias a los créditos facilitados. 

Este crédito pretende invertirlo en material para bota militar, ya que en invierno se vende bastante y ya tiene pedidos de éstas.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de téléphone illico

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Abiba is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Abiba has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Maria M. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villa Nueva en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Claudia se dedica al comercio, vende ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños, en estos momentos esta un poco corta de presupuesto para invertir en su negocio, por tal razon necesita un credito para comprar mas ropa al por mayor, en esta epoca que ya viene la navidad las ventas son muy buenas y por eso es que ella desea invertir en comprar mercaderia, Claudia tiene esperado vender mucha ropa para la navidad.
su meta es poder tener una tienda en la cual pueda poner toda su ropa, ahora ella vende ambulantemente, sale a vender a diferentes colonias tambien se pone cerca del mercado, en las paradas de buses y ahi es donde mas vende.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria M. is 32 years old and lives in the Villa Nueva district in the city of Tegucigalpa. Claudia makes a living selling new clothing for women, men, and children. At present she does not have enough money to invest in her business, and that is why she needs a loan so that she can purchase more clothing wholesale.
