This is the time of year when Christmas is approaching and the sales are very good, and so she wants to invest in purchasing more merchandise. Claudia hopes to sell a lot of clothing for Christmas. Claudia’s goal is to have a store where she can put all of her merchandise, since she currently sells clothing as a street vendor. She goes out to sell clothing in different districts near the market as well as at bus stops, where she makes a lot of sales. This is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing jeans, trousers, shirts, undershirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, socks, dresses, and clothing for infants

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea S., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Kea Chanmakara, 28, live on an Island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2004 and have a young son.   

Sophea and his wife are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. He is requesting his first loan of $200 to purchase materials for his and his wife’s silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the family silk-weaving business.

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.en: Aeropaquita is a nurse by profession but the business that she started on her own is the sale of used clothes, though she also sells medicines. She has been managing this business for ten years; she began selling clothing on foot. Aeropaquita is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000, she reports that her loans always help her to live a little more comfortably.  She does not have any children. Aeropaquita has been struggling a little with her health but says that little by little she is getting better. Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to establish it in her home.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi P. is 68 and married with 8 children (ages 29 - 40).  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Lagi has 7 years of experience in this business.  Lagi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 tala or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Lagi joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lagi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lagi P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business

loans.name: Alihuseyn

texts.en:
Alihuseyn was born in 1952. He is single and lives in Baku city. He has been in the business of raising cattle for 8 years. 

Alihuseyn is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve and increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Pablo Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo M. es un agricultor que vive en palacio una comunidad del Viejo, Quien tiene una granja camaronera ubicada a 25km  de Morazán, (Palacio).
El Sr. esta solicitando este crédito para darle mantenimiento a la granja ya que  va a sembrar y necesita darle todo el mantenimiento necesario para sacer una buena cosecha.

El actualmente tiene 12 cabezas de ganado los cuales le ayudan a el a llevar el sustento a su hogar, además siembra maíz para tener mayores ingresos y así cumplir con sus obligaciones.

El ha tenido 5 créditos con la institución  los cuales le han ayudado mucho ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado CEPRODEL, ha venido engrandeciendo su ganadería y su granja camaronera.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo M. is a farmer who lives in the community of Palacio in El Viejo. He has a shrimp farm located 25km from Morazán (in Palacio). The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his farm and provide it with everything necessary to ensure a good output.

Pablo also has twelve heads of cattle which help to support his household. In addition, he plants corn in order to generate more income to meet his obligations.

Pablo has taken out five loans with CEPRODEL which have helped him greatly. He thanks CEPRODEL for providing assistance in expanding both his livestock operation and his shrimp farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inputs for maintaining his shrimp farm

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita G., 49, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Edwin G., a foreman construction worker, she is  blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn their living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling cooked food and managing her own variety store for several years.

Nenita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow six times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows as added working capital for her business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 6,700 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added working capital for her expanding business, allowing her to buy more food and products for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that they can save enough to cover their  children’s education. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more food and products for her store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 48 years old, married, and has five children – three boys and two girls. Her children attend school and they are excelling. Her husband is a retired civil servant.
Eunice sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and does not want to incur debts in her business. Eunice is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel G., from the village of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five school-aged children. To make a living, Russel owns and operates a business venture selling dried fish and dried squid in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Russel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities and is now requesting her first loan for 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: A. Alijon is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, he has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle. With the experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Alijon harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 1,400 USD to buy more cattle in order to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing wellbeing and security to the members of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Hemalatha

texts.en:
Hemalatha is a 56-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. They have two children, ages 29 and 26, both married.

Hemalatha's first job was food processing but it was not as profitable for the family as they needed it to be. Now, she has a business making and selling dresses and her husband and children provide support for her business. The family benefits from the hard work they put into the sewing business in the form of increased income.

Hemalatha does her job on-time and is a very honest lady. She is seeking a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy cloth and other raw materials for the sewing business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cloth and other raw materials

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of fruit in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital & to purchase more fruit to sell. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nang L. is the group leader selected by four people located in Ba Srae village in Takeo province. All the members will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Nang L. was born in 1949. Now she is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Since her breeding is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this breeding, Mrs. Nang L. is requesting a loan to buy pig food. She is a widow with a child who is an ice cream seller.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Née en 1958 en Côte d’Ivoire, Etat voisin du Bénin, A. Béatrice est mariée à SOGNIGBE Emmanuel et est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, deux des enfants sont encore à la charge du couple. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Agongbomè à Cotonou. Béatrice s’est installée dans ce quartier depuis neuf ans. Le couple le partage les différentes charges familiales. Béatrice n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Béatrice vend divers produits (sucre, lait, piles, conserves de sardine et de tomate, papier hygiénique, produits pour cheveux, savons, et des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Béatrice achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Béatrice a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés, mais avec quelques difficultés, vu qu’elle a été malade. Aujourd’hui, Béatrice désire renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est donc pour rehausser le niveau de ses produits que Béatrice sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Ivory Coast, a country bordering Benin, Béatrice A. is married to Emmanuel Sognigbe and is the mother of six children, all in school. Only two of the children are still in the care of the couple. Béatrice lives together with her husband and children in the Agongbomè area in Cotonou. She has lived in this area for nine years. The couple share the various family expenses. Béatrice did not go to school. To provide for herself and her children, she sells various products (sugar, milk, batteries, canned sardines and tomatoes, toilet paper, hair products, soap, and plastic kitchen utensils) at a store in her home. Béatrice buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which were repaid properly, but with some difficulty because she was sick. Today, Béatrice wants to strengthen her business and better respond to the demands of her clientele. It is thus to raise the level of her products that Béatrice is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (sugar, milk, batteries, canned sardines and tomatoes, toilet paper, and plastic kitchen utensils)

loans.name: Jenipher Adhiambo

texts.en: Jenipher Adhiambo O. is a resident of Lwanyange. She is a trained tailor but later became a housewife. She could not ignore her family's needs so she started vegetable farming and selling in the year 2001 in Nambale so that she could assist her husband in supporting the family. She realized that the venture was very lucrative and was inspired to expand it further. Due to insufficient funds, she requested a loan of Ksh.10,000 to boost her business and enable her to achieve her dream of being economically independent and able to afford a quality education for her children. Jenipher, who is 30 years old, married and a mother of four children is optimistic that her life will improve if she receives the loan.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase necessary tools for his shop

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 37 years old. Susana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Susana runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 12 years. Susana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Susana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
A. Jumaboy is 63 years old. He is married with two adult children. Jumaboy is a farmer. He plants wheat, onions, carrots, cabbages and garlic. At the same time he raises cattle. Jumaboy tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. 

Thanks to his savings, he was able to arrange the marriage of his son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, Jumaboy would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Jumaboy’s income and his family's living standards.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Orgil

texts.en:
Orgil A. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and five year old daughter in Hentiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a relations yard. His wife works as a bond teller in a company. Orgil currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2008 and has found success. He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. His daily revenue is a between 18,000 and 25,000 MNT (13-19 USD)and daily business expense is around 9,000 MNT (7 USD). 

For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation and to purchase new car for his business. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (980 USD)loan to purchase auto-parts and to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: To purchase auto-parts and to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Jhon; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de artesanía junto con su esposa trabajan en este negocio y sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a., hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompas, chalinas, collares y trabajos de arcilla.

 
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jhon belongs to the communal bank "Kukuli," which is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

He is 28 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children.  He has a business selling handicrafts with his wife.  They work in this business to provide for their children.  He works from 9am until 10 pm.  Jhon wants to expand his business.  He requests a loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, scarves, necklaces, and handicrafts made of clay.

Jhon is grateful to the people who make it possible for him to pursue his dream through these means, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sweaters, scarves, necklaces and handicrafts made from clay

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.en:
Burulkan A. is the group’s leader. She is 58 years old and married. Her husband is a pensioner. The couple has brought up 6 children, all of whom are already grownups and live separately from their parents. The family's main income is from farming. For twenty years they have managed to improve their financial position, educate their sons and organize their children's weddings. Their cattle stock has also increased. This loan's purpose is to purchase 8-9 livestock animals for fattening and breeding. In the future, Burulkan and her family intend to build a house, to develop their business and to obtain an automobile. 

Kasmaaly O., 25, is married. His family has 2 children of preschool age. As the head of the family, he raises funds by being a taxi-driver, and is planning to start his own business reselling cereals and potatoes (he has 5000 soms in cash and 1000 kg of potato). He is requesting this loan to purchase 3000 kg of potato (6 soms per kilogram) for further resale. Kasmaaly wants to increase his commodity circulation and to improve his financial position. 

Zinakul M., 48, is married. Her spouse is a farmer. The family has four sons, the eldest of whom are students and the youngest of whom are school pupils. Farming has the main family business since 1994. During the years, they have worked hard and have managed to improve their financial position and to increase cattle stock. The purpose of the loan is to pay harvest service. In the future, Zinakul is planning to obtain an automobile and then to obtain a lot near Bishkek.

Alym I. is the treasurer of the group. She is 57 and married. Her family has 7 children. The eldest of them live separately from parents and one of their sons and his family live with the parents. Their youngest is a schoolboy. The family makes its money on field work. They started farming in 1994, after obtaining a lot, and began to cultivate the land. Through the years they have managed to improve their financial position, to purchase several cars and also to arrange their son’s wedding. The purpose of the loan is to buy petroleum-based fuels. In the future, Alym is planning to increase her cattle stock, and then to buy a lot near Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Oinepu  Ole

texts.en:
Oinepu Ole K. is 31years old and he supports seven people in his family. He has been a wheat farmer for the last eight years.

This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climate conditions and adequate rainfall throughout the year.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members within his area of residence who are already registered clients. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

He is a hard working man and when supported financially he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 27 years old. She is married and has two children who are between four and six years old. All her children are enrolled in school and she also cares for one orphan who is a dependent. Her husband is a farmer. 

Dativa sells a variety of items in her shop such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, paraffin, and cement. She has had this business for three years. With this loan she will buy more items like sugar, cement, and cooking oil to sell. 

Dativa says that her business is successful because she manages to get what is needed for the well-being of her family, and the profit from this business will be used to buy a plot of land where she will establish her business. She  hopes to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cement, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Merima

texts.en:
Merima N. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Merima is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Merima owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merima has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merima has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Merima is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Merima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Martha Eliza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Calle #2. 

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 6 hijos, tres mayores y tres de 17,14 y 11 años, uno estudia en la Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en un taller de mecánica.
  
Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos,  perfumería y accesorios de damas). Trabaja todos los días dos horas por día. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y  bisutería, nos cuenta que lleva ya dos años en este negocio y que ha tenido sus altas y bajas, pero que con trabajo sigue adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería y otros productos. Esta en  el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta  porque los créditos son sucesivos. Su sueño es tener una casa nueva porque  la que tiene  esta en mal estado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the Nueva California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, there is a gathering of the members of the communal bank "Banco Comunal Calle #2" (Street #2 Communal Bank). 

This is the place in which we find Señora Martha.  She is 43 years old and lives with her partner.  Together they have 6 children, three of whom are grown and three who are 17,14 and 11 years old.  One attends the University, one is in high school and one is in grade school.  Her partner works in a mechanic's workshop.
  
Sra. Martha makes her living in sales.  She sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works for two hours every day.  The items she sells the most of are perfumes and costume jewelry.  She tells us that she has been in this business for two years and has had her ups and downs, but that with work, she'll continues to move forward.

This loan is for the purchase of lotions, perfumes, costume jewelry and other products.  Sra. Martha has been with the communal bank since its inception.  She likes the bank because of the consecutive loans.  Her dream is to have a new house, since the one she has now is in disrepair.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, lotions, costume jewelry, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes Pérez López, vive en la Ribera  Morelia Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas  México, vive en unión libre con el señor Galileo Vaquerizo Pérez, ellos tienen cuatro hijos de quien una de ellos ya está casada y tres quedan a su responsabilidad y son: María Luvia  de 14 años, el otro es Francisco Damián de 6 años y el más pequeño es Galileo Daniel.
        Ella se dedica a elaborar antojitos como son: donas, chicharrones, choco-bananas, roscas, entre otros y solicitó el préstamo  para la compra de ingredientes para que con ello pueda trabajar más días a la semana  y así tenga mejor ingreso en su hogar, con esta actividad lleva seis años  y comenta que le va bien  pues ha tenido  ingresos.
        Se inspiró en esta actividad ya que  también quiere  apoyar a su esposo aportando con los ingresos  de su hogar, así  tener lo más necesario en su familia y salir adelante trabajando juntos con su esposo.
        Con las ganancia que va obteniendo de su venta lo guarda para comprar más ingredientes  que le hace falta para su actividad, como también  tener para ser puntual en su pagos y así no tener ningún problema con la FRAC pues necesita el apoyo para poder trabajar.
       Su sueño es que logre ahorrar  para apoyar a sus hijos  que vienen creciendo darles estudio para que terminen una carrera  y de  ello dependan cuando ya estén grandes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Mercedes Pérez López lives in Ribera Morelia, Coapilla, in the state of Chiapas, México in a common law relationship with Mr. Galileo Vaquerizo Pérez.  They have four children.  One of them is married and three are still dependent on them:  María Luvia, 14, Francisco Damián, 6 and the youngest, Galileo Daniel.

She makes fast food snacks like: donuts, chicharrones, chocolate covered bananas, ring cookies, etc. and asked for a loan to buy ingredients so that she can work more days during the week and have better income for her home.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she comments that she does well because she’s had income.

She was inspired in this activity because she wants to support her husband contributing to household income and have what is most necessary for her family and together with her husband get ahead.

She saves the profits from her sales to buy more ingredients she needs for her activity but also to have enough to be punctual with her repayments so that she will not have any problems with FRAC because she needs its support to be able to work.

Her dream is to manage to support her children who are growing up and provide them with schooling so that they will finish careers they can depend on when they are grown.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make donuts, cakes, chicharrines (crispy fried dough snacks), among others.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kototala sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de poissons, de condiments, des fruits, des tubercules et d’articles divers.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Kototala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
WAWA D. s’approvisionne quotidiennement en fruits avec les revendeurs de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla, en détail,  au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Kototala group are married women, and they are, on average, 35 years old with three children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional extended families in the village of Coulibalyla, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as relatives and as neighbors, and they do business in fish, condiments, fruits, tubers, and various other products. This is the first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso for these women.

Wawa D. gets her daily fruit supply from distributors in Dioïla. She sells in the village square and on Dioïla market days. Her sales are retail, for cash and credit to both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used to pay the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 45 años, es separada de su esposo, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 2 hijos de los 5 en total que tiene, puesto que los tres son mayores e independientes. Está emprendedora madre de familia, todas las temporadas de verano vendía gaseosa en la playa y  hace 18 años con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar una bodega en su casa, y desde entonces poco a poco fue incrementado con productos comestibles. Sin embargo le molesta cuando sus clientes no le pagan a tiempo. Para Rosa, su negocio es muy importante, por ello tiene un buen trato hacia sus clientes, eso asegura la sostenibilidad de su bodega. En adelante desea ampliar su bodega, y acondicionar un espacio para la venta de licores de calidad. Es el 8vo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además en su grupo comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará licores de calidad para atender la solicitud de sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa is 45 years old and separated from her husband.  She lives in her own home with two of her five children.  The three oldest children live independently.  This hard-working mother started selling softdrinks at the beach during the summer seasons and over an 18-year period was able to establish a liquor store in her house, which has also become a grocery store.   What bothers her most is when her customers don't pay on time.  Her business is very important to her so she treats her customers well to ensure her store's sustainability.  She hopes to be able to expand her store and add a new space for quality liqueurs.  This is the 8th loan through MFP and as a senior member she is committed to paying it back on time.  The communal bank is very well respected because of how responsible she is.  She plans to use the loan to buy quality liqueurs for her customers.

loans.use: To buy quality liqueurs

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz R. is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin  Province. She is 42 years old. Paz is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling  ready to wear clothing & shoe products like NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen, tiene 35 años y se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general. El negocio Maria lo inició hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando su inventario y agregó otras mercancías, como calcetines, conjuntos de niños y ropa interior para damas, caballeros e infantil, pero eso si siempre ha sido apoyada por su esposo en sus proyectos de vida y esto la inspira a seguir adelante. Con este crédito, comprará calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, sabanas. Sueña avanzar en su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen, age 35, sells general merchandise.  Maria started her business ten years ago.  She has two minor children under her care.

As time passed, she was increasing her inventory.  She added other merchandise like socks, children’s outfits, and underwear for women, men, and children.  She has always been supported by her husband in all her projects in life, and this inspires her to keep going.

She will use this loan to buy footwear, cosmetics, general clothing, and sheets.  She dreams of advancing in the growth of her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its tannery industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 10 years. She is 27 years old and operates a utensils-selling business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She has no child yet; that’s why she spends her spare time doing her household responsibilities. Her brother and sister also live with her and contribute financially by doing work. Both of them are also involved in the same business. Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who wants to expand his utensils-selling business. With the loan, he will buy utensils of steel and plastic that will allow him to sell in larger quantity and make more profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Bashiran is confident that a loan investment will bring more profits to him and will expand his business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a good experience for her.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Bashiran.

loans.use: To buy steel and plastic utensils to sell

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din S. was born in 1962 and is a married woman who is blessed with four children. All four children are students in the local public school. Her husband, Din Ra, is 40 years old and works as a firewood seller in his village in Kompong Tom province. 

Din S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises pigs to earn a living. She has started to build a new house, but it is very difficult to save money and she has not yet been able to pay for construction costs. To solve this problem, Din S. is requesting her first loan to add to her savings and pay for the cost of building her house.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom are in school. 

Delia is a rice farmer in the Philippines.  She has been farming rice for the past 3 years.  To sustain her farming activities, Delia has borrowed and repaid 7 previous loans.   She has requested a new loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fetilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Delia  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda A., a 39-year-old married woman, wanted to help her husband in supporting the family, so they decided to open a Mini-Market. “Hamada Mini-Market” is the name of their store. It has been serving a wide area for two years now. Customers have came up to Raghda’s husband (since he is the one working at the store) and asked him to add more variety to their products. In order to satisfy their customers, Raghda applied for this loan to buy more products for their store and to improve the decoration of the shop.

Raghda is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for their Mini-Market and to improve the decoration of the shop.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El Sr. Rogelio utilizara su crédito para la construcción de un cuarto ya que comenta que  pronto  recibirán la llegada  de su  hijo,  por lo cual ve la necesidad de construir otra  habitación  para  que  el pequeño  pueda tener   su propio espacio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  ya  que  ve en el crédito la oportunidad de realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Mr. Rogelio will use this loan to build a room as his son is coming to live with him. He needs to build a bedroom in order for the youngster to have his own space. He is thankful for the support of this loan that will give him the opportunity to complete this project.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells multiple items such as the local dish, kenkey, and fish, and bags of charcoal. She is divorced but currently takes care of six dependants. Ekua has been selling kenkey and fish and charcaol for five years. Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcaol for resale. She anticipates building a cover for the charcoal with the new profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcaol for resale.

loans.name: Laura Lizbeth

texts.es: La señora Laura es propietaria de una microempresa de servicios de radio móvil trabaja con 45 móviles a su cargo, trabaja hace cuatro años en el mercado  es separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos varones de 5 y 7 años, ella sola mantiene el hogar,  la señora Laura. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una línea telefónica  por que sus clientes indican que su línea telefónica en horas pico se congestiona, y con otra línea telefónica de este modo poder brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes, es un apersona joven y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Laura owns a small mobile radio service business. She works with 45 mobile phones. She has been in the market for 4 years. She is separated from her husband and has two sons aged 5 and 7. Laura is responsible for all household expenses. 

She will invest the money in the purchase of a phone line, because her customers say that her phone line gets congested during peak hours. With the additional phone line she expects to be able to provide a better service to her customers. She is a young and hard working person, very grateful to the organisation for the support received.

loans.use: to buy a phone line.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 53 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the local community.

Natividad is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy peanuts, soft drinks, noodles and other daily basic needs to sell. Each month, Natividad earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Natividad hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, soft drinks, noodles and other daily basic needs to sell.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.es:
Hubert es de la zona rural de San Francisco, La Palmera.
El necesita un préstamo por el monto de ₡500.000, esta cantidad para lograr reparar su cochera, ya que la tiene en muy mal estado, y como parte de su casita desea que se vea mejor.
El pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco.
texts.en:
Hubert is from the rural area of ​​San Francisco in La Palmera.

He needs a loan in the amount of ₡500.  This amount is for him to be able to repair his garage, as it is in bad shape.  As it is part of his house, he wants it to look better.

He belongs to the Communal Loan Company of San Francisco.

loans.use: to repair his garage.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. 

Richard peddles cooked peanuts in different flavors. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional peanuts to sell.

Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal, 48, is a widow who lives with her two children. She has worked as a meat seller in a bazaar since 1995. At first, she started her business with a group of sellers, but she has been running her business individually since last year. Currently, her circulating assets are almost MNT 2,000,000. There is a necessity to make repairs to her house because it is becoming old and uncomfortable to live there.
 
She is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Povi Ernestina

texts.fr:
Povi est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un géomètre topographe. Elle a 02 enfants.
 Povi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2006. Elle vend à domicile. 
Elle achète les produits dans les marchés périphériques et au Grand Marché. 
Povi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentations générales et des mèches.
texts.en:
Povi is a woman of 32. She is married to a topographer and has two children. 

Povi has been working at selling groceries (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc.) since 2006. She sells them out of her home. She buys the products she sells in suburban markets and at the Grand Marché.

Povi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products and hair extensions.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Assad

texts.en: Assad is a 45-year-old married man and father of three children. He has worked in transportation since 1997 and is well known in the region because of his good reputation and customer service. His car is new and clean because he takes good care of it to continue attracting new customers. Assad is a hard worker who seeks the best to his family, providing them with good and healthy living, and giving them the best education possible. To keep his car healthy and good looking, Assad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva to do the necessary maintenance. He works hard on pleasing his customers to make sure they stay loyal to him. It is his only way to earn a living and he fights to improve it and hopes to open a transportation company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 42 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Allí  se dedica a vender mercancía variada, especialmente ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil. Su negocio lo inició hace 20 años,  comprando ropa para ella que luego la vendía al público, ya que le solicitaban la que ella elegantemente  lucia. Su principal clientela está situada en su pueblo natal entre los departamentos de Sucre y Bolívar, sus ventas las realiza a crédito  a una clientela acreditada y muy juiciosa con sus pagos a plazos. Su sueño es hacer crecer al negocio de tal manera que logre estudios profesionales de calidad para su hija. Con su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará ropa en todas las líneas, femenina, masculina e infantil, y está segura de una inversión exitosa por su experiencia, porque trabaja sobre pedidos y con mercancía de buena calidad, variedad y precios cómodos, así como también con plazos otorgados ajustados a su clientela meta. Carmen en su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 32 días, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 30 días, indicadores desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una inversión de su credikiva exitosa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and 10-year-old child. She sells a variety of merchandise, especially clothes for women, men, and infants. Carmen started her business 20 years ago, buying clothes that she would sell later to the public. She ordered clothes that have an elegant look. Her main customers are from her hometown and from the Departments of Sucre and Bolívar. Carmen extends credit to her customers and is very judicious with the payment terms that she offers. Her dream is to grow her business so that her daughter can pursue a quality professional education. With her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Carmen will buy clothing for women, men, and infants of all brands.

Carmen is confident that her investment will be successful because of her experience. She works primarily from orders and offers a variety of good quality merchandise at affordable prices. Carmen also adjusts her payment terms based on the customers that she is targeting. She manages to generate a profit from her sales within a period of no less than 32 days. Her accounts receivable period is 30 days. These indicators are the signs that predict her potential growth, which will increase with a successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for women, men, and infants.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 35 years old, married and has a five-year-old child. For the past seven years, she has been operating a mobile phone money transfer business to earn a living. In the same business premises, she sells African design fabric (kitenge). In addition, she bakes cakes and does event decorations. Regine has managed to run her business well because she has been trained in business management skills through Faulu Kenya. She needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy African design fabric (kitenge).

loans.use: to buy African design fabric (kitenge)

loans.name: C18514 Korubeho Group

texts.en:
Antoinette is 43 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 7 and 4. She is a businesswoman selling clothes. Antoinette is also the leader of this group, which is called "Korubeho" in the local language. This word means "effort" in English. Antoinette employs one person to help her and she has five years of experience. She starts her work at 7:00 a.m. and works until 6:00 p.m. every day. She is the first person on the left in the picture. 

Antoinette and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more products to sell, like salt, sugar, cooking oil, clothing and so on. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save for their futures.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.ru: Матлубахон умная, перспективная молодая предпринимательница. Она самостоятельно 6 лет занимается  этой предпринимательской деятельностью и имеет опыт в этом деле. Начинала она бизнес с $2500 США, а сейчас у нее товар на сумму $5000 США. У Матлубахон в ассортименте качественные парфюмерии и товары для женщин, которые очень востребованы. Она имеет репутацию честной, ответственной редпринимательницы. Матлубахон  хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США для покупки товара и расширения бизнеса. Матлубахон надеясь на вашу поддержку выражает свою признательность.
texts.en: Matlubakhon is a smart, promising young entrepreneur.  She has been running this entrepreneurship independently for six years and has experience in this business.  She started the business with $2500, and now her merchandise is valued at $5000.  Matlubakhon has a selection of quality perfumes and women's goods that are in high demand.  She has a reputation of an honest and responsible entrepreneur.  Matlubakhon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of goods and business expansion.  Matlubakhon hopes to receive your support and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and gift sets

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana de 39 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos. Ella vive en el centro poblado de CCatunrumi, Pichari, donde tiene su casa propia. Maximiliana desde muy temprana edad persió a su madre,y a los 19 años se comprometió con el padre de sus tres hijos, años más tarde él los abandono. Fueron momentos de tristeza, pero poco a poco salio adelante, y esto gracias al apoyo de sus hermanos y amigos, quienes le facilitaron un capital en calidad de préstamo, con ese dinero puso en marcha un pequeño negocio en su propia casa. Es así que se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir para niños de 0 a 6 años de edad, si uno visita la tienda de Maximiliana se queda sorprendido por lo bien ordenado y la manera como muestra sus prendas. Es todo estos detalles que hace que su tienda de prendas sea la más concurrida, por lo que ella esta feliz por los buenos beneficios que le deja el negocio que tiene. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago  de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará más prendas para niños y algunos accesorios para su tienda.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 39 year old single mother of three. She lives in the town of Catunrumi, Pichari, where she has her own home. At a very early age, she lost her mother and at age 19 she met the father of her three children, though some years later he abandoned them. There were moments of despair, but little by little she managed to pull herself up thanks to the help of her siblings and friends. 

They pulled together some money to provide her with a loan, with which she launched a small business in her house. She now sells children's clothes for children under age six. When someone visits Maximiliana's store they are surprised by the orderliness and the way she displays her clothing. She pays close attention to detail, making sure that her store offers the most current clothing. She is happy with the benefits that her business has provided her.  

This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner] and she is committed to meeting all her payments on time. With this 3,000 PEN [nuevos soles], she will purchase more children's clothing and some accessories for her store.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and accessories for her store.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José Ramón de 37 años, tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo. El negocio consiste en prestar el servicio de triciclo, además tiene su pulpería. Hace más 10 años inició este negocio con la venta de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, consomé, especies, cereales, pan, refrescos, productos lácteos, jugos. El es muy trabajador, empieza su actividad desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Solicito este préstamo para compra de materia prima. Su gran sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado ya establecido en un lugar estratégico.
texts.en:
José Ramón, 37, has 2 dependent children.  His business is a general store and tricycle lending.  He started the business more than 10 years ago selling basic grains such as rice, and sugar, beans, oil, consume, spices, cereals, bread, soft drinks, dairy products and juices.  He is very hard-working.  He opens his business at 7 am and closes at 9 pm.
He requested the loan to buy basic supplies.  His dream is to eventually have an established supermarket in an advantageous location.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, and sugar, beans, oil, consume, spices, cereals, bread, soft drinks, dairy products and juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more elder and children shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sirende Group

texts.en:
Esther is the facilitator of the Sirende group. Esther and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Esther takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Esther will build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sirende group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. Esther is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, a widow, resides in Mombasa, Kenya, where she has operated a grocery stall for six years, having started the business from personal savings. Rose learnt of Milango from her friends and, because she lacks the personal capital to make the purchase, is now requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to buy fruits and vegetables for sale. She looks forward to growing the business and employing more people in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Ritha is 40 years old, married, and has six children who attend school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, which she has been doing for eight years.

Ritha is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en: Saffie (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 52 years ago in Makeni city, Saffie is married and has five children.  For 27 years now, Saffie has been a businesswoman. Currently, Saffie sells market food: palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, tomatoes, etc. Saffie is going to use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, rice, tomatoes, etc.in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia Irene pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 58 años de edad y es casaca, la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales son todos ellos independientes, la socia es propietaria de una quinta restaurante en pleno corazón de Calca, la socia le ha puesto de nombre Quinta Kintachos, y es un acogedor local y cuenta con la amabilidad de esta señora que ha integrado a sus hijos para el mejor desempeño de su negocio, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus diferentes potajes; La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus diferentes potajes.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Irene belongs to the community bank Mamacha Asunta de Calca. The bank can be found in the province of Calca, which is in the Cusco department, an hour away from the city of Cusco.
She is 58 years old and married. She has 4 children who are all independent. She is the proprietor of a restaurant in the heart of Calca. She has given in the name Quinta Kintachos and it is a cozy place the benefits from the kindness of this lady who has also brought her children into the business so that it can grow. She is a hardworking woman and, at this time, she wants to invest her loan in buying supplies for preparing a variety of dishes. 
She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make a variety of dishes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Lilian is making and peddling corn snacks like binake & tilaob. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks.

Lilian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lilian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make corn snacks

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, age 39 years, is a married mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.
 
She has been engaged in farming rice and planting vegetables for 14 years while her husband buys bananas to resell to earn extra income for the family. This current occupation earns them approximately 27,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is the first loan for Thy with VisionFund. She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy a horse as means of transportation for selling bananas in the village. She hopes to sell her bananas timely and for a good price to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a horse as means of transportation for selling bananas in the village.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Martha Gladys

texts.en:
I have been working for five years in my small business, which is located in my home and is half a block from the Social Security building of out town. At the moment, I need to expand my business so that my daughter, who is in her final year of high school, can go to university to continue with her studies. The earnings I make help me with family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase bonbons, chiclets, confections, churros, sodas and other items.

Tengo cinco años de tener mi pequeño negocio que esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion y a media cuadra del Seguro Social de nuestra ciudad. En este momento necesito ampliar mi negocio ya que mi hija esta en su ultimo año de estudios secundarios y mi meta es enviarla a la universidad para que continue sus estudios. Los ingresos que percibo actualmente me ayudan con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de bombones, chiclets, confites, churros, refrescos y otros

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Auntie Pat, as she is called by her customers, sells necklaces, earrings, body and hair pomades, artificial hair and so on. She lives in a community where women dominate and so daily demands for goods by individuals is very high. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to purchase more goods to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Laumua

texts.en: Laumua is a married mother of five children. She is from the village of Sataoa and runs a taro plantation.  She started her plantation with an initial SPBD loan that she used to buy seeds.  She harvested 300 taro plants during her first harvest.  After two harvests, she made ST 500 (about USD 200).  Laumua has invested some of this revenue into more taro plants and now has a total of 4,500 plants.  Her dreams of growth aren’t over and she aims to expand further.  Her husband and children are very excited about the extra income and they notice the satisfaction it brings their mother in being able to support the family.  She is seeking additional loan funds to make some improvements to her plantation and her home.  She needs to purchase fencing material, a lawnmower and make some necessary repairs to the floor and roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy a chain-link fence, lawnmower and make home improvements

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin J. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan He is married and has five children. He makes doors and fences in his yard from iron. Elchin has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2003 and is one of their best clients. Since 2003 he has received four loans, which total $2,800,  for his business from them. In 2003 his loan was in the amount of $400. In 2004 he borrowed $600; in 2005 he borrowed $800; and in 2006 he borrowed $1,000. Now he needs $1,200 to buy more equipment for his business.

loans.use: for buying equipments

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs. Silvina is 43 years old and has been with Mr. Elario Mendez for 25 years who works  in construction .  They have 5 children one of 25 years already married, Zunilda of 22 that wishes to study secretaryship, Fabiana of 19 that is dedicated to sales and Cinthia of 14 years old is still in school school. 

Doña Silvina is a very ambitious woman, always dedicated to the purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables.  Through the shared group of women granted in the Paraguayan Foundation, they began with a capital of $ 60 for its pantry, and with time and its constant work, Silivina, obtained that its business grew gradually. Now it has greater variety of merchandises like fruits, vegetables, milk, bread, flour, sugar among others. She dreams that their daughters can become professionals and form a happy home, like the one of her, since even though they did not have much to eat.

She needs the loan to buy merchandises like notebooks, papers, fine cardboards, pencils and all the articles of bookstore, since near his house there is a small school and the students ask for these equipment frequently.




ORIGINAL SPANISH

La Señora Silvina tiene 43 años  esta en pareja con el Sr. Elario Mendez  hace 25 años quien se dedica a la construccion, tienen 5 hijos uno de 25 años ya casado, Zunilda de 22 que desea estudiar secretariado, Fabiana de 19 que se dedica a la venta, y Cinthia de 14 que esta en el colegio.

 Doña Silvina es una mujer muy asendosa, siempre se dedicó a la compra y  venta de frutas y  verduras, hasta que consguió un prestamo através del grupo solidario de mujeres otorgados en la Fundación Paraguaya, comenzó con un capital de $ 60 para su despensa, y con el tiempo y su constante trabajo, Silivina, logró que su negocio creciera paulatinamente. Ahora posee mayor variedad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, leche, pan, harina, azúcar entre otros. Ella  sueña  que sus hijas sean profesionales y formen un hogar feliz, como el de ella, ya que aún cuando no tenían para comer la familia tenía mucho para compartir.

Necesita el credito para  comprar  mercaderías como cuadernos, papeles, cartulinas, lápices y todos los artículos de librería, ya que cerca de su casa hay una escuelita y los alumnos solicitan con frecuencia estos útiles.

loans.use: para  comprar  mercaderías como cuadernos, papeles, cartulinas, lápices y todos los artículos de librería

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela, a widow, lives in the Santiago Primero area of El Alto, next door to her daughter and son-in law. She sells food on one of the city’s busy streets.

She would like to use her loan to purchase a kiosk to better serve her customers and to improve the conditions under which she prepares her food.

She has previously worked with Impro for a loan and, given an evaluation of her credit history and cash flow, she would make a good loan candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela vive en la calle 1 de la zona Santiago Primero de la ciudad de El Alto. Se dedica a la venta de comida en una de las calles populosas de la ciudad. Ella es viuda vive junto a su hija y su yerno. El crédito que Angela solicita será invertido en la compra de un kiosco y así mejorar la atención a sus clientes y las condiciones de sanidad necesarias para un negocio como es el de vender comida. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro. Angela es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito pues muestra un flujo de caja aceptable.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Winifrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling soft drinks and mineral water. She is not married and has one child aged 5 years. She really enjoys her job and dreams to become a successful entrepreneur. This is her second loan request to SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a big showcase, chairs, tables, and improve her stock . She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a big showcase, chairs, tables, and improve her stock

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
Mrs. Augusta A. is 58 years old. She is separated and has 3 children. Two of them are married and one daughter lives with her and both studies administration and works in order to contribute to the household income.

She started out with a small café where she served food for many patrons. After that, she learned how to make pastry and candy and opened up sweet shop in her home. She currently teaches pastry-making at a school near her home.

Augusta says that the loan will be of great use to her because it will be easier for her to obtain a discount on supplies if she pays in cash.

She is also preparing an area in her home to open up an ice cream parlor, taking advantage of the hot summer season. She is requesting this loan in order to buy milk, sugar, flour, vanilla extract, yeast, fruit, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Augusta tiene 58 años de edad, ella es separada, tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos casados y una hija que vive con ella que es estudiante de Administración, además trabaja, y también colabora con los gastos de la casa.

Augusta comenta que en sus inicios ella tenía un copetín, donde daba de comer a muchas personas, luego estudió repostería y confitería, entonces decidió abrir su microempresa de confitería en su domicilio. Actualmente enseña repostería en una escuela cerca de su casa.

Augusta dice que el crédito es de gran ayuda ya que le facilita la compra de sus materias primas, al contado, pues de esta forma obtiene mejores descuentos.

Actualmente está preparando espacio en su casa para habilitar una heladería, aprovechando la época de mucho calor. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como leche, azúcar, harina, esencia de vainilla, levadura, frutas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of confectioner’s supplies such as milk, sugar, flour, vanilla extract, yeast, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
My name is Shamim H. and I was born in the small town of Pakpattan but now live in Borewala, Pakistan with my family. I need a loan to buy my son a rickshaw. My husband is a rickshaw driver and has trained our boy in this trade. Therefore, I feel that my son will do well with a rickshaw of his own.

I am the leader of a group that includes four other women. We are all committed to eradicate poverty in our community. Noor B. wants a loan for her son’s cotton-trading business. Hanifa B. needs a loan so her son can supply flour to various shops in our city. Amna B.’s husband runs a canteen and wants to buy furniture for it. Sabra B. will use her portion of the loan to start a small shoe-making business.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and other supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Hidajeta

texts.en: Hidajeta was born in 1966. She is married and lives with her husband in Jaruške, near the town Banovići. Her husband works in a limestone mine and he can earn 500KM monthly. Hidajeta works in agriculture and she can earn about 200KM monthly by selling milk products. She is going to use this loan of 1000KM to buy a calf and fatten it, along with her other stock. She wants to increase her animal resources in order to increase the monthly income of her family.

loans.use: Buying a calf.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 52 years old and the mother of five children.

With the first loan Noemí received from Manuela Ramos she invested in a river transportation business and now has a boat. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and then heads to the port where she works until 10:00 p.m.

With this loan of $1,075, which she plans to repay in six months, she will buy materials for her boat including wood, nails, rope, tarps, tar and fuel.
