Noemí is very happy because of what she has overcome to be able to support her family and give them a better life and good education. Her children are proud of her and very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting their mother’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 5 hijos. Noemí con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de transporte fluvial. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un bote, se levanta a las 5am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dirige al puerto para dirigir las labores en su pequeña embarcación hasta las 10pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: materiales para la refacción de su bote como madera, clavos, sogas, mantas, brea, combustible, etc. Noemí esta muy feliz , porque ha tenido que pasar mucho para lograr dar tranquilidad a su familia y así poder brindarles una buena vida y una buena educación, ellos están orgullosos de ella y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: Boat owner will buy materials for her boat

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José is married and has two children: José Eduardo who is 24 years old and Mario is 19 years olds. His sons do not help him in his business because they are students.

He started a business because he wanted to have his own workshop because at the time he was unemployed and needed money. That was five years ago. He had this opportunity in his friend's workshop, where he trained for a while and then became independent.

He is asking for a loan of $400, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase a special tool kit for installing carburetor parts. With your support Don José can continue to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

José esta casado, tiene dos hijos José Eduardo de 24 años y Mario de 19 años, ellos no le ayudan en el negocio porque son estudiantes

El emprendió un negocio con el deseo de iniciar su propio taller, ya que en ese momento estaba desempleado y necesitaba dinero, esto fue hace cinco años, le dieron la oportunidad en un taller de un amigo, de aprender por un tiempo, y luego se independizo.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un kit de herramienta especial para la instalación de equipos de carburación. Con tu apoyo Don José seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Comprar herramienta

loans.name: Carmen Faustina

texts.es:
Carmen started her business because she needed to support the family finances, and since in that moment (5 years ago), she was pregnant with her first son, she needed a job where she wouldn't need to leave the house. This is why she decided to sell shoes and linens by catalog, since it would be her best opportunity to obtain better income before the expenses that were nearing because of the birth of her son. She is still doing this activity, and until now it has given her good income. Now she is expecting her second son.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and to sell more, so she will be able to get ahead with her business. With your help, this will become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Carmen, inició el negocio porque necesitaba apoyar en la economía de la casa y como en ese tiempo (hace 5 años) estaba embarazada de su primer hijo, necesitaba un trabajo donde no necesitara salir de esta, así que se decidió por la venta de zapatos y blancos por catalogo , ya que seria su mejor oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos ante los gastos que se aproximaban por el nacimiento de su hijo, y asi lo fue esta actividad continua desarrollandola hasta la fecha lo que le ha dado buenos ingresos, ahora se encuentra esperando a su segundo hijo.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía y vender mas, para salir adelante con su negocio, con tu ayuda esto se hara realidad.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Oyzodakhon

texts.en:
A. Oyzodakhon is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. Oyzodakhon owns a vendor shop in the famous central market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand town. For more than 10 years, she has been selling soft drinks and juices. Oyzodakhon is the only bread-winner in the family, since her husband is currently unemployed. She is very hard-working, and her store offers a wide range of goods at affordable prices. She has loyal clients, and her business brings in stable income for the family. One of Oyzodakhon's dreams is that her children achieve a lot in their lives through obtaining good education. Therefore, making considerable financial sacrifices, she is paying for their studies at a university. 
During the current hot season, the goods at Oyzodakhon's store are in high demand. Therefore, Oyzodakhon is asking for a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more goods for sale. The loan will be repaid within 6 months and will greatly help her reach her business goals.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is the married, 43-year-old mother of three children. Melania grows root crops and cereals on her land in the community of Sachabamba, a district of Chiara, located three hours from the city of Ayacucho. Melania plants her crops twice a year, during July for her small farm which she harvests in January and during November which she harvests in July. She sends her crops to the city of Lima and sells them to wholesalers with the help of her son. Furthermore, Melania has a car to transport her goods to the city of Ayacucho.

Melania needs a loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 900) to invest in replacement resources and to maintain her car. Melania is a member of Las Entusiastas Bank.

Melania’s dream is to buy a trailer to transport her products and that her younger son finishes school and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to invest in replacement resources and to maintain her car

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia Estela A. N. is 37 years old, she is married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old and are studying on second and third grade of primary school, her husband works as a community instructor of viral illnesses in order to prevent them. Mrs. A. had required the loan to improve her economic conditions through her business which is to elaborate and sell baking goods, which learned from her parents. Her dream is to improve the conditions of her small bakery and create employment to others, provide studies to her children and to be one of the most well known bakeries on the local level and to create the best possible products for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia Estela A. N., tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los 5 y 7 años de edad actualmente cursan el segundo grado y tercer grado, de primaria, su esposo trabaja en el area preventiva de enfermedades de origen viral desempeñandose como instructor en las comunidades. La señora ha requerido del apoyo de nuestra institucion con el objetivo de poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas siendo este la elaboracion y venta de cosa de horno, ya que es el oficio que le heredaron su padres, su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su pequeño taller y generar empleos, por consiguiente brindar estudios a sus hijos y llegar a ser una de las proveedoras mas reconocidas a nivel local, ofreciendo para ello condiciones tecnicas para generar empleos y un producto de calidad a quien guste de su mercaderia.

loans.use: Working Capital / Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Magdalena Marlen

texts.es: El domicilio de la señora Magdalena, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en un pequeño departamento en alquiler;  se dedica a la administración de un taxi que utiliza para el transporte publico, del cual recibe una renta diaria de 100 Bs. También tiene una segunda actividad que es la costura. Se dedica a la administración de su taxi hace 4 años; es por eso que este crédito será destinado al mantenimiento de su vehiculo ( compra de llantas, accesorios etc.). La sra Magdalena  es madre soltera tiene un niño de 8 años que depende de ella. Es cliente de nuestra institución  hace 3 años y solamente trabaja con nosotros e indica que realmente le gusta trabajar con Emprender por las facilidades de pago, comenta que para ella es muy fácil juntar la cuota ya que sus ingresos son diarios.
texts.en:
Magdalena's home is located in the populous region of Alto Tejar in the city of La Paz. She lives in a small apartment. She manages a taxi that she uses for public transport, from which she earns a daily rate of 100 Bs. She also runs a second business, that of a tailoring shop. She has been managing the taxi service for 4 years and this loan will be used for maintenance of the vehicle (to purchase tires and accessories etc.). Magdalena is a single mother that has an 8 year old boy who counts on her. She has been a member of this institution for 3 years and has been exclusively with us meaning that she truly likes to work with Emprender for the easy pay plans. She has mentioned that it is easy for her to amass the payments given her daily earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 33, is married with five children living at home in Kampong Chhnan province. She works grinding rice, typically making US$ 10 each day and her husband is a mechanic and workman. Her husband, Chea Chheung, typically makes about US$ 2 each day. Chan P. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to increase her stocks of rice. She will take off the rice husk and then sell the grains.

loans.use: To grind rice

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary U. is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs at Mami market. She sells foodstuffs like groundnuts and palm oil, stockfish, tomato paste, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Assisted by her husband and children, Zarifa Q., a mother of 10, has been raising livestock for 20 years in the small village of Imishli, located in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Because Zarifa and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price, each morning she arises early so that they may graze among the hills all day.

That she and her family are able to sustain themselves fills Zarifa with great satisfaction, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to expand her enterprise. With your support, Zarifa will be able to accomplish her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Mrs. Sreymom V. was born in 1983, and she now lives in Tram Roneap village in Kampong Speu province. She is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Suong Bunna, is a bodyguard who also earns a little salary to support the family. Although Mrs. Sreymom V. and her husband try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sreymom V. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family members to live in and have a better life. Mrs. Sreymom V. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only a year old. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To help build a new house for her family to live in and have a better life.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
“Work hard to achieve the best”, is a quotation lived by Josephine Q..  She is engaged in hog-raising business, an enterprise that she wants to grow through hard work, so that she can support the needs of their family especially for the education of their children.

She is 45 years old, married to Romeo, a farmer, who also guides her in the hog-raising business.  They have seven children: Jayson, 20,  and Jocelyn,18, both elementary undergraduates; Mylene,15, elementary graduate; Jessica,13, second year high school student; Jemalyn, 9, in elementary grade two; Racelle,5, a pre-school student and Regie, 3 years old. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of around PHP6,000 that she will use to expand her business by purchasing additional hogs and feeds.  She hopes and will strive hard to improve her business to meet the growing needs of their family, particularly that the prices of commodities are increasing.

loans.use: for business expansion, purchase hogs and feeds

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia Q. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. According to Sophia, her two children are in the basic school. She says her husband trades in raw gold and products made of it. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

Sophia works as a petty trader to help her husband meet the demands of the family. She deals in cereals such as maize, rice, beans, etc.; she travels from her town in the south all the way to the north to procure goods. Sophia says she distributes to food vendors in her community and also treks to markets in nearby towns to do business. She has been in this business for five years. Sophia wants a loan to be able to procure goods in bulk at each trip so she can save herself from making frequent trips to procure goods. She hopes to save enough to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Geyling Mara

texts.es: Geyling es casada, tiene  un hijo de 8 meses, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la finca a 15 kilometros de la colonia, y se encarga de los gastos familiares,  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de repellar lacosina y hecharle el piso), trabaja como docente desde hace 10 años,  ella asume con los gastos familiares de sus padres ya que son de escasos recursos economicos y de los compromisos adquiridos,  es una joven responsable, honesta  trabajadora  y muy querida en su comunidad  pues ayuda a muchos niños campesinos de su comunidad,bella vive en la colonia San Pablo a 25 km de Nueva Guinea, es una docente que ama su trabajo, actualmente esta estudiando su 3er año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Expresa que se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Geyling is married, and she has an eight-month old son. She depends on the support of her husband who works in a finca around 15 kilometres from their suburb. She is in charge of managing the family budget, and is asking for financing through their fifth loan in order to invest the money in improving their house (finishing the plastering and laying the floor). She has worked as a teacher for the past 10 years, and also meets the expenses of her parents as they have very few economic resources and many commitments. She is a responsible young woman, honest and hard-working and very loved in her community as she has done a lot to help the labourers' children in her community. She lives in the suburb of San Pablo 25 kilometres from New Guinea. She is a teacher who loves her work and currently is studying her third year in the URACCAN university in Recinto, New Guinea. She expressed her gratitude for AFODENIC's help as with the previous loans she has bought domestic appliances and approved the house in which she lives. Her dream is to have a beautiful house and to work to ensure her son gets ahead in life and to help her mother with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the kitchen and lay a floor

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
“There is a positive side to every situation if we simply make the choice to find it," says Hermie, who is twenty-five years old, single and a man with simple dreams.  He is still living with his parents and his two siblings are also working.

Hermie is getting married soon.  This is the reason why he is working hard to make sure that he can provide a stable life for his future family.  He owns a community-based variety store in their village and at the same time works as a tricycle operator.  

His loan request of $175 will be used to buy more stock for his store and for the maintenance of his tricycle, so they will have a stable source of income.

loans.use: To buy more stock and tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Solopeta

texts.en: Solopeta F., 42, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the lawn mowing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Solopeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for loans at the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a new mower and labour cost for maintenance of old mowers

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 29, pictured here with her husband, is a weaver and a grocery vendor, typically making $2 every day. Her husband sells wine and works on the farm, on average also earning $2 per day. This couple lives in Takeo Province. Neang would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr:
A. Débora est née vers 1979 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN, d’où elle est originaire. Débora est mariée et mère d’un garçon de trois (3) ans qui est à la maternelle. Débora vend des chaussures à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin depuis sept (7) ans. C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin que Débora achète ses chaussures. Débora a déjà bénéficié de crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Actuellement, Débora sollicite un autre crédit pour continuer de développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 
	.
texts.en:
A. Débora was born around 1979 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin, to where she traces her roots. She is married and the mother of a 3-year-old boy who is in nursery school. She has been selling shoes at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, for seven years. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, is where Debora purchases her shoes. She has already benefited from a loan from ALIDÉ to develop her business. Currently, she's requesting another loan to continue developing it, in order to respond better to customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five boxes of shoes

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de bè-plage qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle vend à des couturières et tailleurs. Le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de couvrir la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 rouleaux de tissus popelines et des tissus. Avec le revenu de son commerce  elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Akou A. is a resident of the Bé-Plage quarter, a central quarter of the city of Lomé. She is a married mother of one child. She generates a living through her cloth-making and fabrics business, selling to tailors and dress-makers. The stock that she currently is insufficient to meet the demand of her clientele; therefore she is requesting from WAGES a loan to buy two rolls of poplin fabric and other fabrics. With the revenue from her business she plans to contribute to helping with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Juana Teresa

texts.es:
La señorita Juana tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.  Ella es socia del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”
La empresaria presenta estudio superiores completos.
Juana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de Unique, Avon y Esika
Este es el primer crédito que solicita, ella requiere 300 soles para invertir en su negocio, comprará mas productos de belleza para tener en stock y poder vender con mas rapidez y facilidad.
También ha empezado a comprar vitrinas y  mostradores para colocar sus productos en su casa y posteriormente alquilar un stand en una tienda comercial en trujillo.
Juana tiene como sueño incrementar su negocio, ganar mas clientes y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana, 31, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Las Emprendedoras II Community Bank. She has a college degree. Juana sells Unique, Avon, and Esika beauty products. This is her first loan. She needs 300 PEN to buy more beauty products to have in stock. Then she will be able to sell faster and easier. She has also started to buy display cases and counters for her products in her house. Later, she will rent a stand in a store in Trujillo. Juana’s dream is to expand her business, gain more customers, and get greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to stock her inventory

loans.name: Happy Family Group

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and married. She is a plantain seller and sells at the community market where she lives. She obtains her stock of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She lives with her husband, who is usually able to help her buy her plantain stock, but recently there has been a fall in demand in his business and he has not been able to provide her with enough money to make her purchases. Due to inadequate capital, she is not able to pick enough plantains from her suppliers. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy plantain stock. With her two years of selling experience, she was chosen to be the group leader.

Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Happy Family.’ She is the one sitting in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of plantains

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.es:
el sr. Edwin M. tiene 27 años de edad y es residente de la colonia San Francisco, el tiene un  negocio en el cual vende accesorios para telefonos moviles, los productos que el vende son protectores, cobertores, cargadores de carro y pared, baterias y pantallas para celulares, este negocio lo tiene hace 6 años, anteriormente el vendia repuestos para vehiculos en el parque el obelisco y tambien se dedicaba a la albañileria.
el tiene un hijo, esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa, con este negocio el logra sacar adelante su hogar, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, quiere abastecerse de mucho producto para poder tener para varios meses. tambien quiere comprar diferentes estilos.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin M. is 27 years old and lives in the San Francisco housing development. He owns a cellular phone accessory business, selling products like covers, cases, car and wall chargers, batteries, and screens. He has been in business for 6 years. He used to sell spare parts for cars at the El Obelisco Park, and he also worked as a bricklayer.

He is a married father with one son. His wife is a homemaker, but he has managed to support his household with this business. He needs this loan in order to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices. He wants to stock up with enough products to last him several months. He would also like to purchase a variety of styles.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair their residential house. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to have a little bit more comfortable shelter to live in and to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix vive en casa propia en la zona 16 de febrero de la Ciudad de El Alto; es casado, su esposa es comerciante y tiene un puesto de venta en la misma zona de abarrotes, tiene cuatro hijos que aun están en edad escolar, trabaja como empleado grafico en la ciudad de La Paz, esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso.

El crédito lo destinará para refaccionar su vivienda y aumentar dos cuartos, para la comodidad de su familia.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.

loans.use: Costo de aumentar dos habitaciones en su casa para vivir con meyor comodidad.

loans.name: Los Naranjos3303974 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Naranjos tiene un año de trabajar con adim y está integrado por Abismael Arsenio M. M., Francisca Teodora Velázquez L. y Lino Nemesio Velásquez L.. Ellos son provenientes del municipio de Nindiri.

El coordinador del grupo es  Abismael Arsenio M. M. tiene 37 años de edad el tiene una pequeña sastrería desde hace cuatro años en la comarca Buena Vista. Él desea aumentar sus ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, tijeras, botones entre otros materiales.

Los otros dos integrantes del grupo son Francisca Teodora Velázquez L. de 62 años que desde hace doce años trabaja vendiendo verduras en el M. de Masaya y Lino Nemecio Velásquez L. de 41 año quien es vendedor ambulante de verduras en el M. oriental.

Ambos desean invertir su préstamo en la compra de verduras como yuca, chayote, ayote, pipián, zanahoria…etc.

loans.use: Para adquirir materiales como telas, hilos etc. para realizar trajes

loans.name: Tres Combos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Tres Combos está conformado por Emilia de Carmen Z. S. quien comenzó vendiendo helados y choco bananos y actualmente vende ropa, Mariela del Socorro P. quien vende perfumes y ropa,  Maritza del Socorro L. vende helados y choco bananos y Ana María P. vende ropa. 

Todas ellas neceitan el crédito para por invertir en su negocio y salir adelante. La meta inmediata de ellas es mejorar su calidad de vida por ella y sus familias.

loans.use: comprar ropa y perfumes

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
En el mercado el bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Isabel V. se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosas tortillas las cuales son vendidas por ella misma siendo muy visitada por los clientes que compran las tortillas.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio y beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo para mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
At the Bisne Market in the department of Chinandega, Sra. Isabel V. is known for making delicious tortillas. She sells them to customers who come visit her.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients, such as corn. This will enable her to continue improving her business and also help her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario cristo rey esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son tres miembros los de este grupo y a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Catalina L. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Adalid Araujo tienen un hijo que depende de ellos.  
la señora L. se dedica a la costura desde hace unos 30 años, elabora vestidos, faldas, arregla pantalones, necesita el prestamo para comprar tela y juguetes ya que para esta epoca navideña vende bastante.
 
Gloria Emerita R. tiene 66 años de edad, es soltera, vive sola en su casa, no tene hijos que dependen de ella su unica hija vive en Costa Rica y ella se dedica a la comercializacion de perfumes,cremas, acsesorios de limpieza y enchape. esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos ya que la epoca de navidad es buena para el comercio.
 
el señor Oscar Elvin M. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la compra venta de pescado y cerdos.  los cerdos los destaza para luego comercializarlos, esta actividad la realiza
desde hace unos 6 años, sus ventas las realiza en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas cerdos y pescados.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey Solidarity Group is located in the Buena Vista neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. There are three members and the details of their business activities are described below:

Sra. Catalina L. is 55 years old and in a common law marriage with Sr. Adalid Araujo. They have one dependent child. She has been sewing for 30 years. Sra. Catalina produces dresses and skirts, and also does trouser alterations. She needs a loan to buy fabric for her business and toys to sell for the Christmas season.

Gloria Emerita R. is 66 years old, single, and lives by herself. She does not have any dependents since her only daughter lives in Costa Rica. She sells perfumes, crèmes, cleaning supplies, and plates. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these products for the Christmas season, since this is a good time for sales.

Sr. Oscar Elvin M. is 29 years old and single. He sells fish and pigs. The pigs are butchered before being sold. He has been in this business for 6 years and sells his products within the different neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. Oscar is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Eleni

texts.en:
Eleni E. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Auala. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleni owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Eleni has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Eleni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Eleni is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Eleni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Faataumamate

texts.en:
Faataumamate is 30 and married with 2 children ((ages 8 months and 1 yr).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumber.    Faataumamate needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faataumamate joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faataumamate's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Faataumamate's Overall Social Metric Score*:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Futuro se conformo cuando María Salvadora M. y Mirvania del Carmen M. necesitaban financiamiento para mejorar sus negocios pero muchas puertas se le cerraron es entonces que llegaron Adim y decidieron formar un grupo.  Luego se integraron  a ellas Cecilia Castro  y Martha Elena G. desde entonces ya llevan 14 ciclos en los cuales sus negocios han ido creciendo 

María Salvadora M. de 44 años hace tortilla, nacatamales y sopa de mondongo, Cecilia Castro R. tiene un negocio de  destace de cerdo y venta de ropa, Martha Elena Gonzales de 50 años vende cosméticos  y Milvannia tiene una venta.

Ellas esperan que este nuevo año les vaya bien con su negocio, tener salud y fuerzas para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The El Futuro group was formed when María Salvadora M. and Mervannia del Carmen M. needed a loan to improve their businesses. Unfortunately, many lenders closed the door on them, so they contacted Adim and decided to form a group. Cecilia Castro and Martha Elena G. soon joined them, and their businesses have been growing ever since. María is 44 years old. She makes tortillas, nacatamales and mondongo (tripe) soup. Cecilia butchers pigs and sells clothing. Martha is 50 years old, and she sells cosmetics. Mervannia has a shop. The group hopes that the New Year will bring success in business, good health and the strength to be determined.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for tortillas, nactamales and soup

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice, sugar, and gallons of cooking oil

loans.name: Sofía De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Sofía de Jesús G. C. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de dos años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo se le otorgo el crédito para la compra útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que no contabá con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia
Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica. 

Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hijos y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños es darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada . Sofía es una madre soltera y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar y vive con sus padres a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando lo necesitan.
 
Este es el primer crédito que Sofía tiene con ceprodel
y espera no quedarlos mal y expresa que estará agradecida y desea seguir trabajado y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofía de Jesús G. C. is originally from the Department of Estelí and has been working for the Catholic University School of Tropical Agriculture (UCATSE) as a janitor for two years. Her employment history qualified her for a loan to buy school supplies for her children since she does not have enough money and is in urgent need. Prior to her current job, she held other positions including that of a housekeeper.

Sofía claims the loan will be of great help in resolving her children’s problems and will fulfill her dream of providing them with an education. She tries to contribute wherever possible so that they lack nothing. Sofía is a single mother and has two school-age children. She lives with her parents, who also provide their support when needed.

This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and Sofía expresses her appreciation. She hopes to remain well and continue working so that she can improve the living standards for herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: Ganhulug

texts.en:
Ganhulug is 26 years old. He and his wife and their three children live in an apartment of their own in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Ganhulug's wife helps him run his business.

In 1994-1996, Ganhulug attended a training course on the manufacture of wooden products. After he finished the training, he worked in his brother-in-law's carpentry shop but, since 2000, he has worked independently and has been operating his own carpentry business.

Originally Ganhulug had a working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (approximately 70 USD), but after a lot of hard work his working capital currently exceeds 1,290,000 tugrugs (approximately 900 USD). He usually sells his wooden furniture in Umnogovi province, Mongolia, which is approximately 650 km from his own home province.

Ganhulug is a very open and hardworking person. He says, “I would like to create my own workshop and to purchase a new truck with my business profits in order to decrease the expense of transportation.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of material needed to manufacture wooden products for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of material needed to manufacture wooden products

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.en:
S. Kamolidin has owned a convenience store for three years. With this business, he is able to care for his wife and their three children who are still in kindergarten. The market is called “Dehkon”, is situated in a good location and services a good amount of clientele. Kamolidin continues to work to increase his number of customers. His business is becoming popular in the neighborhood, and through good references and personal relationships, the word is spreading about the great quality of his store. With a loan, Kamolidin will continue to help the business grow by improving the facilities, and buying a greater variety of goods to sell in his store.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low- income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Elpenida's Group

texts.en:
Elpenida P. is from the town of Ramos East, San Isidro. She is 33 years old. Elpenida is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elpenida P.'s Group.

Elpenida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elpenida owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Elpenida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elpenida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpenida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elpenida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two children. He lives with his family in Chtoura, in the Bekaa. He works as a home and furniture painter on a freelance basis, taking jobs at the request of his clients. He works hard to meet the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family.
This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He hopes that his loan will allow him to purchase new and better painting tools to improve his work. He plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation, in the future.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Bano lives in the city of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. She is 53 years old, Muslim and has studied till matriculation. She is a widow; without her husband, it has been very difficult for her to live but she has never given up and keeps involving herself in a small business selling garments.

She has an obedient 16-year-old daughter who is the only source of her motivation. She focuses on giving her a good career and for this reason, she works hard to generate income. 

She not only sells garments but also provides the facility of sewing to her clients. From these two businesses, she earns approximately Pak Rs. 10,000 which allows her to manage the education expenses of her daughter and to run the financial circle.

She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to purchase an electric sewing machine which will help her to sew more clothes because the manual machine takes her double the time and makes her tired quickly.

She has a dream to give her daughter the chance to gain higher education and to see her become a teacher of a renowned college.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Chourn S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells clothes for an income of about $12 per day. Her husband is employed at a non-government organization, earning an income of  $2.30 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more clothes for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

S. and her husband appear in the photograph at CREDIT's office.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Kha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who are villagers in Ta Khon village in Takeo province. Mrs. Navy K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for their different purpose.

Mrs. Navy K. owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money from selling groceries. She is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local public school. Her husband, Mr. Saret Sau, is a teacher.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they earn less income than needed to support their family. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Navy K. is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig and piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig and piglets

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and sells foodstuffs and provisions at Abura. She has six dependents. She has no educational background. Aba responsibly helps her husband in taking care of the entire family. She will use the loan she anticipates to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Aba plans to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Shahlar

texts.ru:
Shahlaru 29 let . On jivet v Absheron regione . Shahlar jenat i imeyet 3 detey kotorim 5,7 i 10 let .On uje 5 let zanimayetsya etim biznesom . On xochet uludshit biznes i uvelichit svoy daxod chtobi on moq obespechit xoroshuyu jizn svoim detam i chtob eqo deti imeli vozmojnost dlya xoroshey uchebi. 

Seychas Shahlar nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit mnoqo novix tkaney rulonami dlya pereprodaji i uludsheniye eqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Shahlar is 29 years old. He lives in the Absheron Region. He is married and has three children: five, seven and ten years of age. He has been in this business for five years. He would like to enhance his business and increase his income in order to be able to improve the life conditions of his children and provide them with good education. At present Shahlar needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats to purchase many rolls of new fabrics for resale, which will allow him to enhance his business.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rolls of fabric for resale

loans.name: Médoune

texts.fr: Monsieur Médoune D. est à sa troisième demande de prêt. Il sollicitait un montant de 400 000 FCFA. C’est un grand commerçant et gère son propre magasin sis en face Hôpital Thiès. Il vend des matériels électroniques, des matelas et divers produits. Avec ce prêt, Monsieur D.  âgé de 32 ans veut renforcer son commerce en achetant beaucoup de produits.
texts.en:
M. Médoune D. is asking for his third loan, in the amount of CFA 400,000. He has his own store across from the hospital in Thiès, selling electronics, mattresses and other goods. With this loan he plans to grow his business, increasing his inventory greatly.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build inventory of a variety of products
